passages.moralLesson: The dedication of early scholars in pursuing knowledge set an exemplary standard. True mastery requires complete commitment and continuous effort.
passages.moralLessonAr: تفاني العلماء الأوائل في طلب العلم وضع معيارا مثاليا. الإتقان الحقيقي يتطلب التزاما كاملا وجهدا مستمرا.

passages.title: The Night Journey and Ascension
passages.text: فِي لَيْلَةٍ مُبَارَكَةٍ قَبْلَ الْهِجْرَةِ بِعَامٍ، أُسْرِيَ بِالنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ الْأَقْصَى. جَاءَهُ جِبْرِيلُ عَلَيْهِ السَّلَامُ بِالْبُرَاقِ، دَابَّةٍ بَيْضَاءَ فَوْقَ الْحِمَارِ وَدُونَ الْبَغْلِ. طَارَ بِهِ فِي لَحَظَاتٍ إِلَى بَيْتِ الْمَقْدِسِ. صَلَّى بِالْأَنْبِيَاءِ إِمَامًا فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْأَقْصَى، فَتَحَقَّقَ مَعْنَى خَاتَمِ النُّبُوَّةِ وَإِمَامَةِ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ. ثُمَّ عَرَجَ بِهِ إِلَى السَّمَاوَاتِ الْعُلَى. فِي كُلِّ سَمَاءٍ لَقِيَ نَبِيًّا: آدَمَ فِي الْأُولَى، وَيَحْيَى وَعِيسَى فِي الثَّانِيَةِ، وَيُوسُفَ فِي الثَّالِثَةِ، وَإِدْرِيسَ فِي الرَّابِعَةِ، وَهَارُونَ فِي الْخَامِسَةِ، وَمُوسَى فِي السَّادِسَةِ، وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ فِي السَّابِعَةِ. ثُمَّ رُفِعَ إِلَى سِدْرَةِ الْمُنْتَهَى حَيْثُ لَا يَتَجَاوَزُهَا مَلَكٌ مُقَرَّبٌ وَلَا نَبِيٌّ مُرْسَلٌ. رَأَى مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَى. فَرَضَ اللهُ عَلَيْهِ الصَّلَوَاتِ الْخَمْسَ فِي تِلْكَ اللَّيْلَةِ. كَانَتْ خَمْسِينَ ثُمَّ خُفِّفَتْ إِلَى خَمْسٍ، وَهِيَ خَمْسٌ فِي الْعَمَلِ وَخَمْسُونَ فِي الْأَجْرِ. عَادَ النَّبِيُّ إِلَى مَكَّةَ فِي نَفْسِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَفِرَاشُهُ لَمْ يَبْرُدْ بَعْدُ. أَخْبَرَ قُرَيْشًا فَكَذَّبَهُ أَكْثَرُهُمْ. أَمَّا أَبُو بَكْرٍ فَقَالَ: إِنْ كَانَ قَالَ فَقَدْ صَدَقَ. فَسُمِّيَ الصِّدِّيقَ.
passages.translation: In a blessed night one year before the Hijrah, the Prophet (peace be upon him) was taken on the Night Journey from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque. Gabriel (peace be upon him) came to him with al-Buraq, a white mount above a donkey and below a mule. It flew with him in moments to Jerusalem. He led the prophets in prayer in Al-Aqsa Mosque, fulfilling the meaning of the Seal of Prophethood and leadership of the prophets. Then he ascended with him to the highest heavens. In each heaven he met a prophet: Adam in the first, Yahya and Isa in the second, Yusuf in the third, Idris in the fourth, Harun in the fifth, Musa in the sixth, and Ibrahim in the seventh. Then he was raised to the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary where no angel brought near nor prophet sent can pass. He saw the greatest signs of his Lord. Allah made the five prayers obligatory upon him that night. They were fifty then reduced to five, and they are five in action and fifty in reward. The Prophet returned to Mecca that same night while his bed had not yet cooled. He informed Quraysh and most of them disbelieved him. As for Abu Bakr, he said: If he said it, then he spoke the truth. So he was named As-Siddiq (the Truthful).

vocabularyHighlights.meaning: was taken on a night journey
Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary

passages.moralLesson: The miraculous Night Journey demonstrates Allah's power and honored the Prophet. True faith accepts divine revelation even when beyond human comprehension.
passages.moralLessonAr: رحلة الإسراء المعجزة تظهر قدرة الله وكرمت النبي. الإيمان الحقيقي يقبل الوحي الإلهي حتى وإن كان يتجاوز الفهم البشري.

passages.title: The Virtue of Dhikr
passages.text: الذِّكْرُ غِذَاءُ الرُّوحِ وَحَيَاةُ الْقَلْبِ. بِهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ الْقُلُوبُ وَتَسْكُنُ النُّفُوسُ. قَالَ تَعَالَى: أَلَا بِذِكْرِ اللهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ الْقُلُوبُ. الذَّاكِرُونَ اللهَ كَثِيرًا وَالذَّاكِرَاتُ أَعَدَّ اللهُ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةً وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًا. لَيْسَ الذِّكْرُ مَقْصُورًا عَلَى حَرَكَةِ اللِّسَانِ، بَلْ هُوَ عَمَلُ الْقَلْبِ وَاللِّسَانِ وَالْجَوَارِحِ. الذِّكْرُ بِالْقَلْبِ هُوَ الِاسْتِحْضَارُ الدَّائِمُ لِعَظَمَةِ اللهِ وَمُرَاقَبَتِهِ. وَذِكْرُ اللِّسَانِ هُوَ التَّسْبِيحُ وَالتَّحْمِيدُ وَالتَّهْلِيلُ وَالتَّكْبِيرُ. وَذِكْرُ الْجَوَارِحِ هُوَ الطَّاعَةُ وَالْعَمَلُ الصَّالِحُ. قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: مَثَلُ الَّذِي يَذْكُرُ رَبَّهُ وَالَّذِي لَا يَذْكُرُ رَبَّهُ كَمَثَلِ الْحَيِّ وَالْمَيِّتِ. الذِّكْرُ يَطْرُدُ الشَّيْطَانَ وَيُقَرِّبُ الْعَبْدَ مِنْ رَبِّهِ. يَجْلِبُ السَّكِينَةَ وَالطُّمَأْنِينَةَ وَالْبَرَكَةَ. يُنَوِّرُ الْقَلْبَ وَيَشْرَحُ الصَّدْرَ. يُكَفِّرُ الذُّنُوبَ وَيَرْفَعُ الدَّرَجَاتِ. أَفْضَلُ الذِّكْرِ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللهُ. مَنْ قَالَهَا مِئَةَ مَرَّةٍ كَانَتْ لَهُ عَدْلَ عَشْرِ رِقَابٍ، وَكُتِبَتْ لَهُ مِئَةُ حَسَنَةٍ، وَمُحِيَتْ عَنْهُ مِئَةُ سَيِّئَةٍ، وَكَانَتْ لَهُ حِرْزًا مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ يَوْمَهُ ذَلِكَ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ.
passages.translation: Dhikr (remembrance) is the nourishment of the soul and the life of the heart. Through it, hearts find tranquility and souls find peace. Allah the Most High said: Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured. Those who remember Allah much, men and women, Allah has prepared for them forgiveness and a great reward. Dhikr is not limited to the movement of the tongue; rather, it is the action of the heart, tongue, and limbs. Dhikr with the heart is constant awareness of Allah's greatness and His watchfulness. Dhikr of the tongue is glorification, praise, tahlil, and takbir. Dhikr of the limbs is obedience and righteous action. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: The example of one who remembers his Lord and one who does not remember his Lord is like that of the living and the dead. Dhikr repels Satan and brings the servant near to his Lord. It brings tranquility, peace, and blessing. It illuminates the heart and opens the chest. It expiates sins and raises ranks. The best dhikr is "There is no deity except Allah." Whoever says it one hundred times, it will be equivalent to freeing ten slaves, one hundred good deeds will be written for him, one hundred bad deeds will be erased from him, and it will be a protection for him from Satan that day until evening.
passages.moralLesson: Constant remembrance of Allah nourishes the soul and brings spiritual vitality. It is a comprehensive practice involving heart, tongue, and actions.
passages.moralLessonAr: الذكر المستمر لله يغذي الروح ويجلب الحيوية الروحية. إنها ممارسة شاملة تشمل القلب واللسان والأعمال.

passages.title: The Rights of Neighbors
passages.text: أَوْصَى الْإِسْلَامُ بِالْجَارِ وَصِيَّةً عَظِيمَةً حَتَّى ظَنَّ بَعْضُ الصَّحَابَةِ أَنَّهُ سَيُوَرَّثُ. قَالَ تَعَالَى: وَاعْبُدُوا اللهَ وَلَا تُشْرِكُوا بِهِ شَيْئًا وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا وَبِذِي الْقُرْبَى وَالْيَتَامَى وَالْمَسَاكِينِ وَالْجَارِ ذِي الْقُرْبَى وَالْجَارِ الْجُنُبِ. قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: مَا زَالَ جِبْرِيلُ يُوصِينِي بِالْجَارِ حَتَّى ظَنَنْتُ أَنَّهُ سَيُوَرِّثُهُ. وَقَالَ: وَاللهِ لَا يُؤْمِنُ، وَاللهِ لَا يُؤْمِنُ، وَاللهِ لَا يُؤْمِنُ. قِيلَ: مَنْ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ؟ قَالَ: الَّذِي لَا يَأْمَنُ جَارُهُ بَوَائِقَهُ. الْجَارُ لَهُ حُقُوقٌ كَثِيرَةٌ: أَنْ تَكُفَّ الْأَذَى عَنْهُ، وَأَنْ تَحْتَمِلَ الْأَذَى مِنْهُ، وَأَنْ تُسَلِّمَ عَلَيْهِ وَتَتَفَقَّدَهُ، وَأَنْ تُعِينَهُ إِذَا اسْتَعَانَ بِكَ، وَأَنْ تُقْرِضَهُ إِذَا اسْتَقْرَضَكَ، وَأَنْ تَعُودَهُ إِذَا مَرِضَ، وَأَنْ تُعَزِّيَهُ إِذَا أُصِيبَ، وَأَنْ تُهَنِّئَهُ إِذَا فَرِحَ، وَأَنْ تَسْتُرَ عَوْرَتَهُ، وَأَنْ لَا تَرْفَعَ بِنَاءَكَ فَوْقَ بِنَائِهِ فَتَسُدَّ عَلَيْهِ الرِّيحَ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ. خَيْرُ الْجِيرَانِ عِنْدَ اللهِ خَيْرُهُمْ لِجَارِهِ. حُسْنُ الْجِوَارِ يَزِيدُ فِي الْعُمُرِ وَيَعْمُرُ الدِّيَارَ.
passages.translation: Islam enjoined great care for the neighbor to the extent that some Companions thought he would be made an heir. Allah the Most High said: Worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, and to parents do good, and to relatives and orphans and the needy and the near neighbor and the neighbor farther away. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: Gabriel continued to advise me about the neighbor until I thought he would make him an heir. And he said: By Allah, he does not believe; by Allah, he does not believe; by Allah, he does not believe. It was asked: Who, O Messenger of Allah? He said: He whose neighbor is not safe from his harm. The neighbor has many rights: that you withhold harm from him, that you bear harm from him, that you greet him and check on him, that you help him if he seeks your help, that you lend to him if he asks to borrow from you, that you visit him if he is sick, that you console him if he is afflicted, that you congratulate him if he is happy, that you conceal his faults, and that you not raise your building above his and block the wind from him except with his permission. The best of neighbors with Allah is the best of them to his neighbor. Good neighborliness increases one's lifespan and populates homes.
passages.moralLesson: Neighborly rights are extensive in Islam, reflecting the religion's emphasis on community harmony. Good treatment of neighbors brings blessings and longevity.
passages.moralLessonAr: حقوق الجيران واسعة في الإسلام، مما يعكس تركيز الدين على انسجام المجتمع. المعاملة الحسنة للجيران تجلب البركات وطول العمر.

passages.title: The Battle of Uhud
passages.text: بَعْدَ هَزِيمَتِهِمْ فِي بَدْرٍ، أَعَدَّتْ قُرَيْشٌ جَيْشًا ضَخْمًا قِوَامُهُ ثَلَاثَةُ آلَافٍ مُقَاتِلٍ لِلثَّأْرِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ. خَرَجَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ بِأَلْفِ مُقَاتِلٍ، انْسَحَبَ مِنْهُمْ عَبْدُ اللهِ بْنُ أُبَيٍّ رَأْسُ الْمُنَافِقِينَ بِثُلُثِ الْجَيْشِ. وَضَعَ النَّبِيُّ خَمْسِينَ رَامِيًا عَلَى جَبَلِ الرُّمَاةِ بِقِيَادَةِ عَبْدِ اللهِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ، وَأَمَرَهُمْ أَلَّا يَتْرُكُوا مَوَاقِعَهُمْ مَهْمَا حَدَثَ. بَدَأَ الْقِتَالُ وَانْتَصَرَ الْمُسْلِمُونَ فِي أَوَّلِهِ. رَأَى الرُّمَاةُ الْغَنَائِمَ فَتَرَكُوا مَوَاقِعَهُمْ مُخَالِفِينَ أَمْرَ النَّبِيِّ. اسْتَغَلَّ خَالِدُ بْنُ الْوَلِيدِ -وَكَانَ لَمْ يُسْلِمْ بَعْدُ- هَذَا الْخَطَأَ، فَالْتَفَّ بِفُرْسَانِهِ حَوْلَ الْجَبَلِ وَهَاجَمَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ مِنَ الْخَلْفِ. انْقَلَبَ النَّصْرُ إِلَى هَزِيمَةٍ. أُشِيعَ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ قُتِلَ فَاضْطَرَبَ الْمُسْلِمُونَ. جُرِحَ النَّبِيُّ وَكُسِرَتْ رَبَاعِيَّتُهُ وَشُجَّ رَأْسُهُ. اسْتُشْهِدَ سَبْعُونَ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ مِنْهُمْ حَمْزَةُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْمُطَّلِبِ أَسَدُ اللهِ. دَفَنَ النَّبِيُّ الشُّهَدَاءَ وَقَالَ: زَمِّلُوهُمْ بِدِمَائِهِمْ وَثِيَابِهِمْ. نَزَلَ فِي أُحُدٍ قَوْلُهُ تَعَالَى: أَوَلَمَّا أَصَابَتْكُمْ مُصِيبَةٌ قَدْ أَصَبْتُمْ مِثْلَيْهَا قُلْتُمْ أَنَّى هَذَا قُلْ هُوَ مِنْ عِنْدِ أَنْفُسِكُمْ. عَلَّمَتِ الْهَزِيمَةُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ أَنَّ النَّصْرَ مِنْ عِنْدِ اللهِ وَأَنَّ مُخَالَفَةَ أَوَامِرِ النَّبِيِّ تُؤَدِّي إِلَى الْخَسَارَةِ.
passages.translation: After their defeat at Badr, Quraysh prepared a massive army of three thousand fighters to take revenge on the Muslims. The Prophet (peace be upon him) set out with a thousand fighters; Abdullah ibn Ubayy, the leader of the hypocrites, withdrew with a third of the army. The Prophet placed fifty archers on the Mountain of Archers under the command of Abdullah ibn Jubayr, ordering them not to leave their positions no matter what happened. The battle began and the Muslims were victorious at first. The archers saw the spoils and left their positions, disobeying the Prophet's command. Khalid ibn al-Walid - who had not yet embraced Islam - exploited this error and circled the mountain with his horsemen, attacking the Muslims from behind. Victory turned to defeat. It was rumored that the Prophet was killed and the Muslims became disturbed. The Prophet was wounded, his tooth was broken, and his head was gashed. Seventy Muslims were martyred, including Hamza ibn Abdul Muttalib, the Lion of Allah. The Prophet buried the martyrs and said: Wrap them in their blood and their garments. Regarding Uhud, Allah the Most High revealed: Why, when a disaster struck you - although you had struck twice its like - did you say, "From where is this?" Say, "It is from yourselves." The defeat taught the Muslims that victory is from Allah and that disobeying the Prophet's commands leads to loss.
passages.moralLesson: Obedience to divine guidance and leadership is essential for success. The Battle of Uhud taught Muslims that disobedience leads to defeat even when initial victory seems assured.
passages.moralLessonAr: الطاعة للتوجيه الإلهي والقيادة أمر أساسي للنجاح. علمت غزوة أحد المسلمين أن العصيان يؤدي إلى الهزيمة حتى عندما يبدو النصر الأولي مؤكدا.

passages.title: The Wisdom of the Quran
passages.text: الْقُرْآنُ الْكَرِيمُ مُعْجِزَةُ الْإِسْلَامِ الْخَالِدَةُ وَدُسْتُورُهُ الْمُحْكَمُ. أَنْزَلَهُ اللهُ تَعَالَى بِحِكْمَةٍ بَالِغَةٍ لِهِدَايَةِ الْبَشَرِيَّةِ جَمْعَاءَ. فِيهِ حِكَمٌ تَشْرِيعِيَّةٌ تُنَظِّمُ حَيَاةَ الْفَرْدِ وَالْمُجْتَمَعِ. وَحِكَمٌ أَخْلَاقِيَّةٌ تُهَذِّبُ النُّفُوسَ وَتُزَكِّي الْقُلُوبَ. وَحِكَمٌ رُوحَانِيَّةٌ تَرْبِطُ الْعَبْدَ بِرَبِّهِ. وَحِكَمٌ عِلْمِيَّةٌ سَبَقَ بِهَا الْقُرْآنُ الْعُلُومَ الْحَدِيثَةَ بِقُرُونٍ. أُسْلُوبُهُ الْبَلَاغِيُّ مُعْجِزٌ لَا يُدَانَى. تَحَدَّى اللهُ الْعَرَبَ -وَهُمْ أَهْلُ الْفَصَاحَةِ- أَنْ يَأْتُوا بِمِثْلِهِ فَعَجَزُوا. ثُمَّ تَحَدَّاهُمْ بِعَشْرِ سُوَرٍ فَعَجَزُوا. ثُمَّ بِسُورَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَعَجَزُوا. الْقُرْآنُ يُخَاطِبُ الْعَقْلَ وَالْقَلْبَ مَعًا. يَحْتَوِي عَلَى قَصَصِ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ وَالْأُمَمِ السَّابِقَةِ لِلْعِظَةِ وَالْاعْتِبَارِ. يُبَيِّنُ سُنَنَ اللهِ فِي الْكَوْنِ وَالْمُجْتَمَعِ. يُرْشِدُ إِلَى الطَّرِيقِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ فِي الْعَقِيدَةِ وَالشَّرِيعَةِ وَالْأَخْلَاقِ. كُلُّ آيَةٍ فِيهِ لَهَا ظَاهِرٌ وَبَاطِنٌ، وَحَدٌّ وَمُطَّلَعٌ. لَا تَنْقَضِي عَجَائِبُهُ وَلَا تَفْنَى غَرَائِبُهُ. هُوَ حَبْلُ اللهِ الْمَتِينُ وَالذِّكْرُ الْحَكِيمُ وَالصِّرَاطُ الْمُسْتَقِيمُ. مَنْ قَالَ بِهِ صَدَقَ، وَمَنْ عَمِلَ بِهِ أُجِرَ، وَمَنْ حَكَمَ بِهِ عَدَلَ، وَمَنْ دَعَا إِلَيْهِ هُدِيَ إِلَى صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ.
passages.translation: The Noble Quran is the eternal miracle of Islam and its perfect constitution. Allah the Most High revealed it with profound wisdom to guide all of humanity. In it are legislative wisdoms that organize the life of the individual and society, moral wisdoms that refine souls and purify hearts, spiritual wisdoms that connect the servant to his Lord, and scientific wisdoms with which the Quran preceded modern sciences by centuries. Its rhetorical style is miraculous and unmatched. Allah challenged the Arabs - who were masters of eloquence - to produce its like and they failed. Then He challenged them with ten chapters and they failed. Then with one chapter and they failed. The Quran addresses the mind and the heart together. It contains stories of the prophets and previous nations for admonition and taking lessons. It clarifies Allah's ways in the universe and society. It guides to the straight path in creed, law, and ethics. Every verse in it has an apparent and a hidden meaning, a limit and an ascent. Its wonders do not cease and its marvels do not perish. It is Allah's strong rope, the Wise Reminder, and the Straight Path. Whoever speaks by it speaks truth, whoever acts by it is rewarded, whoever judges by it is just, and whoever calls to it is guided to a straight path.
passages.moralLesson: The Quran is a comprehensive guide containing eternal wisdom for all aspects of life. Its miraculous nature and guidance remain relevant for all times and places.
passages.moralLessonAr: القرآن دليل شامل يحتوي على حكمة أبدية لجميع جوانب الحياة. طبيعته المعجزة وإرشاده يبقيان ذوي صلة لجميع الأزمنة والأماكن.

passages.title: The Farewell Sermon
passages.text: فِي السَّنَةِ الْعَاشِرَةِ مِنَ الْهِجْرَةِ، حَجَّ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ حَجَّةَ الْوَدَاعِ. اجْتَمَعَ مَعَهُ أَكْثَرُ مِنْ مِئَةِ أَلْفِ مُسْلِمٍ. وَقَفَ يَوْمَ عَرَفَةَ عَلَى جَبَلِ الرَّحْمَةِ وَأَلْقَى خُطْبَةً جَامِعَةً خَالِدَةً. أَكَّدَ فِيهَا عَلَى حُرْمَةِ الدِّمَاءِ وَالْأَمْوَالِ وَالْأَعْرَاضِ. قَالَ: إِنَّ دِمَاءَكُمْ وَأَمْوَالَكُمْ وَأَعْرَاضَكُمْ عَلَيْكُمْ حَرَامٌ كَحُرْمَةِ يَوْمِكُمْ هَذَا فِي شَهْرِكُمْ هَذَا فِي بَلَدِكُمْ هَذَا. أَبْطَلَ عَادَاتِ الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ وَالرِّبَا وَالثَّأْرَ. أَعْلَنَ الْمُسَاوَاةَ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ: لَا فَضْلَ لِعَرَبِيٍّ عَلَى أَعْجَمِيٍّ وَلَا لِأَبْيَضَ عَلَى أَسْوَدَ إِلَّا بِالتَّقْوَى. أَوْصَى بِالنِّسَاءِ خَيْرًا: اتَّقُوا اللهَ فِي النِّسَاءِ فَإِنَّكُمْ أَخَذْتُمُوهُنَّ بِأَمَانَةِ اللهِ. أَمَرَ بِالِاعْتِصَامِ بِالْقُرْآنِ وَالسُّنَّةِ: تَرَكْتُ فِيكُمْ مَا إِنْ تَمَسَّكْتُمْ بِهِ لَنْ تَضِلُّوا: كِتَابَ اللهِ وَسُنَّتِي. ثُمَّ قَالَ: أَلَا هَلْ بَلَّغْتُ؟ فَقَالُوا: نَعَمْ. قَالَ: اللَّهُمَّ فَاشْهَدْ. نَزَلَ قَوْلُهُ تَعَالَى: الْيَوْمَ أَكْمَلْتُ لَكُمْ دِينَكُمْ وَأَتْمَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعْمَتِي وَرَضِيتُ لَكُمُ الْإِسْلَامَ دِينًا. كَانَتِ الْخُطْبَةُ دُسْتُورًا لِحُقُوقِ الْإِنْسَانِ سَبَقَتْ كُلَّ الْمَوَاثِيقِ الدَّوْلِيَّةِ بِأَرْبَعَةَ عَشَرَ قَرْنًا.
passages.translation: In the tenth year of Hijrah, the Prophet (peace be upon him) performed the Farewell Pilgrimage. More than one hundred thousand Muslims gathered with him. He stood on the Day of Arafah on the Mount of Mercy and delivered a comprehensive eternal sermon. He emphasized the sanctity of blood, wealth, and honor. He said: Indeed, your blood, your wealth, and your honor are sacred to you like the sanctity of this day of yours, in this month of yours, in this land of yours. He abolished the customs of ignorance, usury, and revenge. He declared equality among people: No Arab has superiority over a non-Arab, nor does a white have superiority over a black, except in piety. He advised treating women well: Fear Allah concerning women, for you have taken them with the trust of Allah. He commanded adherence to the Quran and Sunnah: I have left among you that which if you hold fast to it, you will never go astray: the Book of Allah and my Sunnah. Then he said: Have I conveyed [the message]? They said: Yes. He said: O Allah, bear witness. Allah the Most High revealed: Today I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. The sermon was a constitution for human rights that preceded all international charters by fourteen centuries.
grammaticalConcepts: Form IV verb (ألقى، أبطل، أعلن، أكمل، أتمم)
passages.moralLesson: The Farewell Sermon established timeless principles of human rights, equality, and justice that remain revolutionary and relevant today.
passages.moralLessonAr: خطبة الوداع أرست مبادئ خالدة لحقوق الإنسان والمساواة والعدالة التي تبقى ثورية وذات صلة اليوم.

passages.title: Contemplation of Creation
passages.text: التَّفَكُّرُ فِي خَلْقِ اللهِ عِبَادَةٌ عَظِيمَةٌ غَفَلَ عَنْهَا كَثِيرٌ مِنَ النَّاسِ. قَالَ تَعَالَى: إِنَّ فِي خَلْقِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَاخْتِلَافِ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ لَآيَاتٍ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ. الَّذِينَ يَذْكُرُونَ اللهَ قِيَامًا وَقُعُودًا وَعَلَى جُنُوبِهِمْ وَيَتَفَكَّرُونَ فِي خَلْقِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ. انْظُرْ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ بِلَا عَمَدٍ. وَإِلَى الشَّمْسِ وَالْقَمَرِ كَيْفَ يَجْرِيَانِ فِي فَلَكٍ بِحِسَابٍ دَقِيقٍ. وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ وَمُدَّتْ وَأُلْقِيَ فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ. وَإِلَى الْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ. وَإِلَى الْبِحَارِ كَيْفَ مُلِئَتْ وَكَيْفَ لَا تَخْتَلِطُ الْعَذْبَةُ بِالْمَالِحَةِ. وَإِلَى الْإِنْسَانِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ صَارَ بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا يَسْمَعُ وَيُبْصِرُ وَيَتَكَلَّمُ. وَإِلَى الْحَيَوَانَاتِ وَالطُّيُورِ بِتَنَوُّعِهَا الْعَجِيبِ. كُلُّ ذَلِكَ يَدُلُّ عَلَى عَظَمَةِ الْخَالِقِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ وَحِكْمَتِهِ. التَّفَكُّرُ سَاعَةً خَيْرٌ مِنْ قِيَامِ لَيْلَةٍ. يَزِيدُ الْإِيمَانَ وَيُقَوِّي الْيَقِينَ وَيُرَقِّقُ الْقَلْبَ. الْغَافِلُ عَنِ التَّفَكُّرِ كَالْأَنْعَامِ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا.
passages.translation: Contemplation of Allah's creation is a great act of worship that many people have neglected. Allah the Most High said: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of night and day are signs for people of understanding, who remember Allah standing, sitting, and lying on their sides and contemplate the creation of the heavens and the earth. Look at the sky how it was raised without pillars. And at the sun and moon how they run in an orbit with precise calculation. And at the earth how it was spread out and extended and anchors were cast in it. And at the mountains how they were erected. And at the seas how they were filled and how fresh water does not mix with salt water. And at the human how he was created from a drop then became a complete person who hears, sees, and speaks. And at the animals and birds in their amazing diversity. All of this indicates the greatness of the Creator and His power and wisdom. Contemplation for an hour is better than standing in prayer for a night. It increases faith, strengthens certainty, and softens the heart. He who is heedless of contemplation is like cattle; rather, they are more astray in way.
passages.moralLesson: Reflecting on creation reveals Allah's greatness and increases faith. Neglecting contemplation leaves one spiritually blind and misguided.
passages.moralLessonAr: التأمل في الخلق يكشف عظمة الله ويزيد الإيمان. إهمال التفكر يترك المرء أعمى روحيا وضالا.

passages.title: The Opening of Mecca
passages.text: فِي السَّنَةِ الثَّامِنَةِ مِنَ الْهِجْرَةِ، نَقَضَتْ قُرَيْشٌ صُلْحَ الْحُدَيْبِيَةِ بِمُعَاوَنَتِهَا حُلَفَاءَهَا بَنِي بَكْرٍ ضِدَّ خُزَاعَةَ حُلَفَاءِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ. جَهَّزَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ جَيْشًا قِوَامُهُ عَشَرَةُ آلَافِ مُقَاتِلٍ. دَخَلَ مَكَّةَ فَاتِحًا مُنَكِّسًا رَأْسَهُ تَوَاضُعًا للهِ. أَمَّنَ النَّاسَ قَائِلًا: مَنْ دَخَلَ الْمَسْجِدَ الْحَرَامَ فَهُوَ آمِنٌ، وَمَنْ دَخَلَ دَارَ أَبِي سُفْيَانَ فَهُوَ آمِنٌ، وَمَنْ أَغْلَقَ بَابَهُ فَهُوَ آمِنٌ. طَافَ بِالْكَعْبَةِ وَكَسَّرَ الْأَصْنَامَ حَوْلَهَا وَهُوَ يَقْرَأُ: جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ الْبَاطِلُ إِنَّ الْبَاطِلَ كَانَ زَهُوقًا. جَمَعَ قُرَيْشًا وَقَالَ: يَا مَعْشَرَ قُرَيْشٍ، مَا تَظُنُّونَ أَنِّي فَاعِلٌ بِكُمْ؟ قَالُوا: خَيْرًا، أَخٌ كَرِيمٌ وَابْنُ أَخٍ كَرِيمٍ. قَالَ: اذْهَبُوا فَأَنْتُمُ الطُّلَقَاءُ. عَفَا عَنْهُمْ رَغْمَ مَا فَعَلُوهُ بِهِ مِنْ إِيذَاءٍ وَتَعْذِيبٍ وَإِخْرَاجٍ. لَمْ يَنْتَقِمْ لِنَفْسِهِ قَطُّ. أَسْلَمَ النَّاسُ أَفْوَاجًا. كَانَ الْفَتْحُ نُقْطَةَ تَحَوُّلٍ فِي تَارِيخِ الْإِسْلَامِ. دَخَلَتِ الْجَزِيرَةُ الْعَرَبِيَّةُ كُلُّهَا فِي الْإِسْلَامِ. ضَرَبَ النَّبِيُّ أَرْوَعَ الْأَمْثِلَةِ فِي الْعَفْوِ عِنْدَ الْمَقْدِرَةِ وَالرَّحْمَةِ فِي النَّصْرِ.
passages.translation: In the eighth year of Hijrah, Quraysh broke the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah by aiding their allies Banu Bakr against Khuza'ah, the allies of the Muslims. The Prophet (peace be upon him) prepared an army of ten thousand fighters. He entered Mecca victoriously with his head bowed in humility to Allah. He granted people safety, saying: Whoever enters the Sacred Mosque is safe, whoever enters Abu Sufyan's house is safe, and whoever closes his door is safe. He circumambulated the Ka'bah and broke the idols around it while reciting: Truth has come and falsehood has departed. Indeed, falsehood is bound to depart. He gathered Quraysh and said: O assembly of Quraysh, what do you think I will do with you? They said: Good - a noble brother and son of a noble brother. He said: Go, for you are free. He pardoned them despite what they had done to him of harm, torture, and expulsion. He never took revenge for himself. People embraced Islam in crowds. The conquest was a turning point in the history of Islam. The entire Arabian Peninsula entered Islam. The Prophet set the most magnificent example of pardon when able and mercy in victory.
passages.moralLesson: The conquest of Mecca exemplified mercy and forgiveness in victory. The Prophet's pardon of his enemies demonstrates the highest form of character.
passages.moralLessonAr: فتح مكة جسد الرحمة والمغفرة في النصر. عفو النبي عن أعدائه يظهر أعلى شكل من الأخلاق.

passages.title: The Miracle of the Quran
passages.text: الْقُرْآنُ الْكَرِيمُ مُعْجِزَةٌ خَالِدَةٌ تَتَجَدَّدُ دَلَائِلُ إِعْجَازِهَا عَبْرَ الْعُصُورِ. الْإِعْجَازُ الْبَلَاغِيُّ: نَزَلَ الْقُرْآنُ فِي عَصْرِ الْفَصَاحَةِ وَالْبَيَانِ، فَتَحَ��َّى الْعَرَبَ بِأَنْ يَأْتُوا بِسُورَةٍ مِنْ مِثْلِهِ فَعَجَزُوا. جَمَعَ بَيْنَ أَرْفَعِ الْبَلَاغَةِ وَأَسْهَلِ الْأُسْلُوبِ. الْإِعْجَازُ الْعِلْمِيُّ: أَشَارَ إِلَى حَقَائِقَ عِلْمِيَّةٍ لَمْ تُكْتَشَفْ إِلَّا حَدِيثًا. قَالَ تَعَالَى: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ، مُشِيرًا إِلَى تَوَسُّعِ الْكَوْنِ. وَقَالَ: وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ حَيٍّ، مُؤَكِّدًا أَنَّ الْمَاءَ أَسَاسُ الْحَيَاةِ. الْإِعْجَازُ التَّشْرِيعِيُّ: شَرَّعَ قَوَانِينَ صَالِحَةً لِكُلِّ زَمَانٍ وَمَكَانٍ. حَفِظَ حُقُوقَ الْإِنْسَانِ وَنَظَّمَ الْعَلَاقَاتِ الْاجْتِمَاعِيَّةَ وَالْاقْتِصَادِيَّةَ. الْإِعْجَازُ الْغَيْبِيُّ: أَخْبَرَ عَنْ أُمُورٍ غَيْبِيَّةٍ وَقَعَتْ كَمَا أَخْبَرَ. قَالَ: غُلِبَتِ الرُّومُ فِي أَدْنَى الْأَرْضِ وَهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ غَلَبِهِمْ سَيَغْلِبُونَ فِي بِضْعِ سِنِينَ، فَوَقَعَ كَمَا أَخْبَرَ. الْإِعْجَازُ النَّفْسِيُّ: يُؤَثِّرُ فِي النُّفُوسِ تَأْثِيرًا عَجِيبًا. يُلَيِّنُ الْقُلُوبَ الْقَاسِيَةَ وَيَهْدِي الضَّالِّينَ. كَمْ مِنْ كَافِرٍ أَسْلَمَ بِسَمَاعِ آيَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ. وَأَعْظَمُ الْمُعْجِزَاتِ أَنَّهُ مَحْفُوظٌ مِنَ التَّحْرِيفِ: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ.
passages.translation: The Noble Quran is an eternal miracle whose signs of miraculousness renew through the ages. Rhetorical miracle: The Quran was revealed in the age of eloquence and expression, and challenged the Arabs to produce a chapter like it, and they failed. It combined the highest eloquence with the easiest style. Scientific miracle: It pointed to scientific facts not discovered until recently. Allah the Most High said: "And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are expanding [it]," indicating the expansion of the universe. And He said: "And We made from water every living thing," affirming that water is the basis of life. Legislative miracle: It legislated laws suitable for every time and place. It preserved human rights and organized social and economic relations. Unseen miracle: It informed about unseen matters that occurred as it informed. It said: "The Romans have been defeated in the nearest land. But they, after their defeat, will overcome within a few years," and it occurred as informed. Psychological miracle: It affects souls in a wondrous way. It softens hard hearts and guides the misguided. How many disbelievers embraced Islam upon hearing a single verse. And the greatest of miracles is that it is protected from distortion: "Indeed, it is We who sent down the Quran and indeed, We will be its guardian."
passages.moralLesson: The Quran's multifaceted miracle proves its divine origin. Its preservation, eloquence, scientific accuracy, and transformative power remain unmatched.
passages.moralLessonAr: معجزة القرآن المتعددة الجوانب تثبت أصله الإلهي. حفظه وبلاغته ودقته العلمية وقوته التحويلية تبقى بلا مثيل.

passages.title: The Companions' Sacrifice
passages.text: ضَرَبَ الصَّحَابَةُ رِضْوَانُ اللهِ عَلَيْهِمْ أَرْوَعَ الْأَمْثِلَةِ فِي التَّضْحِيَةِ وَالْفِدَاءِ. بِلَالٌ الْحَبَشِيُّ عُذِّبَ فِي رَمْضَاءِ مَكَّةَ وَوُضِعَتِ الصَّخْرَةُ الْعَظِيمَةُ عَلَى صَدْرِهِ لِيَكْفُرَ، فَمَا زَادَهُ ذَلِكَ إِلَّا إِيمَانًا يَقُولُ: أَحَدٌ أَحَدٌ. سُمَيَّةُ بِنْتُ خَيَّاطٍ، أَوَّلُ شَهِيدَةٍ فِي الْإِسْلَامِ، قُتِلَتْ بِيَدِ أَبِي جَهْلٍ لَمَّا رَفَضَتِ التَّخَلِّيَ عَنْ دِينِهَا. خَبَّابُ بْنُ الْأَرَتِّ أُحْمِيَتْ لَهُ الْحَدِيدَةُ وَوُضِعَتْ عَلَى ظَهْرِهِ حَتَّى ذَابَ شَحْمُ ظَهْرِهِ. عَمَّارُ بْنُ يَاسِرٍ عُذِّبَ هُوَ وَأَبُوهُ وَأُمُّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا. الْمُهَاجِرُونَ تَرَكُوا أَمْوَالَهُمْ وَدِيَارَهُمْ للهِ وَرَسُولِهِ. مُصْعَبُ بْنُ عُمَيْرٍ كَانَ أَنْعَمَ شَبَابِ مَكَّةَ، فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَ صَارَ يَلْبَسُ الْخُشَنَ وَيَأْكُلُ الْقَلِيلَ. اسْتُشْهِدَ يَوْمَ أُحُدٍ وَلَمْ يَجِدُوا لَهُ كَفَنًا يُوَارِيهِ كُلَّهُ. الْأَنْصَارُ قَاسَمُوا الْمُهَاجِرِينَ أَمْوَالَهُمْ وَبُيُوتَهُمْ، وَآثَرُوهُمْ عَلَى أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَلَوْ كَانَ بِهِمْ خَصَاصَةٌ. أَبُو بَكْرٍ أَنْفَقَ كُلَّ مَالِهِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللهِ. عُثْمَانُ جَهَّزَ جَيْشَ الْعُسْرَةِ بِمَالِهِ. عَلِيٌّ نَامَ فِي فِرَاشِ النَّبِيِّ لَيْلَةَ الْهِجْرَةِ مُعَرِّضًا نَفْسَهُ لِلْقَتْلِ. هَكَذَا كَانَتِ التَّضْحِيَةُ عِنْوَانَ ذَلِكَ الْجِيلِ الْفَرِيدِ.
passages.translation: The Companions (may Allah be pleased with them) set the most magnificent examples in sacrifice and devotion. Bilal al-Habashi was tortured in the scorching heat of Mecca and a great rock was placed on his chest to make him disbelieve, but this only increased his faith as he said: "Ahad, Ahad" (One, One). Sumayyah bint Khayyat, the first martyr in Islam, was killed by the hand of Abu Jahl when she refused to abandon her religion. Khabbab ibn al-Aratt had heated iron placed on his back until his back fat melted. Ammar ibn Yasir was severely tortured along with his father and mother. The Migrants left their wealth and homes for Allah and His Messenger. Musab ibn Umayr was the most pampered youth of Mecca, but when he embraced Islam, he wore coarse clothing and ate little. He was martyred on the day of Uhud and they could not find a shroud to cover all of him. The Ansar shared their wealth and homes with the Migrants, and preferred them over themselves even though they were in need. Abu Bakr spent all his wealth in the way of Allah. Uthman equipped the Army of Hardship with his wealth. Ali slept in the Prophet's bed on the night of migration, exposing himself to death. Thus was sacrifice the hallmark of that unique generation.
grammaticalConcepts: Past tense (ترك، كان، صار، أنفق، نام)
passages.moralLesson: The Companions' sacrifice exemplifies complete devotion to faith. Their willingness to endure any hardship for Islam sets an unparalleled standard.
passages.moralLessonAr: تضحية الصحابة تجسد التفاني الكامل للإيمان. استعدادهم لتحمل أي مشقة من أجل الإسلام يضع معيارا لا مثيل له.

passages.title: The Comprehensive Framework of Islamic Manners
passages.text: إِنَّ الْأَدَبَ فِي الْإِسْلَامِ مَنْظُومَةٌ مُتَكَامِلَةٌ تَشْمَلُ جَمِيعَ جَوَانِبِ الْحَيَاةِ الْإِنْسَانِيَّةِ، وَلَيْسَ مُجَرَّدَ قَوَاعِدَ لِلْآدَابِ الِاجْتِمَاعِيَّةِ. فَالْمُؤْمِنُ الَّذِي يَتَحَلَّى بِالْأَدَبِ يَرْعَى حُقُوقَ اللهِ تَعَالَى بِإِخْلَاصِ الْعِبَادَةِ وَتَعْظِيمِ الشَّعَائِرِ، وَيَرْعَى حُقُوقَ النَّفْسِ بِتَزْكِيَتِهَا وَتَهْذِيبِهَا عَنِ الرَّذَائِلِ وَتَحْلِيَتِهَا بِالْفَضَائِلِ، وَيَرْعَى حُقُوقَ الْخَلْقِ بِحُسْنِ الْمُعَامَلَةِ وَالْإِحْسَانِ إِلَى الْقَرِيبِ وَالْبَعِيدِ. قَالَ الْإِمَامُ الْغَزَالِيُّ رَحِمَهُ اللهُ: «الْأَدَبُ أَنْ تَعْرِفَ لِكُلِّ ذِي حَقٍّ حَقَّهُ، وَتُؤَدِّيَهُ إِلَيْهِ فِي وَقْتِهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَفْرِيطٍ وَلَا إِفْرَاطٍ». وَقَدْ جُمِعَتْ هَذِهِ الْآدَابُ فِي كُتُبِ السُّنَّةِ النَّبَوِيَّةِ، وَلَا سِيَّمَا فِي كِتَابِ رِيَاضِ الصَّالِحِينَ الَّذِي صَنَّفَهُ الْإِمَامُ النَّوَوِيُّ رَحِمَهُ اللهُ تَعَالَى. فَمَنِ الْتَزَمَ بِهَذِهِ الْآدَابِ فِي كُلِّ شُؤُونِهِ وَأَحْوَالِهِ، ظَهَرَ عَلَيْهِ نُورُ الْإِيمَانِ وَأَثَرُ الْيَقِينِ، وَاسْتَحَقَّ مَحَبَّةَ الرَّحْمَنِ وَرِضَاهُ. وَإِنَّ التَّخَلُّقَ بِالْأَدَبِ طَرِيقٌ مُوصِلٌ إِلَى الْكَمَالِ الْإِنْسَانِيِّ وَالْقُرْبِ مِنَ اللهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ، فَمَنْ تَأَدَّبَ بِأَدَبِ الشَّرِيعَةِ ارْتَفَعَتْ مَنْزِلَتُهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ.
passages.translation: Indeed, manners in Islam constitute an integrated system encompassing all aspects of human life, not merely rules for social etiquette. The believer who adorns himself with good manners observes the rights of Allah the Exalted through sincere worship and magnification of sacred rites, observes the rights of the self through purifying and refining it from vices and adorning it with virtues, and observes the rights of creation through excellent conduct and benevolence to those near and far. Imam al-Ghazali, may Allah have mercy on him, said: 'Good manners mean that you recognize the right of everyone who has a right, and fulfill it to them at its proper time without negligence or excess.' These manners have been compiled in the books of the Prophetic Sunnah, especially in the book Riyad al-Salihin which was compiled by Imam al-Nawawi, may Allah the Exalted have mercy on him. Whoever adheres to these manners in all his affairs and conditions, the light of faith and the mark of certainty become manifest upon him, and he deserves the love and pleasure of the Most Merciful. Indeed, embodying good manners is a path leading to human perfection and closeness to Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, for whoever is disciplined by the manners of the Sacred Law, his status is elevated in this world and the Hereafter.
grammaticalConcepts: إِنَّ and sisters for emphasis (إِنَّ الْأَدَبَ)
Relative clauses with الَّذِي (الْمُؤْمِنُ الَّذِي يَتَحَلَّى)
Classical quotation structure with direct speech
passages.moralLesson: Islamic manners are not merely social etiquette but a comprehensive framework that governs one's relationship with Allah, oneself, and all of creation. Adherence to these manners is the path to spiritual perfection and divine proximity.
passages.moralLessonAr: الآداب الإسلامية ليست مجرد آداب اجتماعية بل هي إطار شامل ينظم علاقة الإنسان مع الله ونفسه وجميع المخلوقات. الالتزام بهذه الآداب هو الطريق إلى الكمال الروحي والقرب الإلهي.

passages.title: The Two Jackals: Ambition and Caution
passages.text: فِي قَدِيمِ الزَّمَانِ، كَانَ ابْنَا آوَى صَدِيقَانِ: كَلِيلَةُ وَدِمْنَةُ. قَالَ دِمْنَةُ: لِمَاذَا نَقْنَعُ بِالْعَيْشِ فِي الْبَرِّيَّةِ بَعِيدًا عَنِ السُّلْطَانِ وَالْعِزِّ؟ يَنْبَغِي لِذِي الْعَقْلِ أَنْ يَطْلُبَ الْمَكَانَةَ عِنْدَ الْمُلُوكِ، لِأَنَّ مَنْ لَمْ يُخَاطِرْ لَمْ يَظْفَرْ بِمَا يَطْمَحُ إِلَيْهِ. فَأَجَابَهُ كَلِيلَةُ: إِنَّ الْقَنَاعَةَ كَنْزٌ لَا يَفْنَى، وَالطَّمَعَ بَابُ الذُّلِّ وَالْهَوَانِ. أَلَمْ تَسْمَعْ بِحِكَايَةِ الْقِرْدِ الَّذِي أَرَادَ أَنْ يُسَاعِدَ النَّجَّارَ فَكَانَتْ نِيَّتُهُ سَبَبَ هَلَاكِهِ؟ مَنِ اقْتَحَمَ مَا لَيْسَ مِنْ شَأْنِهِ عَرَّضَ نَفْسَهُ لِلْخَطَرِ. فَقَالَ دِمْنَةُ: الْجُبْنُ لَا يَحْفَظُ الْأَرْوَاحَ، بَلِ الْحِكْمَةُ وَالشَّجَاعَةُ. إِنَّ الْحَيَاةَ اخْتِيَارٌ بَيْنَ طَرِيقَيْنِ: طَرِيقُ الأَمَانِ مَعَ الْخُمُولِ، أَوْ طَرِيقُ الْمَجْدِ مَعَ الْمُخَاطَرَةِ. وَكُلٌّ يَخْتَارُ مَا يُنَاسِبُ طَبْعَهُ وَعَزْمَهُ.
passages.translation: In ancient times, there were two jackal friends: Kalila and Dimna. Dimna said: Why should we be content living in the wilderness far from authority and honor? The intelligent one should seek position with kings, because whoever does not take risks does not gain what he aspires to. Kalila answered him: Contentment is a treasure that never perishes, and greed is the door to humiliation and disgrace. Have you not heard the story of the monkey who wanted to help the carpenter and his intention became the cause of his destruction? Whoever ventures into what is not his business exposes himself to danger. Dimna said: Cowardice does not preserve lives; rather, wisdom and courage do. Life is a choice between two paths: the path of safety with obscurity, or the path of glory with risk. And each person chooses what suits his nature and determination.
grammaticalConcepts: Proverbial expressions (مَنْ لَمْ يُخَاطِرْ لَمْ يَظْفَرْ)
Parallelism and contrast (طَرِيقُ الأَمَانِ...أَوْ طَرِيقُ الْمَجْدِ)
passages.moralLesson: This parable presents two valid but opposing life philosophies without declaring one superior. Kalila represents the wisdom of contentment, safety, and knowing one's limits. Dimna embodies the spirit of ambition, courage, and striving for greatness. Both perspectives have merit, and the text invites the reader to reflect on which path aligns with their own nature. True wisdom may lie not in choosing one path universally, but in understanding oneself deeply enough to know which path is right for one's own character and circumstances.
passages.moralLessonAr: يعرض هذا المثل فلسفتين حياتيتين صحيحتين لكنهما متعارضتان دون إعلان تفوق إحداهما. يمثل كليلة حكمة القناعة والسلامة ومعرفة حدود المرء. بينما يجسد دمنة روح الطموح والشجاعة والسعي نحو العظمة. كلا المنظورين له ميزة، والنص يدعو القارئ للتأمل في أي طريق يتوافق مع طبيعته الخاصة. قد تكمن الحكمة الحقيقية ليس في اختيار طريق واحد عالميًا، بل في فهم الذات بعمق كافٍ لمعرفة أي طريق مناسب لشخصية المرء وظروفه.

passages.title: The Importance of Unity
passages.text: الْوَحْدَةُ قُوَّةٌ وَالْفُرْقَةُ ضَعْفٌ. أَمَرَ اللهُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ بِالِاعْتِصَامِ بِحَبْلِهِ جَمِيعًا وَنَهَاهُمْ عَنِ التَّفَرُّقِ. قَالَ تَعَالَى: وَاعْتَصِمُوا بِحَبْلِ اللهِ جَمِيعًا وَلَا تَفَرَّقُوا. كَانَ الْأَوْسُ وَالْخَزْرَجُ قَبْلَ الْإِسْلَامِ أَعْدَاءً مُتَنَاحِرِينَ، فَجَمَعَهُمُ الْإِسْلَامُ إِخْوَةً مُتَحَابِّينَ. آخَى النَّبِيُّ بَيْنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالْأَنْصَارِ فَصَارُوا كَالْجَسَدِ الْوَاحِدِ. الِاخْتِلَافُ فِي الْآرَاءِ الْاجْتِهَادِيَّةِ مَقْبُولٌ بَلْ مَطْلُوبٌ، أَمَّا الِافْتِرَاقُ فِي الْأُصُولِ وَالتَّحَزُّبُ الْمَذْمُومُ فَمَنْهِيٌّ عَنْهُ. قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: الْمُؤْمِنُ لِلْمُؤْمِنِ كَالْبُنْيَانِ يَشُدُّ بَعْضُهُ بَعْضًا، وَشَبَّكَ بَيْنَ أَصَابِعِهِ. ضَعْفُ الْأُمَّةِ الْيَوْمَ مَرَدُّهُ إِلَى تَفَرُّقِهَا وَتَشَتُّتِهَا. تَنَازَعَتْ فَفَشِلَتْ وَذَهَبَتْ رِيحُهَا. الْوَحْدَةُ لَا تَعْنِي الْمُطَابَقَةَ التَّامَّةَ فِي كُلِّ شَيْءٍ، بَلِ الِاتِّفَاقَ عَلَى الْأُصُولِ وَالتَّسَامُحَ فِي الْفُرُوعِ. حِينَمَا تَتَوَحَّدُ الْأُمَّةُ تَعُودُ قُوَّتُهَا وَعِزَّتُهَا وَمَكَانَتُهَا. الْعَمَلُ الْجَمَاعِيُّ وَالتَّعَاوُنُ طَرِيقُ النَّجَاحِ وَالتَّقَدُّمِ.
passages.translation: Unity is strength and division is weakness. Allah commanded Muslims to hold fast to His rope together and forbade them from division. Allah the Most High said: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. The Aws and Khazraj before Islam were hostile enemies, and Islam united them as loving brothers. The Prophet established brotherhood between the Migrants and the Ansar, and they became like one body. Difference in scholarly opinions is acceptable, even required, but division in fundamentals and blameworthy partisanship is forbidden. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: The believer to the believer is like a building, each part strengthening the other, and he interlaced his fingers. The weakness of the Ummah today is due to its division and fragmentation. It quarreled and failed, and its strength went. Unity does not mean complete uniformity in everything, but rather agreement on fundamentals and tolerance in subsidiary matters. When the Ummah unites, its strength, honor, and status return. Collective work and cooperation are the path to success and progress.
grammaticalConcepts: Form VI verb (متناحرين، متحابين، تنازعت، توحد)
passages.moralLesson: Unity is essential for the strength and dignity of the Muslim nation. True unity respects diversity while maintaining agreement on core principles.
passages.moralLessonAr: الوحدة ضرورية لقوة الأمة الإسلامية وكرامتها. الوحدة الحقيقية تحترم التنوع مع الحفاظ على الاتفاق على المبادئ الأساسية.

passages.title: Lessons from Surah Yusuf
passages.text: سُورَةُ يُوسُفَ مِنْ أَجْمَلِ الْقَصَصِ الْقُرْآنِيَّةِ وَأَكْثَرِهَا عِبَرًا وَدُرُوسًا. تُعَلِّمُنَا الصَّبْرَ عَلَى الِابْتِلَاءِ: يُوسُفُ أُلْقِيَ فِي الْبِئْرِ، بِيعَ عَبْدًا، سُجِنَ ظُلْمًا، لَكِنَّهُ صَبَرَ حَتَّى جَعَلَهُ اللهُ عَزِيزَ مِصْرَ. تُعَلِّمُنَا الْعِفَّةَ وَالتَّقْوَى: لَمَّا رَاوَدَتْهُ امْرَأَةُ الْعَزِيزِ قَالَ: مَعَاذَ اللهِ إِنَّهُ رَبِّي أَحْسَنَ مَثْوَايَ، وَاخْتَارَ السِّجْنَ عَلَى الْمَعْصِيَةِ. تُعَلِّمُنَا حُسْنَ التَّخْطِيطِ: فَسَّرَ رُؤْيَا الْمَلِكِ وَوَضَعَ خُطَّةً لِمُوَاجَهَةِ السِّنِينَ الْعِجَافِ. تُعَلِّمُنَا الْعَفْوَ عِنْدَ الْمَقْدِرَةِ: لَمَّا تَمَكَّنَ مِنْ إِخْوَتِهِ قَالَ: لَا تَثْرِيبَ عَلَيْكُمُ الْيَوْمَ يَغْفِرُ اللهُ لَكُمْ. تُعَلِّمُنَا التَّوَكُّلَ عَلَى اللهِ: قَالَ يَعْقُوبُ: إِنَّمَا أَشْكُو بَثِّي وَحُزْنِي إِلَى اللهِ. تُعَلِّمُنَا أَنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا: تَحَوَّلَتْ مِحَنُ يُوسُفَ إِلَى مِنَحٍ. تُعَلِّمُنَا التَّوْحِيدَ وَالْإِخْلَاصَ: قَالَ يُوسُفُ فِي السِّجْنِ: أَأَرْبَابٌ مُتَفَرِّقُونَ خَيْرٌ أَمِ اللهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ. أَحْسَنُ الْقَصَصِ فِي أَحْسَنِ الْكُتُبِ.
passages.translation: Surah Yusuf is among the most beautiful Quranic stories and the most filled with lessons. It teaches us patience with trials: Yusuf was thrown into a well, sold as a slave, imprisoned unjustly, but he was patient until Allah made him the minister of Egypt. It teaches us chastity and piety: when the wife of al-Aziz tried to seduce him, he said: "Allah forbid! Indeed, he is my master who has made good my residence," and he chose prison over sin. It teaches us good planning: he interpreted the king's dream and developed a plan to face the lean years. It teaches us pardoning when able: when he had power over his brothers, he said: "No blame upon you today. May Allah forgive you." It teaches us reliance on Allah: Ya'qub said: "I only complain of my suffering and grief to Allah." It teaches us that with hardship comes ease: Yusuf's trials transformed into blessings. It teaches us monotheism and sincerity: Yusuf said in prison: "Are separate lords better or Allah, the One, the Prevailing?" The best of stories in the best of books.
passages.moralLesson: Surah Yusuf provides timeless lessons in patience, chastity, planning, forgiveness, and trust in Allah. Trials are transformed into blessings for the patient.
passages.moralLessonAr: سورة يوسف تقدم دروسا خالدة في الصبر والعفة والتخطيط والمغفرة والثقة بالله. الابتلاءات تتحول إلى نعم للصابرين.

passages.title: The Characteristics of the Righteous Scholars
passages.text: الْعُلَمَاءُ الرَّبَّانِيُّونَ هُمْ وَرَثَةُ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ، وَرِثُوا عَنْهُمُ الْعِلْمَ وَالْحِكْمَةَ، وَحَمَلُوا أَمَانَةَ التَّبْلِيغِ وَالتَّعْلِيمِ. لَيْسُوا مَنْ جَمَعَ الْعِلْمَ وَكَنَزَهُ لِنَفْسِهِ، بَلْ مَنْ تَعَلَّمَهُ وَعَلَّمَهُ وَعَمِلَ بِهِ وَدَعَا إِلَيْهِ. أَوَّلُ صِفَاتِهِمُ الْإِخْلَاصُ لِلَّهِ تَعَالَى فِي طَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ وَنَشْرِهِ، فَلَا يَبْتَغُونَ بِهِ جَاهًا وَلَا مَالًا وَلَا ثَنَاءً مِنَ الْخَلْقِ. وَمِنْ صِفَاتِهِمُ الْوَرَعُ وَالتَّقْوَى، فَيَحْفَظُونَ أَنْفُسَهُمْ عَنِ الشُّبُهَاتِ وَالْمُحَرَّمَاتِ، وَيَكُونُونَ قُدْوَةً صَالِحَةً لِلنَّاسِ. وَمِنْهَا التَّوَاضُعُ وَخَفْضُ الْجَنَاحِ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ، فَلَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَلَى أَحَدٍ وَلَا يَحْتَقِرُونَ الضُّعَفَاءَ. وَمِنْهَا الرَّحْمَةُ وَالشَّفَقَةُ عَلَى الْخَلْقِ، فَيُعَامِلُونَ النَّاسَ بِاللِّينِ وَاللُّطْفِ، وَيَصْبِرُونَ عَلَى أَذَاهُمْ، وَيَعْفُونَ عَنْ مُسِيئِهِمْ. وَمِنْهَا الْغَيْرَةُ عَلَى مَحَارِمِ اللهِ أَنْ تُنْتَهَكَ، فَيَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ بِالْحِكْمَةِ وَالْمَوْعِظَةِ الْحَسَنَةِ. وَمِنْهَا الزُّهْدُ فِي الدُّنْيَا، فَلَا تَشْغَلُهُمُ الْمَنَاصِبُ وَالْأَمْوَالُ عَنْ طَلَبِ الْآخِرَةِ. وَمِنْهَا الْعَدْلُ فِي الْحُكْمِ وَالْفُتْيَا، فَلَا يَتَّبِعُونَ الْهَوَى وَلَا يُحَابُونَ أَحَدًا عَلَى حِسَابِ الْحَقِّ. وَمِنْهَا الصَّبْرُ عَلَى مَشَقَّةِ التَّعْلِيمِ وَالتَّعَلُّمِ، فَيُثَابِرُونَ عَلَى الْبَحْثِ وَالدِّرَاسَةِ حَتَّى آخِرِ الْعُمُرِ. هَؤُلَاءِ هُمُ الَّذِينَ يُنِيرُونَ الطَّرِيقَ لِلْأُمَّةِ، وَيَهْدُونَهَا إِلَى الصِّرَاطِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ. قَالَ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِنَّ الْعُلَمَاءَ وَرَثَةُ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ، وَإِنَّ الْأَنْبِيَاءَ لَمْ يُوَرِّثُوا دِينَارًا وَلَا دِرْهَمًا، إِنَّمَا وَرَّثُوا الْعِلْمَ، فَمَنْ أَخَذَهُ أَخَذَ بِحَظٍّ وَافِرٍ". فَاطْلُبُوا الْعِلْمَ عِنْدَ أَهْلِهِ الْمُتَّقِينَ، وَاقْتَدُوا بِهِمْ فِي أَقْوَالِهِمْ وَأَفْعَالِهِمْ، وَادْعُوا لَهُمْ بِالتَّوْفِيقِ وَالسَّدَادِ.
passages.translation: The righteous scholars are the heirs of the prophets. They inherited from them knowledge and wisdom, and they carried the trust of conveying and teaching. They are not those who gathered knowledge and hoarded it for themselves, but rather those who learned it, taught it, practiced it, and called others to it. The first of their characteristics is sincerity to Allah the Most High in seeking knowledge and spreading it, so they do not seek through it status, wealth, or praise from people. Among their characteristics is piety and God-consciousness, so they protect themselves from doubtful matters and prohibitions, and they become good examples for people. Among them is humility and lowering the wing to the believers, so they do not show arrogance to anyone nor do they despise the weak. Among them is mercy and compassion for creation, so they treat people with gentleness and kindness, and they are patient with their harm, and they pardon those who wrong them. Among them is protective jealousy for Allah's sanctities not to be violated, so they enjoin good and forbid evil with wisdom and beautiful exhortation. Among them is asceticism in this world, so positions and wealth do not distract them from seeking the Hereafter. Among them is justice in judgment and legal rulings, so they do not follow desires nor do they show favoritism to anyone at the expense of truth. Among them is patience with the hardship of teaching and learning, so they persevere in research and study until the end of life. These are those who illuminate the path for the Ummah and guide it to the Straight Path. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, the scholars are the heirs of the prophets. Indeed, the prophets did not leave as inheritance dinars or dirhams, but rather they left knowledge, so whoever takes it has taken an abundant portion." So seek knowledge from its righteous people, and follow them in their words and deeds, and supplicate for them for success and correctness.
grammaticalConcepts: Form III and VI verbs (يعامل، يحاب، يثابر)
Prohibition and negation (لا يبتغون، لا يستكبرون)
Hadith quotation with أن and إن
Masdar forms as subjects and objects
passages.moralLesson: True Islamic scholars combine deep knowledge with righteous character. They serve as living examples of the faith, teaching not just with words but through their conduct and dedication to truth.
passages.moralLessonAr: العلماء الحقيقيون يجمعون بين المعرفة العميقة والخلق الصالح. يخدمون كأمثلة حية للإيمان، يعلمون ليس بالكلمات فقط بل من خلال سلوكهم وإخلاصهم للحق.

passages.title: The Etiquette of Seeking Knowledge
passages.text: لِطَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ آدَابٌ جَلِيلَةٌ وَشُرُوطٌ عَظِيمَةٌ، إِذَا الْتَزَمَ بِهَا الطَّالِبُ بُورِكَ لَهُ فِي عِلْمِهِ وَانْتَفَعَ بِهِ وَنَفَعَ. أَوَّلُهَا تَصْحِيحُ النِّيَّةِ، فَيَنْوِي بِطَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ وَجْهَ اللهِ تَعَالَى لَا شَيْئًا سِوَاهُ، وَيَحْذَرُ مِنَ الرِّيَاءِ وَالسُّمْعَةِ، فَإِنَّهُمَا يُحْبِطَانِ الْعَمَلَ وَيَحْرِمَانِ الْبَرَكَةَ. وَمِنْهَا اخْتِيَارُ الْعَالِمِ الثِّقَةِ الَّذِي يَجْمَعُ بَيْنَ الْعِلْمِ وَالْعَمَلِ، فَإِنَّ الْعِلْمَ يُؤْخَذُ عَنِ الرِّجَالِ لَا مِنَ الْكُتُبِ وَحْدَهَا. وَمِنْهَا التَّوَاضُعُ لِلْعِلْمِ وَالْمُعَلِّمِ، فَلَا يَأْتِي الطَّالِبُ إِلَى الْعِلْمِ مُسْتَكْبِرًا وَلَا مُعْجَبًا بِنَفْسِهِ، بَلْ يَأْتِيهِ خَاشِعًا خَاضِعًا، كَالْأَرْضِ الْعَطْشَى تَنْتَظِرُ الْمَطَرَ. قَالَ الْإِمَامُ الشَّافِعِيُّ: "مَا نَاظَرْتُ أَحَدًا إِلَّا وَتَمَنَّيْتُ أَنْ يُوَفَّقَ وَيُسَدَّدَ وَيُعَانَ، وَيَكُونَ عَلَيْهِ رِعَايَةٌ مِنَ اللهِ وَحِفْظٌ". وَمِنَ الْآدَابِ حُسْنُ الِاسْتِمَاعِ وَالْإِنْصَاتُ لِلْمُعَلِّمِ، وَعَدَمُ مُقَاطَعَتِهِ أَثْنَاءَ الْكَلَامِ، وَتَدْوِينُ مَا يُلْقِيهِ مِنَ الْفَوَائِدِ. وَمِنْهَا الْمُثَابَرَةُ وَالِاسْتِمْرَارُ، فَلَا يَمَلُّ الطَّالِبُ وَلَا يَكِلُّ، بَلْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ وِرْدًا يَوْمِيًّا لَا يَخِلُّ بِهِ. وَمِنْهَا الْعَمَلُ بِالْعِلْمِ، فَإِنَّ الْعِلْمَ بِلَا عَمَلٍ شَجَرَةٌ بِلَا ثَمَرٍ، وَسَحَابَةٌ بِلَا مَطَرٍ. قَالَ بَعْضُ السَّلَفِ: "كُنَّا نَسْتَعِينُ عَلَى حِفْظِ الْحَدِيثِ بِالْعَمَلِ بِهِ". وَمِنْهَا التَّدَرُّجُ فِي الطَّلَبِ، فَيَبْدَأُ بِالْأَهَمِّ فَالْأَهَمِّ، وَالْأَصْلُ قَبْلَ الْفَرْعِ، وَالْمُخْتَصَرُ قَبْلَ الْمُطَوَّلِ. وَمِنْهَا الْحِرْصُ عَلَى فَهْمِ الْمَسَائِلِ لَا مُجَرَّدِ حِفْظِهَا، فَالْفَهْمُ أَوْلَى مِنَ الْحِفْظِ، وَإِنْ جَمَعَ بَيْنَهُمَا فَذَلِكَ أَفْضَلُ. وَمِنْهَا الِاسْتِعَانَةُ بِاللهِ تَعَالَى وَكَثْرَةُ الدُّعَاءِ، فَيَدْعُو الطَّالِبُ رَبَّهُ أَنْ يَشْرَحَ صَدْرَهُ لِلْعِلْمِ، وَيُنَوِّرَ قَلْبَهُ بِالْحِكْمَةِ، وَيُبَارِكَ لَهُ فِي عُمُرِهِ وَوَقْتِهِ. فَإِذَا الْتَزَمَ الطَّالِبُ بِهَذِهِ الْآدَابِ أَثْمَرَ عِلْمُهُ وَبُورِكَ لَهُ فِيهِ، وَصَارَ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْعِلْمِ الْعَامِلِينَ النَّافِعِينَ.
passages.translation: Seeking knowledge has noble etiquettes and great conditions. If the student adheres to them, his knowledge will be blessed and he will benefit from it and benefit others. The first is correcting the intention, so he intends by seeking knowledge the Face of Allah Most High and nothing else, and he beware of showing off and seeking reputation, for they nullify action and deprive of blessing. Among them is choosing the trustworthy scholar who combines knowledge and action, for knowledge is taken from men, not from books alone. Among them is humility toward knowledge and the teacher, so the student does not come to knowledge arrogantly or conceited with himself, but rather comes humbly and submissively, like thirsty earth waiting for rain. Imam Shafi'i said: "I never debated anyone except that I wished that he be granted success, correctness, and assistance, and that there be care and protection from Allah upon him." Among the etiquettes is good listening and attentiveness to the teacher, not interrupting him during speech, and recording the benefits he conveys. Among them is perseverance and continuity, so the student does not tire or grow weary, but rather makes for himself a daily portion that he does not neglect. Among them is acting upon knowledge, for knowledge without action is a tree without fruit, and a cloud without rain. Some of the predecessors said: "We used to seek help in memorizing hadith by acting upon it." Among them is gradual progression in seeking, so he begins with the most important then the next important, and the foundation before the branch, and the summary before the detailed. Among them is keenness on understanding matters not merely memorizing them, for understanding is more important than memorization, though combining them is best. Among them is seeking Allah's help and much supplication, so the student supplicates his Lord to open his chest to knowledge, illuminate his heart with wisdom, and bless him in his life and time. If the student adheres to these etiquettes, his knowledge will bear fruit and be blessed, and he will become among the practicing and beneficial people of knowledge.
grammaticalConcepts: Prepositional phrase as sentence opener (لطلب العلم)
passages.moralLesson: Seeking knowledge requires proper intention, humility, persistence, and most importantly, acting upon what is learned. The etiquette of the student shapes the effectiveness and blessing of the learning journey.
passages.moralLessonAr: طلب العلم يتطلب النية الصحيحة والتواضع والمثابرة والأهم العمل بما يُتعلم. أدب الطالب يشكل فعالية وبركة رحلة التعلم.

passages.title: The Reality of This World
passages.text: الدُّنْيَا دَارُ مَمَرٍّ لَا دَارُ مَقَرٍّ، وَمَحَطُّ رِحَالٍ لَا مَوْطِنُ إِقَامَةٍ. جُعِلَتْ مَزْرَعَةً لِلْآخِرَةِ، فَمَنْ زَرَعَ فِيهَا خَيْرًا حَصَدَ نَعِيمًا، وَمَنْ زَرَعَ شَرًّا حَصَدَ جَحِيمًا. لَيْسَتْ بِدَارٍ لِلْقَرَارِ، بَلْ هِيَ كَالظِّلِّ الزَّائِلِ، وَالطَّيْفِ الْعَابِرِ، وَالسَّحَابِ الْمُنْقَشِعِ. مَهْمَا طَالَتْ أَيَّامُهَا فَهِيَ قَصِيرَةٌ، وَمَهْمَا عَظُمَتْ لَذَّاتُهَا فَهِيَ فَانِيَةٌ. كَمْ مِنْ مُلُوكٍ تَرَبَّعُوا عَلَى عُروشِهَا، ثُمَّ صَارُوا تُرَابًا تَحْتَ أَقْدَامِ النَّاسِ! وَكَمْ مِنْ أَغْنِيَاءَ جَمَعُوا الْكُنُوزَ وَالْأَمْوَالَ، ثُمَّ فَارَقُوهَا وَلَمْ يَأْخُذُوا مِنْهَا إِلَّا الْكَفَنَ! وَكَمْ مِنْ أَقْوِيَاءَ سَاطُوا وَجَبَرُوا، ثُمَّ أَذَلَّهُمُ الْمَوْتُ وَأَخْضَعَهُمْ! الدُّنْيَا كَالْمَاءِ الْمِلْحِ، كُلَّمَا ازْدَادَ الْإِنْسَانُ مِنْهُ شُرْبًا ازْدَادَ عَطَشًا. تَغُرُّ بِزِينَتِهَا وَتَخْدَعُ بِزَخْرَفِهَا، حَتَّى إِذَا اطْمَأَنَّ إِلَيْهَا صَاحِبُهَا انْقَلَبَتْ عَلَيْهِ وَخَانَتْهُ. قَالَ اللهُ تَعَالَى: "إِنَّمَا مَثَلُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا كَمَاءٍ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ فَاخْتَلَطَ بِهِ نَبَاتُ الْأَرْضِ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ النَّاسُ وَالْأَنْعَامُ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَخَذَتِ الْأَرْضُ زُخْرُفَهَا وَازَّيَّنَتْ وَظَنَّ أَهْلُهَا أَنَّهُمْ قَادِرُونَ عَلَيْهَا أَتَاهَا أَمْرُنَا لَيْلًا أَوْ نَهَارًا فَجَعَلْنَاهَا حَصِيدًا كَأَنْ لَمْ تَغْنَ بِالْأَمْسِ". فَالْعَاقِلُ مَنْ جَعَلَ الدُّنْيَا مَطِيَّةً لِلْآخِرَةِ، وَالْأَحْمَقُ مَنْ جَعَلَ الْآخِرَةَ ثَمَنًا لِلدُّنْيَا. نَعَمْ، لِلدُّنْيَا حَقٌّ، فَلَا يَنْبَغِي تَرْكُهَا بِالْكُلِّيَّةِ، بَلْ أَخْذُ مَا يُعِينُ عَلَى طَاعَةِ اللهِ مِنْهَا، وَتَرْكُ مَا يَشْغَلُ عَنْهُ. فَاعْمَلْ لِدُنْيَاكَ كَأَنَّكَ تَعِيشُ أَبَدًا، وَاعْمَلْ لِآخِرَتِكَ كَأَنَّكَ تَمُوتُ غَدًا. وَلَا تَكُنْ مِمَّنْ أَسْكَرَتْهُ خُمُورُ الدُّنْيَا، فَغَفَلَ عَنِ الْآخِرَةِ حَتَّى فَاجَأَهُ الْمَوْتُ وَهُوَ غَيْرُ مُسْتَعِدٍّ.
passages.translation: This world is an abode of passage not an abode of settlement, and a stopping place for travelers not a homeland of residence. It was made a farm for the Hereafter, so whoever plants good in it will harvest bliss, and whoever plants evil will harvest hellfire. It is not an abode for permanence, rather it is like a fleeting shadow, a passing phantom, and dispersing clouds. No matter how long its days, they are short, and no matter how great its pleasures, they are perishing. How many kings sat upon its thrones, then became dust beneath people's feet! And how many wealthy gathered treasures and wealth, then departed from them taking nothing but the shroud! And how many powerful dominated and tyrannized, then death humiliated and subdued them! This world is like salt water - the more a person drinks from it, the more his thirst increases. It deceives with its adornment and deludes with its decorations, until when its possessor becomes complacent with it, it turns against him and betrays him. Allah the Most High said: "The example of this worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky that the plants of the earth absorb - from which men and livestock eat - until when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they have capability over it, Our command comes to it by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday." The wise person is one who makes this world a mount for the Hereafter, and the foolish is one who makes the Hereafter a price for this world. Yes, this world has a right, so it should not be abandoned completely, but rather taking from it what assists in obeying Allah, and leaving what distracts from Him. Work for your world as if you will live forever, and work for your Hereafter as if you will die tomorrow. And do not be among those whom the intoxications of this world have intoxicated, so he became heedless of the Hereafter until death surprised him while he was unprepared.
grammaticalConcepts: Form II and Form IV verbs
passages.moralLesson: This world is temporary and deceptive. The wise use it as a means to the eternal Hereafter, taking what is needed for righteous action while remaining detached from its illusions.
passages.moralLessonAr: هذه الدنيا مؤقتة وخادعة. العاقل يستخدمها كوسيلة للآخرة الأبدية، يأخذ ما يحتاجه للعمل الصالح بينما يظل منفصلاً عن أوهامها.

passages.title: The Wisdom Behind Trials and Tribulations
passages.text: الِابْتِلَاءُ سُنَّةٌ مَاضِيَةٌ فِي خَلْقِ اللهِ، لَا يَنْجُو مِنْهُ أَحَدٌ، لَا نَبِيٌّ مُرْسَلٌ وَلَا مَلَكٌ مُقَرَّبٌ، فَضْلًا عَنْ عَامَّةِ الْخَلْقِ. قَالَ تَعَالَى: "وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ بِشَيْءٍ مِنَ الْخَوْفِ وَالْجُوعِ وَنَقْصٍ مِنَ الْأَمْوَالِ وَالْأَنْفُسِ وَالثَّمَرَاتِ وَبَشِّرِ الصَّابِرِينَ". وَرَاءَ هَذِهِ الِابْتِلَاءَاتِ حِكَمٌ عَظِيمَةٌ لَا يُدْرِكُهَا إِلَّا مَنْ نَوَّرَ اللهُ بَصِيرَتَهُ. فَمِنْ حِكَمِهَا أَنَّهَا تَكْشِفُ مَعَادِنَ النَّاسِ، وَتُمَيِّزُ الصَّادِقَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِ، وَالْمُؤْمِنَ الْحَقِيقِيَّ مِنَ الْمُنَافِقِ. فَالِابْتِلَاءُ كَالنَّارِ تُصَهِّرُ الْمَعْدِنَ، فَيَظْهَرُ الذَّهَبُ الْخَالِصُ وَيُطْرَحُ الزَّغَلُ. وَمِنْهَا أَنَّهَا تُطَهِّرُ الْمُؤْمِنَ مِنْ ذُنُوبِهِ وَخَطَايَاهُ، كَمَا قَالَ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَا يُصِيبُ الْمُسْلِمَ مِنْ نَصَبٍ وَلَا وَصَبٍ وَلَا هَمٍّ وَلَا حُزْنٍ وَلَا أَذًى وَلَا غَمٍّ، حَتَّى الشَّوْكَةِ يُشَاكُهَا، إِلَّا كَفَّرَ اللهُ بِهَا مِنْ خَطَايَاهُ". وَمِنْهَا أَنَّهَا تُذَكِّرُ الْإِنْسَانَ بِضَعْفِهِ وَافْتِقَارِهِ إِلَى رَبِّهِ، فَيَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِ تَائِبًا مُنِيبًا، بَعْدَمَا كَانَ غَافِلًا سَادِرًا. وَمِنْهَا أَنَّهَا تَرْفَعُ دَرَجَاتِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ فِي الْجَنَّةِ، فَأَعْلَى الدَّرَجَاتِ لَا تُنَالُ إِلَّا بِالصَّبْرِ عَلَى الْبَلَاءِ. وَمِنْهَا أَنَّهَا تُقَوِّي الْإِيمَانَ وَتُرَسِّخُهُ فِي الْقَلْبِ، فَالْإِيمَانُ الَّذِي لَمْ يُمْتَحَنْ كَالشَّجَرَةِ الَّتِي لَمْ تُعَصِّبْهَا الرِّيَاحُ، ضَعِيفَةُ الْعُرُوقِ سَهْلَةُ الِاقْتِلَاعِ. وَمِنْهَا أَنَّهَا تُعَلِّمُ الْمُؤْمِنَ الصَّبْرَ وَالثَّبَاتَ وَالتَّوَكُّلَ عَلَى اللهِ، وَهَذِهِ صِفَاتٌ لَا تُكْتَسَبُ إِلَّا بِالتَّجْرِبَةِ وَالْمُمَارَسَةِ. فَإِذَا فَهِمَ الْمُؤْمِنُ هَذِهِ الْحِكَمَ هَانَ عَلَيْهِ الْبَلَاءُ، وَصَبَرَ عَلَى الضَّرَّاءِ، وَاحْتَسَبَ الْأَجْرَ عِنْدَ اللهِ. وَلَمْ يَتَسَخَّطْ وَلَمْ يَجْزَعْ، بَلْ رَضِيَ بِقَضَاءِ اللهِ وَقَدَرِهِ، عَالِمًا أَنَّ اللهَ لَا يَقْضِي لِلْمُؤْمِنِ قَضَاءً إِلَّا كَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُ. قَالَ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "عَجَبًا لِأَمْرِ الْمُؤْمِنِ، إِنَّ أَمْرَهُ كُلَّهُ خَيْرٌ، وَلَيْسَ ذَلِكَ لِأَحَدٍ إِلَّا لِلْمُؤْمِنِ: إِنْ أَصَابَتْهُ سَرَّاءُ شَكَرَ فَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُ، وَإِنْ أَصَابَتْهُ ضَرَّاءُ صَبَرَ فَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُ".
passages.translation: Tribulation is an ongoing practice in Allah's creation; no one escapes it - neither a sent prophet nor an angel brought near, let alone the general creation. The Most High said: "And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient." Behind these tribulations are great wisdoms that only those whose insight Allah has illuminated can perceive. Among their wisdoms is that they reveal people's true natures and distinguish the truthful from the liar, and the true believer from the hypocrite. Tribulation is like fire smelting ore - pure gold appears and the dross is discarded. Among them is that it purifies the believer from his sins and transgressions, as the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "No fatigue, nor disease, nor worry, nor sadness, nor hurt, nor distress befalls a Muslim, even a thorn that pricks him, but Allah expiates some of his sins for that." Among them is that it reminds a person of his weakness and need for his Lord, so he returns to Him repentant and turning back, after having been heedless and wandering. Among them is that it raises the ranks of believers in Paradise, for the highest ranks are not attained except through patience with affliction. Among them is that it strengthens faith and establishes it firmly in the heart, for faith that has not been tested is like a tree that has not been buffeted by winds - weak in roots and easy to uproot. Among them is that it teaches the believer patience, steadfastness, and reliance upon Allah, and these are qualities not acquired except through experience and practice. When the believer understands these wisdoms, affliction becomes easy for him, and he is patient with adversity, and he anticipates reward with Allah. He neither complains nor despairs, but rather is content with Allah's decree, knowing that Allah does not decree for the believer any decree except that it is good for him. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Amazing is the affair of the believer, verily all of his affair is good, and this is not for anyone except the believer: if prosperity befalls him, he is grateful and that is good for him, and if adversity befalls him, he is patient and that is good for him."
passages.moralLesson: Trials are not punishments but divine tests carrying profound wisdom. They purify, strengthen faith, and distinguish the sincere. Understanding their purpose transforms suffering into spiritual growth and brings contentment with divine decree.
passages.moralLessonAr: الابتلاءات ليست عقوبات بل اختبارات إلهية تحمل حكمة عميقة. تطهر وتقوي الإيمان وتميز الصادقين. فهم غرضها يحول المعاناة إلى نمو روحي ويجلب الرضا بالقضاء الإلهي.

passages.title: The Rights of the Muslim Upon the Muslim
passages.text: لِلْمُسْلِمِ عَلَى أَخِيهِ الْمُسْلِمِ حُقُوقٌ عَظِيمَةٌ أَوْجَبَهَا اللهُ تَعَالَى وَرَسُولُهُ، وَجَعَلَهَا أَسَاسًا لِبِنَاءِ الْمُجْتَمَعِ الْمُتَمَاسِكِ وَالْأُمَّةِ الْقَوِيَّةِ. أَوَّلُ هَذِهِ الْحُقُوقِ رَدُّ السَّلَامِ، فَإِذَا سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكَ أَخُوكَ الْمُسْلِمُ وَجَبَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ تَرُدَّ عَلَيْهِ، وَأَنْ تَرُدَّ بِأَحْسَنَ مِمَّا حَيَّاكَ بِهِ أَوْ بِمِثْلِهِ. وَمِنْهَا إِجَابَةُ الدَّعْوَةِ، فَإِذَا دَعَاكَ أَخُوكَ إِلَى وَلِيمَةٍ أَوْ مُنَاسَبَةٍ فَلَا تَتَخَلَّفْ عَنْهُ إِلَّا بِعُذْرٍ شَرْعِيٍّ، فَإِنَّ فِي إِجَابَتِهِ إِدْخَالَ السُّرُورِ عَلَيْهِ وَتَقْوِيَةَ أَوَاصِرِ الْمَحَبَّةِ بَيْنَكُمَا. وَمِنْهَا عِيَادَةُ الْمَرِيضِ، فَإِذَا مَرِضَ أَخُوكَ فَزُرْهُ وَتَفَقَّدْ حَالَهُ وَسَلِّهِ وَادْعُ لَهُ بِالشِّفَاءِ، فَإِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ أَجْرًا عَظِيمًا. قَالَ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَا مِنْ مُسْلِمٍ يَعُودُ مُسْلِمًا غُدْوَةً إِلَّا صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ، وَإِنْ عَادَهُ عَشِيَّةً إِلَّا صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ، وَكَانَ لَهُ خَرِيفٌ فِي الْجَنَّةِ". وَمِنْهَا اتِّبَاعُ الْجَنَائِزِ، فَإِذَا مَاتَ أَخُوكَ فَشَيِّعْ جَنَازَتَهُ وَصَلِّ عَلَيْهِ وَادْعُ لَهُ بِالْمَغْفِرَةِ وَالرَّحْمَةِ، وَلَا تَنْسَهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهِ بَلِ ادْعُ لَهُ وَتَصَدَّقْ عَنْهُ. وَمِنْهَا النَّصِيحَةُ، فَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ أَخَاكَ عَلَى خَطَأٍ فَانْصَحْهُ بِالرِّفْقِ وَاللِّينِ، سِرًّا لَا جَهْرًا، حِفْظًا لِمَاءِ وَجْهِهِ. قَالَ الْفُضَيْلُ بْنُ عِيَاضٍ: "الْمُؤْمِنُ يَسْتُرُ وَيَنْصَحُ، وَالْفَاجِرُ يَهْتِكُ وَيُعَيِّرُ". وَمِنْهَا سَتْرُ عَوْرَتِهِ وَعَيْبِهِ، فَلَا تَفْضَحْهُ وَلَا تَكْشِفْ مَا يَكْرَهُ كَشْفَهُ مِنْ أُمُورِهِ. وَمِنْهَا نُصْرَتُهُ ظَالِمًا أَوْ مَظْلُومًا، أَمَّا نُصْرَتُهُ مَظْلُومًا فَبِمَنْعِ الظُّلْمِ عَنْهُ، وَأَمَّا نُصْرَتُهُ ظَالِمًا فَبِكَفِّهِ عَنِ الظُّلْمِ وَمَنْعِهِ مِنْهُ. وَمِنْهَا حُسْنُ الظَّنِّ بِهِ، فَلَا تَحْمِلْ كَلَامَهُ وَفِعْلَهُ عَلَى أَسْوَأِ الْمَحَامِلِ، بَلِ الْتَمِسْ لَهُ الْعُذْرَ وَأَحْسِنْ بِهِ الظَّنَّ مَا اسْتَطَعْتَ. وَمِنْهَا مُسَاعَدَتُهُ فِي حَاجَتِهِ، فَإِذَا احْتَاجَ إِلَيْكَ فَكُنْ عَوْنًا لَهُ، وَاسْعَ فِي قَضَاءِ حَاجَتِهِ كَمَا تَسْعَى فِي حَاجَةِ نَفْسِكَ. قَالَ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "وَاللهُ فِي عَوْنِ الْعَبْدِ مَا كَانَ الْعَبْدُ فِي عَوْنِ أَخِيهِ". فَمَنْ حَفِظَ هَذِهِ الْحُقُوقَ وَأَدَّاهَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ، وَمَنْ قَصَّرَ فِيهَا فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ أَخَاهُ وَحَرَمَ نَفْسَهُ الْأَجْرَ.
passages.translation: The Muslim has great rights upon his Muslim brother that Allah the Most High and His Messenger made obligatory, and He made them a foundation for building a cohesive society and a strong Ummah. The first of these rights is returning the greeting; if your Muslim brother greets you, you must respond to him, and respond better than he greeted you or similarly. Among them is accepting invitations; if your brother invites you to a feast or occasion, do not fail him except with a legitimate excuse, for in answering him is bringing joy to him and strengthening the bonds of love between you. Among them is visiting the sick; if your brother becomes ill, visit him, check on his condition, console him, and supplicate for his healing, for in that is great reward. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "There is no Muslim who visits a sick Muslim in the morning except that seventy thousand angels pray for him until evening, and if he visits him in the evening, seventy thousand angels pray for him until morning, and he will have a garden in Paradise." Among them is following funerals; if your brother dies, accompany his funeral, pray over him, and supplicate for his forgiveness and mercy, and do not forget him after his death but rather supplicate for him and give charity on his behalf. Among them is sincere advice; if you see your brother in error, advise him with gentleness and kindness, privately not publicly, preserving his dignity. Fudayl ibn 'Iyad said: "The believer covers and advises, while the immoral exposes and reproaches." Among them is covering his private matters and faults, so do not expose him nor reveal what he dislikes to be revealed of his affairs. Among them is supporting him whether oppressor or oppressed; as for supporting him when oppressed, it is by preventing injustice against him, and as for supporting him when oppressing, it is by restraining him from oppression and preventing him from it. Among them is thinking well of him, so do not interpret his words and actions in the worst way, but rather seek excuses for him and think well of him as much as you can. Among them is assisting him in his need; if he needs you, be a helper to him, and strive to fulfill his need as you would strive for your own need. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Allah is helping the servant as long as the servant is helping his brother." Whoever preserves these rights and fulfills them is among the righteous, and whoever falls short in them has wronged his brother and deprived himself of reward.
grammaticalConcepts: Form II and Form III verbs

vocabularyHighlights.meaning: his dignity (lit. water of his face)

passages.moralLesson: Islam establishes comprehensive rights between Muslims that create a compassionate, supportive community. Fulfilling these rights demonstrates true brotherhood and earns divine reward while strengthening societal bonds.
passages.moralLessonAr: الإسلام يؤسس حقوقاً شاملة بين المسلمين تخلق مجتمعاً رحيماً وداعماً. الوفاء بهذه الحقوق يظهر الأخوة الحقيقية ويكسب الأجر الإلهي مع تقوية الروابط الاجتماعية.

passages.title: The Comprehensive Framework of Prophetic Medicine
passages.text: إِنَّ الطِّبَّ النَّبَوِيَّ لَيْسَ مُجَرَّدَ مَجْمُوعَةٍ مِنَ الْعِلَاجَاتِ، بَلْ هُوَ نِظَامٌ صِحِّيٌّ مُتَكَامِلٌ يَجْمَعُ بَيْنَ السَّلَامَةِ الْجِسْمِيَّةِ وَالرُّوحِيَّةِ وَالنَّفْسِيَّةِ. قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: مَا أَنْزَلَ اللهُ دَاءً إِلَّا أَنْزَلَ لَهُ شِفَاءً. هَذَا الْمَبْدَأُ يُؤَسِّسُ أَنَّ لِكُلِّ مَرَضٍ عِلَاجًا، سَوَاءٌ اكْتَشَفَهُ الْإِنْسَانُ أَمْ لَمْ يَكْتَشِفْهُ. يُشَدِّدُ الطِّبُّ النَّبَوِيُّ عَلَى الْوِقَايَةِ مِنْ خِلَالِ النِّظَامِ الْغِذَائِيِّ وَنَمَطِ الْحَيَاةِ، مِثْلَ تَنَاوُلِ سَبْعِ تَمَرَاتٍ عَجْوَةٍ صَبَاحًا. وَيُؤْثِرُ الْعِلَاجَ الطَّبِيعِيَّ بِالْعَسَلِ وَالْحَبَّةِ السَّوْدَاءِ وَالْحِجَامَةِ. وَلَكِنَّ الْأَهَمَّ أَنَّهُ يَرْبِطُ بَيْنَ الْأَخْذِ بِالْأَسْبَابِ وَالتَّوَكُّلِ عَلَى اللهِ. فَالشِّفَاءُ الْحَقِيقِيُّ لَا يَأْتِي إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللهِ، وَالدُّعَاءُ جُزْءٌ أَسَاسِيٌّ مِنَ الْعِلَاجِ. يُعَلِّمُنَا هَذَا النَّهْجُ أَنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ يَجِبُ أَنْ يَسْعَى لِلْعِلَاجِ مَعَ الْيَقِينِ بِأَنَّ اللهَ وَحْدَهُ هُوَ الشَّافِي.
passages.translation: Prophetic medicine is not merely a collection of remedies; rather, it is an integrated health system that combines physical, spiritual, and psychological well-being. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: Allah has not sent down a disease except that He has sent down its cure. This principle establishes that for every illness there is a treatment, whether humans have discovered it or not. Prophetic medicine emphasizes prevention through diet and lifestyle, such as eating seven Ajwa dates in the morning. It prefers natural treatment with honey, black seed, and cupping. But most importantly, it connects taking means with reliance upon Allah. True healing comes only by Allah's permission, and supplication is a fundamental part of treatment. This approach teaches us that a person must seek treatment while having certainty that Allah alone is the Healer.
grammaticalConcepts: Inna and its sisters (إِنَّ، أَنَّ، لَكِنَّ)
Form II and IV verbs (يُؤَسِّسُ، أَنْزَلَ، يُشَدِّدُ)
passages.moralLesson: Prophetic medicine represents a holistic paradigm that transcends mere physical treatment. It integrates faith with action, natural remedies with spiritual reliance, and human effort with divine will. The fundamental teaching is that believers must actively pursue healing through legitimate means—diet, natural medicines, professional care—while maintaining absolute conviction that all healing flows from Allah's will alone. This balanced worldview prevents both medical fatalism (refusing treatment) and secular materialism (ignoring divine agency). The prophetic model teaches that du'a (supplication) is not supplementary to medicine but integral to it, and that true health encompasses body, soul, and spirit in harmony.
passages.moralLessonAr: يمثل الطب النبوي نموذجًا شاملاً يتجاوز مجرد العلاج الجسدي. إنه يدمج الإيمان مع العمل، والعلاجات الطبيعية مع الاعتماد الروحي، والجهد البشري مع الإرادة الإلهية. التعليم الأساسي هو أن على المؤمنين السعي النشط للشفاء من خلال الوسائل المشروعة - النظام الغذائي، الأدوية الطبيعية، الرعاية المهنية - مع الحفاظ على اليقين المطلق بأن كل شفاء يأتي من إرادة الله وحده. هذه النظرة المتوازنة للعالم تمنع كلاً من الجبرية الطبية (رفض العلاج) والمادية العلمانية (تجاهل الفاعلية الإلهية). النموذج النبوي يعلم أن الدعاء ليس مكملاً للطب بل جزء لا يتجزأ منه، وأن الصحة الحقيقية تشمل الجسد والروح والنفس في انسجام.

passages.title: The Hijrah: Multidimensional Transformation
passages.text: لَمْ تَكُنِ الْهِجْرَةُ النَّبَوِيَّةُ مُجَرَّدَ انْتِقَالٍ جُغْرَافِيٍّ، بَلْ كَانَتْ تَحَوُّلًا شَامِلًا فِي أَبْعَادٍ مُتَعَدِّدَةٍ. اسْتِرَاتِيجِيًّا، انْتَقَلَ الْمُسْلِمُونَ مِنَ الضَّعْفِ إِلَى الْقُوَّةِ، وَمِنَ الْبَقَاءِ إِلَى الْفَاعِلِيَّةِ. رُوحِيًّا، جَسَّدَتِ الْهِجْرَةُ التَّوَكُّلَ الْكَامِلَ عَلَى اللهِ، كَمَا فِي قِصَّةِ الْغَارِ وَخَيْطِ الْعَنْكَبُوتِ. اجْتِمَاعِيًّا، أَسَّسَتِ الْمُؤَاخَاةَ بَيْنَ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ وَالْأَنْصَارِ، نِظَامًا يَتَجَاوَزُ الْقَبِيلَةَ وَالنَّسَبَ. سِيَاسِيًّا، أَنْشَأَتْ أَوَّلَ دَوْلَةٍ إِسْلَامِيَّةٍ ذَاتِ دُسْتُورٍ مَكْتُوبٍ. رَمْزِيًّا، صَارَتِ الْهِجْرَةُ بِدَايَةَ التَّقْوِيمِ الْإِسْلَامِيِّ، لَا الْمِيلَادُ وَلَا الْوَحْيُ. إِنَّ الْهِجْرَةَ لَيْسَتْ هُرُوبًا بَلْ إِعَادَةُ تَمَوْضُعٍ اسْتِرَاتِيجِيٍّ. جَمَعَتْ بَيْنَ التَّخْطِيطِ الْمُحْكَمِ وَالتَّوَكُّلِ الْمُطْلَقِ، مُعَلِّمَةً أَنَّ الْإِيمَانَ الْحَقِيقِيَّ يَجْمَعُ بَيْنَ الْأَخْذِ بِالْأَسْبَابِ وَالثِّقَةِ بِاللهِ.
passages.translation: The Prophetic Hijrah was not merely a geographical relocation; rather, it was a comprehensive transformation across multiple dimensions. Strategically, Muslims transitioned from weakness to strength, from survival to agency. Spiritually, the Hijrah embodied complete trust in Allah, as in the story of the cave and the spider's web. Socially, it established brotherhood between the Muhajirun and Ansar, a system transcending tribe and lineage. Politically, it created the first Islamic state with a written constitution. Symbolically, the Hijrah became the beginning of the Islamic calendar, not the Prophet's birth nor the revelation. The Hijrah is not flight but strategic repositioning. It combined meticulous planning with absolute reliance, teaching that true faith combines taking means with trust in Allah.
grammaticalConcepts: Form II and V verbs (جَسَّدَتْ، يَتَجَاوَزُ، تَمَوْضُعٍ)
Complex sentence structures with embedded clauses
passages.moralLesson: The Hijrah represents a paradigm of transformative change that integrates multiple dimensions of human experience. It teaches that when circumstances prevent living according to truth, migration becomes not cowardice but strategic wisdom. The Hijrah demonstrates that authentic leadership requires both careful planning (choosing Madinah, timing the departure, selecting the route) and complete spiritual reliance (trusting in divine protection). The establishment of brotherhood between immigrants and natives created a revolutionary social model where faith superseded blood ties. Most profoundly, choosing the Hijrah—not birth or revelation—as the calendar's starting point signals that Islam prioritizes action and sacrifice over passive inheritance. The Hijrah was transformation: from endurance to initiative, from scattered individuals to unified community, from powerless minority to self-governing society.
passages.moralLessonAr: تمثل الهجرة نموذجًا للتغيير التحويلي الذي يدمج أبعادًا متعددة من التجربة الإنسانية. إنها تعلم أنه عندما تمنع الظروف العيش وفقًا للحق، تصبح الهجرة ليست جبنًا بل حكمة استراتيجية. الهجرة تثبت أن القيادة الحقيقية تتطلب كلاً من التخطيط الدقيق (اختيار المدينة، توقيت المغادرة، اختيار الطريق) والاعتماد الروحي الكامل (الثقة بالحماية الإلهية). إنشاء الأخوة بين المهاجرين والسكان الأصليين خلق نموذجًا اجتماعيًا ثوريًا حيث الإيمان يتفوق على روابط الدم. والأعمق، اختيار الهجرة - وليس الميلاد أو الوحي - كبداية للتقويم يشير إلى أن الإسلام يعطي الأولوية للعمل والتضحية على الميراث السلبي. كانت الهجرة تحولاً: من التحمل إلى المبادرة، من أفراد متفرقين إلى مجتمع موحد، من أقلية عاجزة إلى مجتمع يحكم نفسه.

passages.title: The Essence of Companionship
passages.text: الصَّحَابَةُ رَضِيَ اللهُ عَنْهُمْ لَمْ يَكُونُوا خَارِقِينَ لِلطَّبِيعَةِ، بَلْ كَانُوا بَشَرًا عَادِيِّينَ حَقَّقُوا أُمُورًا اسْتِثْنَائِيَّةً بِوَسَائِلَ عَادِيَّةٍ رَفَعَهَا الإِخْلَاصُ الاسْتِثْنَائِيُّ. مَا مَيَّزَهُمْ خَمْسُ خَصَائِصَ جَوْهَرِيَّةٍ: أَوَّلًا، الاسْتِسْلَامُ الْكَامِلُ لِأَمْرِ اللهِ وَرَسُولِهِ دُونَ تَرَدُّدٍ أَوْ تَفَاوُضٍ. ثَانِيًا، التَّضْحِيَةُ الْمُطْلَقَةُ بِالْمَالِ وَالرَّاحَةِ وَالْحَيَاةِ فِي سَبِيلِ الإِسْلَامِ. ثَالِثًا، الإِيثَارُ حَيْثُ فَضَّلُوا إِخْوَانَهُمْ عَلَى أَنْفُسِهِمْ مُتَجَاوِزِينَ حُدُودَ الْقَبِيلَةِ وَالْعِرْقِ وَالطَّبَقَةِ الاجْتِمَاعِيَّةِ. رَابِعًا، وَحْدَةُ الْهَدَفِ حَيْثُ صَارَتِ الدُّنْيَا وَسِيلَةً لِلْآخِرَةِ لَا غَايَةً فِي ذَاتِهَا. خَامِسًا، التَّرْبِيَةُ النَّبَوِيَّةُ الْمُبَاشِرَةُ مِنْ خَيْرِ الْخَلْقِ أَجْمَعِينَ. لَمْ يَكُنِ اتِّبَاعُهُمْ لِلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ اخْتِيَارِيًّا انْتِقَائِيًّا، بَلْ كَانَ شَامِلًا كَامِلًا. عِنْدَمَا أَعْطَى أَبُو بَكْرٍ كُلَّ مَالِهِ، بَرْهَنَ أَنَّ اللهَ وَحْدَهُ يَكْفِي. وَعِنْدَمَا صَبَرَ بِلَالٌ تَحْتَ التَّعْذِيبِ قَائِلًا "أَحَدٌ أَحَدٌ"، أَثْبَتَ أَنَّ التَّوْحِيدَ الْحَقِيقِيَّ يُخْتَبَرُ تَحْتَ الضَّغْطِ لَا فِي الرَّخَاءِ. إِرْثُهُمْ لَيْسَ مُجَرَّدَ أَفْعَالٍ تُذْكَرُ، بَلْ نَمُوذَجٌ يُحْتَذَى: الإِسْلَامُ يَتَطَلَّبُ تَحَوُّلًا شَامِلًا كَامِلًا، لَا امْتِثَالًا جُزْئِيًّا مُنْتَقًى.
passages.translation: The companions (may Allah be pleased with them) were not supernatural, but ordinary people who achieved extraordinary things through ordinary means elevated by extraordinary sincerity. Five essential characteristics distinguished them: First, complete submission to Allah's and His Messenger's command without hesitation or negotiation. Second, absolute sacrifice of wealth, comfort, and life for Islam. Third, altruism (ithar) where they preferred their brothers over themselves, transcending tribal, ethnic, and social class boundaries. Fourth, unity of purpose where worldly life became a means to the hereafter, not an end in itself. Fifth, direct prophetic training from the best of all creation. Their following of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) was not selective or optional, but comprehensive and complete. When Abu Bakr gave all his wealth, he proved that Allah alone suffices. And when Bilal endured torture saying "Ahad, Ahad," he demonstrated that true monotheism is tested under pressure, not in ease. Their legacy is not merely deeds to be remembered, but a model to be followed: Islam requires comprehensive, complete transformation, not partial, selective compliance.
grammaticalConcepts: Negation with ليس...بل (not this, but rather that)
Masdar forms for abstract concepts (الاستسلام، التضحية، الإيثار)
passages.moralLesson: The companions were not superhuman—their greatness lay in their sincerity and total commitment. They teach us that Islam is not a cafeteria where we pick and choose; it is a comprehensive way of life demanding transformation of heart, mind, and action. Their example stands as eternal proof that when ordinary people submit completely to Allah, they achieve the extraordinary.
passages.moralLessonAr: لم يكن الصحابة خارقين للعادة—عظمتهم تكمن في إخلاصهم والتزامهم الكامل. يعلموننا أن الإسلام ليس مطعمًا نختار منه ما نشاء؛ إنه أسلوب حياة شامل يتطلب تحول القلب والعقل والعمل. مثالهم يقف برهانًا أبديًا أنه عندما يستسلم الناس العاديون لله تمامًا، يحققون الاستثنائي.

passages.title: The Trials of Prophet Musa - Divine Pedagogy
passages.text: يَعْرِضُ الْقُرْآنُ حَيَاةَ مُوسَى عَلَيْهِ السَّلَامُ كَنَمُوذَجٍ لِلتَّرْبِيَةِ الرَّبَّانِيَّةِ عَبْرَ الْمِحَنِ. خَمْسُ مِحَنٍ رَئِيسِيَّةٍ شَكَّلَتْ نُبُوَّتَهُ: أَوَّلًا، مِحْنَةُ الْخَوْفِ حِينَ فَرَّ مِنْ مِصْرَ بَعْدَ قَتْلِهِ رَجُلًا خَطَأً، فَتَعَلَّمَ التَّوَكُّلَ رَغْمَ الرُّعْبِ. ثَانِيًا، مِحْنَةُ الْفَقْرِ حِينَ خَدَمَ سِنِينَ فِي مَدْيَنَ، فَتَعَلَّمَ التَّوَاضُعَ قَبْلَ الْقِيَادَةِ. ثَالِثًا، مِحْنَةُ الضَّعْفِ حِينَ وَاجَهَ فِرْعَوْنَ بِعُقْدَةٍ فِي لِسَانِهِ، فَأَدْرَكَ أَنَّ الْقُوَّةَ الإِلَهِيَّةَ تُعَوِّضُ الضَّعْفَ الْبَشَرِيَّ. رَابِعًا، مِحْنَةُ الْمَسْؤُولِيَّةِ حِينَ قَادَ قَوْمًا مُتَمَرِّدِينَ، فَتَعَلَّمَ الصَّبْرَ عَلَى النَّاسِ. خَامِسًا، مِحْنَةُ الشَّوْقِ حِينَ طَلَبَ رُؤْيَةَ اللهِ مُبَاشَرَةً، فَتَعَلَّمَ الْحُدُودَ الْبَشَرِيَّةَ أَمَامَ الْجَلَالِ الإِلَهِيِّ. كُلُّ مِحْنَةٍ هَدَمَتْ طَبَقَةً مِنَ الاعْتِمَادِ الذَّاتِيِّ، مُسْتَبْدِلَةً إِيَّاهَا بِالاعْتِمَادِ الإِلَهِيِّ. الْمِحَنُ لَيْسَتْ عِقَابًا بَلْ حِصَصٌ تَدْرِيبِيَّةٌ رَبَّانِيَّةٌ—اللهُ لَا يَكْسِرُ عِبَادَهُ بِالشِّدَّةِ، بَلْ يُعِيدُ صِيَاغَتَهُمْ. قِصَّةُ مُوسَى بُرْهَانٌ أَنَّ الْقِيَادَةَ النَّبَوِيَّةَ لَا تَنْبُعُ مِنَ الْقُوَّةِ الْبَشَرِيَّةِ بَلْ مِنَ الاخْتِيَارِ الإِلَهِيِّ الْعَامِلِ عَبْرَ الضَّعْفِ الْإِنْسَانِيِّ.
passages.translation: The Quran presents the life of Prophet Musa (peace be upon him) as a model of divine pedagogy through trials. Five major trials shaped his prophethood: First, the trial of fear when he fled from Egypt after accidentally killing a man, learning trust despite terror. Second, the trial of poverty when he served for years in Midian, learning humility before leadership. Third, the trial of weakness when he confronted Pharaoh with a speech impediment, realizing that divine strength compensates human weakness. Fourth, the trial of responsibility when he led a rebellious people, learning patience with people. Fifth, the trial of longing when he sought to see Allah directly, learning human limitations before divine majesty. Each trial dismantled a layer of self-reliance, replacing it with divine dependence. Trials are not punishments but divine training sessions—Allah does not break His servants through hardship; He remakes them. Musa's story is proof that prophetic leadership does not spring from human strength but from divine selection working through human weakness.
passages.moralLesson: Trials are divine training, not divine punishment. Allah shapes prophets through weakness, not strength. Musa's journey proves that divine selection works precisely through human limitation—when we acknowledge our incapacity, divine capacity fills the void. True leadership emerges when human ego dies and divine purpose takes the throne.
passages.moralLessonAr: المحن تدريب إلهي، لا عقاب إلهي. يشكل الله الأنبياء عبر الضعف لا القوة. رحلة موسى تثبت أن الاختيار الإلهي يعمل بالضبط عبر القصور البشري—عندما نعترف بعجزنا، تملأ القدرة الإلهية الفراغ. تظهر القيادة الحقيقية عندما تموت الأنا البشرية ويعتلي الهدف الإلهي العرش.

passages.title: The Hadith of Gabriel - Foundations of Religion
