passages.title: The Art of Negotiation
passages.text: الْمُفَاوَضَةُ فَنٌّ يَحْتَاجُ إِلَى دِرَاسَةٍ وَمُمَارَسَةٍ. الْمُفَاوِضُ الْحَاذِقُ يَسْتَمِعُ أَكْثَرَ مِمَّا يَتَكَلَّمُ، وَيُفَكِّرُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَنْطِقَ. عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَعْرِفَ مَصَالِحَ الطَّرَفِ الْآخَرِ كَمَا يَعْرِفُ مَصَالِحَهُ. الْمُفَاوَضَةُ النَّاجِحَةُ لَيْسَتِ انْتِصَارًا لِطَرَفٍ عَلَى آخَرَ، بَلْ هِيَ تَحْقِيقُ مَكَاسِبَ لِلطَّرَفَيْنِ. مِنْ أُصُولِ الْمُفَاوَضَةِ: عَدَمُ التَّسَرُّعِ وَتَجَنُّبُ الْغَضَبِ وَالتَّحَلِّي بِالصَّبْرِ. لَا تُظْهِرْ ضَعْفَكَ وَلَا تَسْتَخِفَّ بِخَصْمِكَ. إِذَا وَصَلْتَ إِلَى طَرِيقٍ مَسْدُودٍ فَاطْلُبِ اسْتِرَاحَةً ثُمَّ عُدْ بِنَظْرَةٍ جَدِيدَةٍ. الْهَدَفُ الْأَسْمَى لِلْمُفَاوَضَةِ هُوَ الْوُصُولُ إِلَى اتِّفَاقٍ يَرْضَى بِهِ الْجَمِيعُ وَيَدُومُ.
passages.translation: Negotiation is an art that requires study and practice. The skilled negotiator listens more than he speaks, and thinks before he utters. He must know the other party's interests as he knows his own. Successful negotiation is not a victory of one party over another, but rather the achievement of gains for both parties. Among the principles of negotiation: avoiding haste, avoiding anger, and exercising patience. Do not show your weakness and do not belittle your opponent. If you reach a dead end, request a break then return with a fresh perspective. The highest goal of negotiation is to reach an agreement that satisfies everyone and endures.
passages.moralLesson: Effective negotiation seeks mutual benefit, not domination. Patience, understanding, and strategic thinking lead to lasting agreements.
passages.moralLessonAr: المفاوضة الفعالة تسعى إلى المنفعة المتبادلة لا الهيمنة. الصبر والتفهم والتفكير الاستراتيجي يؤدي إلى اتفاقات دائمة.

passages.title: War and Peace
passages.text: السَّلَامُ غَايَةٌ نَبِيلَةٌ تَسْعَى إِلَيْهَا الْأُمَمُ الْعَاقِلَةُ. الْحَرْبُ آخِرُ الْحُلُولِ وَلَا يُلْجَأُ إِلَيْهَا إِلَّا عِنْدَ الضَّرُورَةِ الْقُصْوَى. قَالَ تَعَالَى: وَإِنْ جَنَحُوا لِلسَّلْمِ فَاجْنَحْ لَهَا وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى اللهِ. الْهُدْنَةُ فُرْصَةٌ لِلتَّفَاوُضِ وَوَقْفِ نَزِيفِ الدِّمَاءِ. وَلَكِنْ إِذَا فَرَضَ الْعَدُوُّ الْحَرْبَ فَالدِّفَاعُ عَنِ الْوَطَنِ وَاجِبٌ مُقَدَّسٌ. الْقُوَّةُ الْعَسْكَرِيَّةُ وَسِيلَةٌ لِحِمَايَةِ السَّلَامِ لَا لِلْعُدْوَانِ. الدَّوْلَةُ الْقَوِيَّةُ الْمُسَالِمَةُ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الدَّوْلَةِ الضَّعِيفَةِ الْمُعْتَدِيَةِ. السَّلَامُ الْعَادِلُ يَبْنِي وَالْحَرْبُ الظَّالِمَةُ تُدَمِّرُ. اسْتِقْرَارُ الْمِنْطَقَةِ رَهِينٌ بِتَوَازُنِ الْقُوَى وَاحْتِرَامِ السِّيَادَةِ.
passages.translation: Peace is a noble goal that wise nations strive for. War is the last resort and should only be resorted to in cases of extreme necessity. Allah the Most High said: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it and trust in Allah. A truce is an opportunity for negotiation and to stop the bleeding. However, if the enemy imposes war, then defending the homeland is a sacred duty. Military force is a means to protect peace, not for aggression. A strong peaceful state is better than a weak aggressive state. Just peace builds and unjust war destroys. The region's stability depends on the balance of power and respect for sovereignty.
passages.moralLesson: Peace should always be the goal, but strength is necessary to preserve it. Just defense is noble; unjust aggression brings destruction.
passages.moralLessonAr: السلام يجب أن يكون الهدف دائمًا، لكن القوة ضرورية للحفاظ عليه. الدفاع العادل نبيل والعدوان الظالم يجلب الدمار.

passages.title: Alliances and Interests
passages.text: التَّحَالُفُ بَيْنَ الدُّوَلِ قَائِمٌ عَلَى الْمَصَالِحِ الْمُشْتَرَكَةِ. لَا صَدَاقَةَ دَائِمَةً وَلَا عَدَاوَةَ دَائِمَةً، بَلْ مَصَالِحُ دَائِمَةٌ. الدَّوْلَةُ الْحَكِيمَةُ تُنَوِّعُ تَحَالُفَاتِهَا وَلَا تَضَعُ بَيْضَهَا فِي سَلَّةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ. التَّبَعِيَّةُ لِدَوْلَةٍ كُبْرَى خَطَرٌ عَلَى الِاسْتِقْلَالِ. الْقُوَى الْعُظْمَى تَسْعَى لِتَحْقِيقِ مَصَالِحِهَا أَوَّلًا، وَعَلَى الدُّوَلِ الصَّغِيرَةِ أَنْ تَفْهَمَ هَذِهِ الْحَقِيقَةَ. التَّوَازُنُ فِي الْعَلَاقَاتِ الدَّوْلِيَّةِ يَحْمِي مِنَ الِانْحِيَازِ الْمُضِرِّ. مَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يُحْتَرَمَ فَلْيَكُنْ قَوِيًّا بِاقْتِصَادِهِ وَجَيْشِهِ وَعِلْمِهِ وَوَحْدَةِ شَعْبِهِ.
passages.translation: Alliance between states is based on common interests. There is no permanent friendship and no permanent enmity, but only permanent interests. The wise state diversifies its alliances and does not put all its eggs in one basket. Dependence on a major power is dangerous to independence. Great powers seek to achieve their interests first, and small states must understand this reality. Balance in international relations protects from harmful bias. Whoever wants to be respected must be strong in his economy, army, knowledge, and unity of his people.
passages.moralLesson: States must be strategic about alliances, maintaining independence while pursuing mutual interests. True respect comes from internal strength.
passages.moralLessonAr: يجب على الدول أن تكون استراتيجية في تحالفاتها، والحفاظ على الاستقلال مع السعي وراء المصالح المشتركة. الاحترام الحقيقي يأتي من القوة الداخلية.

passages.title: Regional Cooperation
passages.text: دُوَلُ الْمِنْطَقَةِ الْوَاحِدَةِ تَجْمَعُهَا رَوَابِطُ اللُّغَةِ وَالدِّينِ وَالتَّارِيخِ وَالْجُغْرَافْيَا. التَّعَاوُنُ بَيْنَهَا ضَرُورَةٌ لَا تَرَفٌ. الْمُنَظَّمَاتُ الْإِقْلِيمِيَّةُ تُوَفِّرُ إِطَارًا لِلْحِوَارِ وَحَلِّ النِّزَاعَاتِ بِالطُّرُقِ السِّلْمِيَّةِ. التَّكَامُلُ الِاقْتِصَادِيُّ يَرْفَعُ مُسْتَوَى الْمَعِيشَةِ لِلشُّعُوبِ. الْأَمْنُ الْجَمَاعِيُّ يَحْمِي مِنَ التَّدَخُّلَاتِ الْخَارِجِيَّةِ. التَّفَرُّقُ يُضْعِفُ وَالتَّجَمُّعُ يُقَوِّي. الِاخْتِلَافَاتُ السِّيَاسِيَّةُ الدَّاخِلِيَّةُ يَجِبُ أَلَّا تُعِيقَ التَّعَاوُنَ فِي الْقَضَايَا الْمَصِيرِيَّةِ. إِذَا اتَّحَدَتِ الْأُمَّةُ صَارَتْ قُوَّةً عَالَمِيَّةً مُؤَثِّرَةً.
passages.translation: States of one region are connected by the bonds of language, religion, history, and geography. Cooperation between them is a necessity, not a luxury. Regional organizations provide a framework for dialogue and resolving disputes through peaceful means. Economic integration raises the standard of living for peoples. Collective security protects from external interventions. Disunity weakens and unity strengthens. Internal political differences must not hinder cooperation on existential issues. If the nation unites, it becomes an influential global power.
grammaticalConcepts: Form II verbs (توفر، يُضعف، يُقوي، تُعيق)
passages.moralLesson: Regional unity based on shared heritage creates strength. Internal disputes should not prevent cooperation on matters vital to all.
passages.moralLessonAr: الوحدة الإقليمية القائمة على التراث المشترك تخلق القوة. الخلافات الداخلية يجب ألا تمنع التعاون في الأمور الحيوية للجميع.

passages.title: Non-Interference and Sovereignty
passages.text: سِيَادَةُ الدَّوْلَةِ عَلَى أَرْضِهَا مَبْدَأٌ أَسَاسِيٌّ فِي الْقَانُونِ الدَّوْلِيِّ. لِكُلِّ دَوْلَةٍ الْحَقُّ فِي اخْتِيَارِ نِظَامِهَا السِّيَاسِيِّ وَتَحْدِيدِ سِيَاسَاتِهَا الدَّاخِلِيَّةِ. التَّدَخُّلُ فِي الشُّؤُونِ الدَّاخِلِيَّةِ لِلدُّوَلِ يُثِيرُ الْفَوْضَى وَيُهَدِّدُ الْأَمْنَ. الْقُوَى الْكُبْرَى أَحْيَانًا تَتَذَرَّعُ بِحُقُوقِ الْإِنْسَانِ أَوِ الدِّيمُقْرَاطِيَّةِ لِتَبْرِيرِ تَدَخُّلَاتِهَا. الْحَذَرُ وَاجِبٌ مِنْ هَذِهِ الذَّرَائِعِ. الْإِصْلَاحُ يَجِبُ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ مِنَ الدَّاخِلِ لَا أَنْ يُفْرَضَ مِنَ الْخَارِجِ. تَغْيِيرُ الْأَنْظِمَةِ بِالْقُوَّةِ الْخَارِجِيَّةِ أَثْبَتَ فَشَلَهُ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْحَالَاتِ.
passages.translation: State sovereignty over its land is a fundamental principle in international law. Every state has the right to choose its political system and determine its internal policies. Interference in the internal affairs of states causes chaos and threatens security. Major powers sometimes use human rights or democracy as pretexts to justify their interventions. Caution is required against these pretexts. Reform must come from within, not be imposed from outside. Changing regimes by external force has proven its failure in many cases.
grammaticalConcepts: لكل دولة الحق (every state has the right)
Form V verb (تتذرع - use as pretext)
passages.moralLesson: Sovereignty is sacred in international relations. Genuine reform comes from within societies, not through external intervention regardless of justification.
passages.moralLessonAr: السيادة مقدسة في العلاقات الدولية. الإصلاح الحقيقي يأتي من داخل المجتمعات لا من خلال التدخل الخارجي بغض النظر عن المبررات.

passages.title: The Spy's Burden
passages.text: الْجَاسُوسُ يَعِيشُ فِي ظِلَالِ الْخَوْفِ. يَتَظَاهَرُ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ. يَكْذِبُ لِيَحْمِيَ قَوْمَهُ. يُصَادِقُ أَعْدَاءَهُ وَيَبْتَسِمُ لِمَنْ يُرِيدُ هَلَاكَهُمْ. حَيَاتُهُ أَكَاذِيبُ فَوْقَ أَكَاذِيبَ. لَا يَسْتَطِيعُ أَنْ يَثِقَ بِأَحَدٍ. إِنْ كُشِفَ أَمْرُهُ فَمَصِيرُهُ الْمَوْتُ. يَحْمِلُ أَسْرَارًا لَا يَسْتَطِيعُ الْبَوْحَ بِهَا حَتَّى لِأَقْرَبِ النَّاسِ إِلَيْهِ. هَلْ يَسْتَحِقُّ الْوَطَنُ كُلَّ هَذَا؟
passages.translation: The spy lives in the shadows of fear. He pretends to be what he is not. He lies to protect his people. He befriends his enemies and smiles at those whose destruction he seeks. His life is lies upon lies. He cannot trust anyone. If he is discovered, his fate is death. He carries secrets he cannot reveal even to those closest to him. Does the homeland deserve all this?
grammaticalConcepts: Present tense verbs for habitual action
passages.moralLesson: Those who work in the shadows sacrifice their peace for their nation's security. Their burden is heavy and their reward is often only silence.
passages.moralLessonAr: الذين يعملون في الظلال يضحون بسلامهم من أجل أمن وطنهم. عبؤهم ثقيل وجزاؤهم غالبًا الصمت فقط.

passages.title: The Informant's Dilemma
passages.text: كَانَ أَحْمَدُ يَعْمَلُ مُخْبِرًا لِلْجَيْشِ. يُخْبِرُهُمْ بِتَحَرُّكَاتِ الْمُسَلَّحِينَ فِي قَرْيَتِهِ. قَالُوا لَهُ: أَنْتَ تُنْقِذُ الْأَبْرِيَاءَ مِنَ الْمَوْتِ. لَكِنَّ جِيرَانَهُ يُسَمُّونَهُ خَائِنًا. أَبْنَاءُ عَمِّهِ لَا يُكَلِّمُونَهُ. زَوْجَتُهُ تَبْكِي كُلَّ لَيْلَةٍ خَوْفًا عَلَيْهِ. يَسْأَلُ نَفْسَهُ: مَنِ الْخَائِنُ الْحَقِيقِيُّ؟ أَنَا أَمِ الَّذِينَ يَقْتُلُونَ الْأَبْرِيَاءَ؟
passages.translation: Ahmad worked as an informant for the army. He tells them about the movements of armed men in his village. They told him: You are saving innocents from death. But his neighbors call him a traitor. His cousins don't speak to him. His wife cries every night fearing for him. He asks himself: Who is the real traitor? Me or those who kill the innocent?
passages.moralLesson: Moral choices in conflict zones are rarely black and white. What appears as betrayal to some may be salvation to others.
passages.moralLessonAr: الخيارات الأخلاقية في مناطق الصراع نادرًا ما تكون واضحة. ما يبدو خيانة للبعض قد يكون إنقاذًا للآخرين.

passages.title: The Checkpoint
passages.text: عِنْدَ نُقْطَةِ التَّفْتِيشِ يَقِفُ الْجُنْدِيُّ الشَّابُّ. يَنْظُرُ إِلَى كُلِّ سَيَّارَةٍ بِرَيْبَةٍ. هَلْ هَذَا الرَّجُلُ بَرِيءٌ أَمْ يَحْمِلُ مُتَفَجِّرَاتٍ؟ قَرَارٌ خَاطِئٌ قَدْ يَقْتُلُ أَبْرِيَاءَ. تَرَدُّدٌ قَدْ يَقْتُلُهُ هُوَ وَزُمَلَاءَهُ. ثَوَانٍ تَمُرُّ كَالسَّاعَاتِ. الْعَرَقُ يَسِيلُ عَلَى جَبِينِهِ. يَرْفَعُ يَدَهُ: قِفْ! أَوْ أَشَرْ بِالْمُرُورِ؟ حَيَاتُهُ وَحَيَاةُ الْآخَرِينَ تَتَوَقَّفُ عَلَى قَرَارِهِ.
passages.translation: At the checkpoint stands the young soldier. He looks at every car with suspicion. Is this man innocent or carrying explosives? A wrong decision could kill innocents. Hesitation could kill him and his colleagues. Seconds pass like hours. Sweat drips on his forehead. He raises his hand: Stop! Or wave them through? His life and the lives of others depend on his decision.
passages.moralLesson: Those who guard security face impossible choices in moments. The weight of life and death decisions shapes their souls forever.
passages.moralLessonAr: الذين يحرسون الأمن يواجهون خيارات مستحيلة في لحظات. ثقل قرارات الحياة والموت يشكل أرواحهم للأبد.

passages.title: The Double Agent
passages.text: يُعْطِيهِ الطَّرَفَانِ مَعْلُومَاتٍ. يُعْطِي الطَّرَفَيْنِ مَعْلُومَاتٍ. يَأْخُذُ مِنْهُمْ مَالًا وَثِقَةً. لَا يَعْرِفُونَ أَنَّهُ يَخْدُمُ الْآخَرَ. أَمْ هُوَ لَا يَخْدُمُ أَحَدًا إِلَّا نَفْسَهُ؟ يَوْمًا مَا سَيَنْكَشِفُ. وَحِينَئِذٍ سَيَطْلُبُهُ الْجَانِبَانِ لِلْقَتْلِ. لَكِنَّهُ يَعِيشُ الْيَوْمَ كَأَنَّهُ سَيَعِيشُ أَبَدًا. الْمَالُ كَثِيرٌ وَالْخَطَرُ بَعِيدٌ - هَكَذَا يُخَادِعُ نَفْسَهُ.
passages.translation: Both sides give him information. He gives both sides information. He takes money and trust from them. They don't know he serves the other. Or does he serve no one but himself? One day he will be exposed. And then both sides will seek to kill him. But he lives today as if he will live forever. The money is plenty and the danger is far - thus he deceives himself.
grammaticalConcepts: Form VII verb (ينكشف - to be exposed)
passages.moralLesson: Those who betray everyone end up alone. Self-deception is the most dangerous lie of all.
passages.moralLessonAr: الذين يخونون الجميع ينتهي بهم الأمر وحيدين. خداع النفس أخطر أنواع الكذب.

passages.title: The Undercover Operation
passages.text: دَخَلَ الضَّابِطُ فِي عُمْقِ صُفُوفِ الْعَدُوِّ مُتَنَكِّرًا. غَيَّرَ اسْمَهُ وَلَهْجَتَهُ وَمَلَامِحَهُ. تَعَلَّمَ عَادَاتِهِمْ وَصَلَّى صَلَاتَهُمْ وَأَكَلَ طَعَامَهُمْ. عَاشَ مَعَهُمْ سَنَوَاتٍ حَتَّى نَسِيَ أَحْيَانًا مَنْ هُوَ حَقًّا. صَارَ يَفْهَمُ لِمَاذَا يُقَاتِلُونَ. رَأَى أَطْفَالَهُمْ وَأُمَّهَاتِهِمْ. سَمِعَ أَحْزَانَهُمْ وَآمَالَهُمْ. ثُمَّ جَاءَ الْأَمْرُ: أَعْطِنَا مَوَاقِعَهُمْ. تَرَدَّدَ لَحْظَةً. هَؤُلَاءِ بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا. لَكِنَّ الْوَاجِبَ وَاضِحٌ. أَرْسَلَ الْإِحْدَاثِيَّاتِ. فِي الصَّبَاحِ كَانَ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ رَمَادًا. وَعَادَ بَطَلًا. لَكِنَّ شَيْئًا فِي دَاخِلِهِ مَاتَ أَيْضًا.
passages.translation: The officer entered deep into enemy lines disguised. He changed his name, his accent, and his features. He learned their customs, prayed their prayers, and ate their food. He lived with them for years until he sometimes forgot who he truly was. He came to understand why they fight. He saw their children and mothers. He heard their sorrows and hopes. Then the order came: Give us their positions. He hesitated for a moment. These are humans like us. But duty was clear. He sent the coordinates. In the morning, everything was ashes. And he returned a hero. But something inside him died as well.
passages.moralLesson: Victory in covert warfare often comes at the cost of one's humanity. The line between duty and conscience can tear a person apart.
passages.moralLessonAr: النصر في الحرب السرية غالبًا ما يأتي على حساب إنسانية المرء. الخط بين الواجب والضمير قد يمزق الإنسان.

passages.title: The Handler and the Asset
passages.text: قَالَ الْمُشْرِفُ لِلْعَمِيلِ: أَنْتَ أَدَاةٌ فِي يَدِ الدَّوْلَةِ. لَا تَنْسَ ذَلِكَ أَبَدًا. الْعَمِيلُ يَعْرِفُ الْحَقِيقَةَ: إِذَا فَشِلَ فَسَيُنْكِرُونَهُ. إِذَا قُتِلَ فَلَنْ يَعْتَرِفُوا بِهِ. عَائِلَتُهُ لَنْ تَعْرِفَ كَيْفَ مَاتَ. قَبْرُهُ سَيَكُونُ بِلَا اسْمٍ. لَكِنَّهُ يَسْتَمِرُّ. لِمَاذَا؟ لِأَنَّ هُنَاكَ شَيْئًا أَكْبَرَ مِنْهُ يُؤْمِنُ بِهِ. أَوْ رُبَّمَا لِأَنَّهُ لَا يَعْرِفُ حَيَاةً أُخْرَى. الْمُشْرِفُ يَقُولُ: أَنْتَ بَطَلٌ مَجْهُولٌ. الْعَمِيلُ يَفْكِرُ: أَنَا ضَحِيَّةٌ مَجْهُولَةٌ. كِلَاهُمَا صَادِقٌ.
passages.translation: The handler told the asset: You are a tool in the hand of the state. Never forget that. The asset knows the truth: If he fails, they will deny him. If he is killed, they will not acknowledge him. His family will not know how he died. His grave will be nameless. But he continues. Why? Because there is something bigger than himself he believes in. Or perhaps because he knows no other life. The handler says: You are an unknown hero. The asset thinks: I am an unknown victim. Both are truthful.
passages.moralLesson: The relationship between intelligence services and their agents is transactional. Heroes and victims can be the same person depending on perspective.
passages.moralLessonAr: العلاقة بين أجهزة الاستخبارات وعملائها علاقة نفعية. الأبطال والضحايا قد يكونون نفس الشخص حسب المنظور.

passages.title: The Interrogation Room
passages.text: فِي غُرْفَةٍ بِلَا نَوَافِذَ يَجْلِسُ رَجُلَانِ. أَحَدُهُمَا يَسْأَلُ وَالْآخَرُ يَصْمُتُ. الْمُحَقِّقُ يَعْرِفُ أَنَّ الصَّمْتَ سَيَنْكَسِرُ. كُلُّ إِنْسَانٍ لَهُ نُقْطَةُ ضَعْفٍ. الْمَسْجُونُ يَعْرِفُ أَنَّ كَلِمَةً وَاحِدَةً قَدْ تَقْتُلُ رِفَاقَهُ. سَاعَاتٌ تَمُرُّ. لَا نَوْمَ. لَا طَعَامَ. الضَّوْءُ الْقَوِيُّ لَا يَنْطَفِئُ. الْأَسْئِلَةُ تَتَكَرَّرُ: أَيْنَ هُمْ؟ مَنِ الْقَائِدُ؟ مَاذَا يُخَطِّطُونَ؟ الصَّمْتُ مُقَاوَمَةٌ. الْكَلَامُ اسْتِسْلَامٌ. بَيْنَهُمَا يَقَعُ الْإِنْسَانُ وَيُخْتَبَرُ.
passages.translation: In a room with no windows sit two men. One asks and the other is silent. The interrogator knows silence will break. Every person has a weak point. The prisoner knows that a single word could kill his comrades. Hours pass. No sleep. No food. The bright light never goes out. The questions repeat: Where are they? Who is the leader? What are they planning? Silence is resistance. Speech is surrender. Between them, the human falls and is tested.
grammaticalConcepts: Negation without verb (لا نوم، لا طعام)
passages.moralLesson: Interrogation is a battle of wills where human dignity is tested. Loyalty and survival pull in opposite directions.
passages.moralLessonAr: الاستجواب معركة إرادات حيث تُختبر الكرامة الإنسانية. الولاء والبقاء يجذبان في اتجاهين متعاكسين.

passages.title: The Targeted Killing
passages.text: فِي غُرْفَةِ الْعَمَلِيَّاتِ يُرَاقِبُونَ الشَّاشَةَ. نُقْطَةٌ تَتَحَرَّكُ. إِنَّهُ الْهَدَفُ. سَنَوَاتٌ مِنَ التَّخْطِيطِ لِهَذِهِ اللَّحْظَةِ. الْجِنِرَالُ يَسْأَلُ: هَلْ نَحْنُ مُتَأَكِّدُونَ؟ الضَّابِطُ يُجِيبُ: ثِقَةٌ عَالِيَةٌ. يُوجَدُ أَطْفَالٌ فِي الْبِنَايَةِ؟ رُبَّمَا. كَمْ؟ لَا نَعْلَمُ. لَحْظَةُ صَمْتٍ. هَذَا الرَّجُلُ قَتَلَ الْمِئَاتِ وَسَيَقْتُلُ الْمِئَاتِ. الْقَرَارُ: نَفِّذُوا. صَارُوخٌ يَنْطَلِقُ. انْفِجَارٌ. صَمْتٌ. فِي الْغُرْفَةِ لَا أَحَدَ يَبْتَسِمُ. انْتَصَرْنَا. لَكِنْ بِأَيِّ ثَمَنٍ؟
passages.translation: In the operations room they watch the screen. A point moves. It is the target. Years of planning for this moment. The general asks: Are we certain? The officer answers: High confidence. Are there children in the building? Perhaps. How many? We don't know. A moment of silence. This man has killed hundreds and will kill hundreds more. The decision: Execute. A missile launches. Explosion. Silence. In the room no one smiles. We won. But at what cost?
passages.moralLesson: Modern warfare allows killing from a distance, but moral responsibility cannot be delegated to technology. Every decision to kill carries weight.
passages.moralLessonAr: الحرب الحديثة تسمح بالقتل من مسافة، لكن المسؤولية الأخلاقية لا يمكن تفويضها للتكنولوجيا. كل قرار بالقتل يحمل ثقلًا.

passages.title: The Defector
passages.text: جَاءَ الرَّجُلُ مِنَ الْجَانِبِ الْآخَرِ. قَالَ: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُسَاعِدَكُمْ. سَأَلُوهُ: لِمَاذَا تَخُونُ قَوْمَكَ؟ أَجَابَ: لَيْسَ خِيَانَةً. أَنَا أُحَاوِلُ إِنْقَاذَهُمْ مِنْ قِيَادَةٍ مَجْنُونَةٍ. أَوْ رُبَّمَا أُنْقِذُ نَفْسِي فَقَطْ. لَا أَعْرِفُ بَعْدَ الْآنَ. فَتَّشُوهُ. اخْتَبَرُوهُ. هَلْ هُوَ صَادِقٌ أَمْ مَزْرُوعٌ؟ الْمَعْلُومَاتُ الَّتِي قَدَّمَهَا صَحِيحَةٌ. لَكِنْ لِمَاذَا؟ لِيَكْسِبَ ثِقَتَهُمْ ثُمَّ يَخُونَهُمْ؟ فِي عَالَمِ الْجَوَاسِيسِ لَا أَحَدَ يَثِقُ بِأَحَدٍ. حَتَّى الْمُنْشَقُّ لَا يَثِقُ بِنَفْسِهِ.
passages.translation: The man came from the other side. He said: I want to help you. They asked him: Why do you betray your people? He answered: It is not betrayal. I am trying to save them from a mad leadership. Or perhaps I am only saving myself. I don't know anymore. They searched him. They tested him. Is he truthful or planted? The information he provided is correct. But why? To gain their trust then betray them? In the world of spies, no one trusts anyone. Even the defector doesn't trust himself.
passages.moralLesson: Defection blurs all lines - between loyalty and survival, truth and deception, heroism and treachery. Even the defector may not know his own motives.
passages.moralLessonAr: الانشقاق يطمس كل الخطوط - بين الولاء والبقاء، الحقيقة والخداع، البطولة والخيانة. حتى المنشق قد لا يعرف دوافعه الحقيقية.

passages.title: The Safe House
passages.text: فِي شَقَّةٍ صَغِيرَةٍ يَخْتَبِئُ الْفَرِيقُ. النَّوَافِذُ مُغْلَقَةٌ. السَّتَائِرُ مُسْدَلَةٌ. لَا أَحَدَ يَخْرُجُ إِلَّا لِلضَّرُورَةِ. الْجِيرَانُ لَا يَعْرِفُونَ مَنْ يَسْكُنُ بِجَانِبِهِمْ. رَجُلٌ وَامْرَأَةٌ يَتَظَاهَرَانِ بِأَنَّهُمَا زَوْجَانِ. الْهَاتِفُ مَقْطُوعٌ. التَّوَاصُلُ بِرَسَائِلَ مُشَفَّرَةٍ فَقَطْ. الِانْتِظَارُ صَعْبٌ. الْخَوْفُ مُسْتَمِرٌّ. مَتَى تَبْدَأُ الْعَمَلِيَّةُ؟ لَا أَحَدَ يَعْرِفُ. الصَّبْرُ سِلَاحُهُمُ الْوَحِيدُ.
passages.translation: In a small apartment the team hides. The windows are closed. The curtains are drawn. No one goes out except for necessity. The neighbors don't know who lives beside them. A man and woman pretend to be a married couple. The phone is disconnected. Communication is only by encrypted messages. The waiting is hard. The fear is constant. When does the operation begin? No one knows. Patience is their only weapon.
passages.moralLesson: Covert operations require patience and discipline. The hardest battles are sometimes fought while waiting in silence.
passages.moralLessonAr: العمليات السرية تتطلب الصبر والانضباط. أصعب المعارك أحيانًا تُخاض في انتظار صامت.

passages.title: The Rules of Engagement
passages.text: قَبْلَ كُلِّ عَمَلِيَّةٍ يَقْرَأُونَ الْقَوَاعِدَ. لَا تَقْتُلْ مَدَنِيًّا. لَا تُعَذِّبْ أَسِيرًا. لَا تَسْتَخْدِمْ قُوَّةً مُفْرِطَةً. الْقَوَاعِدُ وَاضِحَةٌ عَلَى الْوَرَقِ. لَكِنْ فِي الْمَيْدَانِ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ رَمَادِيٌّ. الطِّفْلُ الَّذِي يَحْمِلُ حَقِيبَةً - مَدَنِيٌّ أَمْ تَهْدِيدٌ؟ الرَّجُلُ الْجَرِيحُ الَّذِي يَمُدُّ يَدَهُ - يَسْتَسْلِمُ أَمْ يُخْفِي سِلَاحًا؟ ثَانِيَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ لِلْقَرَارِ. حَيَاتُكَ أَوْ ضَمِيرُكَ. الَّذِينَ يَكْتُبُونَ الْقَوَاعِدَ لَا يُوَاجِهُونَ هَذِهِ اللَّحَظَاتِ. الْجُنْدِيُّ يُوَاجِهُهَا كُلَّ يَوْمٍ.
passages.translation: Before every operation they read the rules. Do not kill a civilian. Do not torture a prisoner. Do not use excessive force. The rules are clear on paper. But in the field, everything is gray. The child carrying a bag - civilian or threat? The wounded man extending his hand - surrendering or hiding a weapon? One second to decide. Your life or your conscience. Those who write the rules don't face these moments. The soldier faces them every day.
passages.moralLesson: Rules of engagement are essential but cannot capture the chaos of battle. Those who make the rules must understand the impossible choices soldiers face.
passages.moralLessonAr: قواعد الاشتباك ضرورية لكنها لا تستطيع التقاط فوضى المعركة. الذين يضعون القواعد يجب أن يفهموا الخيارات المستحيلة التي يواجهها الجنود.

passages.title: The Hostage
passages.text: أَيَّامٌ فِي الظَّلَامِ. لَا يَعْرِفُ اللَّيْلَ مِنَ النَّهَارِ. يَدَاهُ مُقَيَّدَتَانِ. عَيْنَاهُ مَعْصُوبَتَانِ. يَسْمَعُ أَصْوَاتًا غَرِيبَةً. يَشُمُّ رَائِحَةَ الرُّطُوبَةِ. الْخَاطِفُونَ يَتَكَلَّمُونَ لُغَةً لَا يَفْهَمُهَا. هَلْ يَبْحَثُ عَنْهُ أَحَدٌ؟ هَلْ سَتَدْفَعُ حُكُومَتُهُ الْفِدْيَةَ؟ أَمْ سَتَتْرُكُهُ لِمَصِيرِهِ؟ الْأَمَلُ يَضْعُفُ. الْإِيمَانُ يَبْقَى. يُصَلِّي فِي صَمْتٍ. اللهُ مَعَهُ حَتَّى فِي هَذَا الْقَبْرِ.
passages.translation: Days in darkness. He doesn't know night from day. His hands are bound. His eyes are blindfolded. He hears strange voices. He smells dampness. The kidnappers speak a language he doesn't understand. Is anyone searching for him? Will his government pay the ransom? Or will they leave him to his fate? Hope weakens. Faith remains. He prays in silence. Allah is with him even in this grave.
passages.moralLesson: In the darkest moments, faith becomes the only light. Those held captive find strength in what cannot be taken from them.
passages.moralLessonAr: في أحلك اللحظات، يصبح الإيمان النور الوحيد. المحتجزون يجدون قوتهم فيما لا يمكن أن يُسلب منهم.

passages.title: The Border Crossing
passages.text: فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ يَزْحَفُونَ نَحْوَ الْحُدُودِ. الصَّمْتُ ضَرُورِيٌّ. صَوْتٌ وَاحِدٌ قَدْ يَعْنِي الْمَوْتَ. الْحُرَّاسُ قَرِيبُونَ. الْكِلَابُ تَنْبَحُ. الْأَضْوَاءُ تَبْحَثُ. مِئَةُ مِتْرٍ فَقَطْ إِلَى الْحُرِّيَّةِ. أَوْ إِلَى الْمَوْتِ. كُلُّ خُطْوَةٍ مُقَامَرَةٌ. التُّرَابُ تَحْتَ أَيْدِيهِمْ بَارِدٌ. قُلُوبُهُمْ تَدُقُّ كَالطُّبُولِ. أَخِيرًا - الْجَانِبُ الْآخَرُ. نَجَوْا. لَكِنْ كَمْ تَرَكُوا خَلْفَهُمْ؟
passages.translation: In the dead of night they crawl toward the border. Silence is necessary. One sound could mean death. The guards are close. Dogs bark. Searchlights sweep. Only a hundred meters to freedom. Or to death. Every step is a gamble. The soil under their hands is cold. Their hearts pound like drums. Finally - the other side. They survived. But how much did they leave behind?
passages.moralLesson: Freedom sometimes requires risking everything. Those who cross borders in darkness carry invisible burdens of what they left behind.
passages.moralLessonAr: الحرية أحيانًا تتطلب المخاطرة بكل شيء. الذين يعبرون الحدود في الظلام يحملون أعباءً خفية مما تركوه خلفهم.

passages.title: The Sleeper Cell
passages.text: سَنَوَاتٌ يَعِيشُ كَجَارٍ عَادِيٍّ. يَذْهَبُ إِلَى الْعَمَلِ. يُحَيِّي الْجِيرَانَ. يَلْعَبُ مَعَ أَطْفَالِهِ. لَا أَحَدَ يَشُكُّ فِيهِ. لَكِنَّ الْهَاتِفَ قَدْ يَرِنُّ يَوْمًا. الرِّسَالَةُ قَدْ تَأْتِي. وَحِينَئِذٍ يَتَحَوَّلُ مِنْ أَبٍ وَزَوْجٍ إِلَى جُنْدِيٍّ. سَنَوَاتُ الِانْتِظَارِ تَنْتَهِي. الْمُهِمَّةُ تَبْدَأُ. هَلْ سَيَفْعَلُهَا؟ أَمْ أَنَّ الْحَيَاةَ الْجَدِيدَةَ غَيَّرَتْهُ؟
passages.translation: For years he lives as an ordinary neighbor. He goes to work. He greets the neighbors. He plays with his children. No one suspects him. But the phone may ring one day. The message may come. And then he transforms from a father and husband into a soldier. Years of waiting end. The mission begins. Will he do it? Or has the new life changed him?
passages.moralLesson: Identity can be layered. Years of living a cover life may change the operative more than they expect.
passages.moralLessonAr: الهوية يمكن أن تكون متعددة الطبقات. سنوات من عيش حياة التمويه قد تغير العميل أكثر مما يتوقع.

passages.title: The Operative's Family
passages.text: زَوْجَتُهُ تَعْرِفُ أَنَّهُ لَيْسَ تَاجِرًا. لَكِنَّهَا لَا تَسْأَلُ. الْأَطْفَالُ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ: لِمَاذَا يُسَافِرُ أَبِي كَثِيرًا؟ لِمَاذَا لَا يَتَكَلَّمُ عَنْ عَمَلِهِ؟ الْجَدَّةُ تَقُولُ: أَبُوكُمْ رَجُلٌ مُهِمٌّ. يَحْمِي الْوَطَنَ. لَكِنْ كَيْفَ؟ لَا أَحَدَ يَعْرِفُ. يَوْمًا قَدْ لَا يَعُودُ. سَتَأْتِي رِسَالَةٌ رَسْمِيَّةٌ. وَدَفْنٌ بِلَا جُثَّةٍ. وَمِيرَاثٌ مِنَ الْأَسْئِلَةِ. الْعَائِلَاتُ تَدْفَعُ ثَمَنَ الْأَسْرَارِ. الْأَطْفَالُ يَكْبَرُونَ بِظِلَالِ أَبٍ غَائِبٍ. هَذَا ثَمَنُ الْخِدْمَةِ الَّذِي لَا يُذْكَرُ فِي الْمَلَفَّاتِ.
passages.translation: His wife knows he is not a merchant. But she doesn't ask. The children wonder: Why does our father travel so much? Why doesn't he talk about his work? Grandmother says: Your father is an important man. He protects the homeland. But how? No one knows. One day he may not return. An official letter will come. A burial without a body. An inheritance of questions. Families pay the price of secrets. Children grow up in the shadow of an absent father. This is the cost of service that isn't mentioned in the files.
passages.moralLesson: Those who serve in silence leave their families with unanswered questions. The cost of secrets extends far beyond the operative.
passages.moralLessonAr: الذين يخدمون في صمت يتركون عائلاتهم مع أسئلة بلا إجابات. ثمن الأسرار يمتد إلى ما هو أبعد من العميل.

passages.title: The Failed Mission
passages.text: الْخُطَّةُ كَانَتْ مِثَالِيَّةً. الْمَعْلُومَاتُ كَانَتْ دَقِيقَةً. الْفَرِيقُ كَانَ مُدَرَّبًا. لَكِنَّ شَيْئًا حَدَثَ. رُبَّمَا خَائِنٌ بَيْنَهُمْ. رُبَّمَا صُدْفَةٌ. رُبَّمَا قَدَرٌ. الْآنَ ثَلَاثَةٌ مِنْهُمْ أَمْوَاتٌ. وَاثْنَانِ فِي الْأَسْرِ. وَالْقَائِدُ يَكْتُبُ التَّقْرِيرَ. كَيْفَ يَشْرَحُ لِلْعَائِلَاتِ؟ كَيْفَ يَنَامُ اللَّيْلَةَ؟ الْفَشَلُ فِي هَذَا الْعَمَلِ لَيْسَ خَسَارَةَ مَالٍ. إِنَّهُ خَسَارَةُ أَرْوَاحٍ. وَالْأَرْوَاحُ لَا تُعَوَّضُ.
passages.translation: The plan was perfect. The intelligence was accurate. The team was trained. But something happened. Perhaps a traitor among them. Perhaps coincidence. Perhaps fate. Now three of them are dead. And two are in captivity. And the commander writes the report. How does he explain to the families? How does he sleep tonight? Failure in this work is not loss of money. It is loss of souls. And souls cannot be replaced.
passages.moralLesson: No amount of planning can guarantee success. Leaders must carry the weight of failed missions and lost lives.
passages.moralLessonAr: لا يمكن لأي قدر من التخطيط أن يضمن النجاح. القادة يجب أن يحملوا ثقل المهام الفاشلة والأرواح الضائعة.

passages.title: The Recruitment
passages.text: يَرْصُدُونَهُ مُنْذُ أَشْهُرٍ. يَعْرِفُونَ نِقَاطَ ضَعْفِهِ. دُيُونٌ كَثِيرَةٌ. زَوْجَةٌ مَرِيضَةٌ. طُمُوحٌ لَمْ يَتَحَقَّقْ. يَقْتَرِبُ مِنْهُ الضَّابِطُ كَصَدِيقٍ. يُقَدِّمُ لَهُ الْمُسَاعَدَةَ. ثُمَّ يَطْلُبُ خِدْمَةً صَغِيرَةً. ثُمَّ أُخْرَى. ثُمَّ أُخْرَى. الْآنَ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُ التَّرَاجُعَ. الشَّبَكَةُ أَحْكَمَتْ عَلَيْهِ. صَارَ عَمِيلًا بِلَا أَنْ يُدْرِكَ مَتَى عَبَرَ الْخَطَّ. هَكَذَا يَسْقُطُ الْكِبَارُ. لَيْسَ بِالْإِغْرَاءِ الْكَبِيرِ. بَلْ بِخُطُوَاتٍ صَغِيرَةٍ.
passages.translation: They've been watching him for months. They know his weak points. Many debts. A sick wife. Unfulfilled ambition. The officer approaches him as a friend. Offers him help. Then asks for a small favor. Then another. Then another. Now he cannot retreat. The net has closed on him. He became an agent without realizing when he crossed the line. This is how the great ones fall. Not through big temptation. But through small steps.
passages.moralLesson: Recruitment exploits human weakness through gradual entanglement. By the time the target realizes, the trap has already closed.
passages.moralLessonAr: التجنيد يستغل الضعف البشري من خلال التورط التدريجي. عندما يدرك الهدف، تكون المصيدة قد أُغلقت بالفعل.

passages.title: The Witness
passages.text: رَأَى مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ يَجِبُ أَنْ يَرَاهُ. الْآنَ هُمْ يَبْحَثُونَ عَنْهُ. غَيَّرَ اسْمَهُ. غَيَّرَ مَدِينَتَهُ. غَيَّرَ شَكْلَهُ. لَكِنَّ الْخَوْفَ لَا يَتَغَيَّرُ. كُلُّ طَرْقَةٍ عَلَى الْبَابِ تُوقِفُ قَلْبَهُ. كُلُّ وَجْهٍ غَرِيبٍ يُثِيرُ شَكَّهُ. هَلْ يَسْتَطِيعُ أَنْ يَعِيشَ هَكَذَا لِلْأَبَدِ؟ أَمْ سَيَأْتِي يَوْمٌ وَيُقَرِّرُ أَنْ يَتَكَلَّمَ؟ الْحَقِيقَةُ ثَقِيلَةٌ. وَالصَّمْتُ أَثْقَلُ.
passages.translation: He saw what he should not have seen. Now they are looking for him. He changed his name. Changed his city. Changed his appearance. But fear doesn't change. Every knock on the door stops his heart. Every strange face raises his suspicion. Can he live like this forever? Or will a day come when he decides to speak? The truth is heavy. And silence is heavier.
passages.moralLesson: Witnessing wrongdoing creates an impossible choice: safety in silence or liberation through truth.
passages.moralLessonAr: مشاهدة الظلم تخلق خيارًا مستحيلًا: الأمان في الصمت أو التحرر من خلال الحقيقة.

passages.title: The Prisoner Exchange
passages.text: عَلَى الْجِسْرِ يَقِفُ الْفَرِيقَانِ. كُلٌّ مِنْهُمَا يَحْمِلُ رَهَائِنَ الْآخَرِ. التَّوَتُّرُ يَمْلَأُ الْهَوَاءَ. الْقَنَّاصُونَ يُرَاقِبُونَ مِنْ بَعِيدٍ. خُطْوَةٌ خَاطِئَةٌ وَيَسْقُطُ الْجَمِيعُ. يَبْدَأُ الْمَشْيُ. بَطِيءٌ. حَذِرٌ. كُلُّ ثَانِيَةٍ سَاعَةٌ. يَتَقَاطَعُونَ فِي الْمُنْتَصَفِ. نَظَرَاتٌ سَرِيعَةٌ. لَا كَلَامَ. ثُمَّ يُكْمِلُونَ. أَخِيرًا - كُلُّ فَرِيقٍ عَلَى جَانِبِهِ. الْيَوْمَ لَمْ يَمُتْ أَحَدٌ. غَدًا؟ اللهُ أَعْلَمُ.
passages.translation: On the bridge stand two teams. Each holds the other's hostages. Tension fills the air. Snipers watch from afar. One wrong step and everyone falls. The walking begins. Slow. Cautious. Every second is an hour. They cross paths in the middle. Quick glances. No words. Then they continue. Finally - each team on their side. Today no one died. Tomorrow? Allah knows best.
passages.moralLesson: Even enemies must sometimes cooperate. Prisoner exchanges require trust between those who have every reason not to trust.
passages.moralLessonAr: حتى الأعداء يجب أن يتعاونوا أحيانًا. تبادل الأسرى يتطلب ثقة بين أولئك الذين لديهم كل سبب لعدم الثقة.

passages.title: The Burned Operative
passages.text: انْكَشَفَتْ هُوِيَّتُهُ. الْآنَ كُلُّ الْعَالَمِ يَعْرِفُ وَجْهَهُ. لَا يَسْتَطِيعُ الْعَوْدَةَ إِلَى الْمَيْدَانِ أَبَدًا. سَنَوَاتٌ مِنَ التَّدْرِيبِ ضَاعَتْ. خِبْرَةٌ ثَمِينَةٌ أُهْدِرَتْ. مَاذَا يَفْعَلُ الْآنَ؟ يَجْلِسُ خَلْفَ مَكْتَبٍ؟ يُدَرِّبُ غَيْرَهُ؟ يَكْتُبُ مُذَكِّرَاتٍ لَنْ تُنْشَرَ؟ الرَّجُلُ الَّذِي عَاشَ فِي الظِّلَالِ لَا يَعْرِفُ كَيْفَ يَعِيشُ فِي الضَّوْءِ.
passages.translation: His identity was exposed. Now the whole world knows his face. He can never return to the field. Years of training wasted. Precious experience squandered. What does he do now? Sit behind a desk? Train others? Write memoirs that will never be published? The man who lived in shadows doesn't know how to live in the light.
passages.moralLesson: When an operative's cover is blown, they lose not just their mission but their entire way of life.
passages.moralLessonAr: عندما ينكشف غطاء العميل، يخسر ليس فقط مهمته بل أسلوب حياته بالكامل.

passages.title: The Mole Hunt
passages.text: هُنَاكَ خَائِنٌ بَيْنَنَا. الْمَعْلُومَاتُ تَتَسَرَّبُ. الْعَمَلِيَّاتُ تَفْشَلُ. الْعُمَلَاءُ يَخْتَفُونَ. بَدَأَ الْبَحْثُ. كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مَشْبُوهٌ. الصَّدِيقُ قَدْ يَكُونُ الْعَدُوَّ. الزَّمِيلُ الْمُخْلِصُ قَدْ يَكُونُ الْخَائِنَ. الثِّقَةُ تَتَآكَلُ. الشَّكُّ يَأْكُلُ الْفَرِيقَ مِنَ الدَّاخِلِ. هَذَا أَخْطَرُ مِنَ الْعَدُوِّ الْخَارِجِيِّ. الْعَدُوُّ الَّذِي تَعْرِفُهُ أَقَلُّ خَطَرًا مِنَ الصَّدِيقِ الَّذِي لَا تَعْرِفُهُ.
passages.translation: There is a traitor among us. Information is leaking. Operations are failing. Agents are disappearing. The search began. Everyone is suspected. A friend could be the enemy. A loyal colleague could be the traitor. Trust erodes. Suspicion devours the team from within. This is more dangerous than an external enemy. The enemy you know is less dangerous than the friend you don't.
passages.moralLesson: A traitor within destroys trust, which is harder to rebuild than any damaged operation.
passages.moralLessonAr: الخائن من الداخل يدمر الثقة، التي يصعب إعادة بنائها أكثر من أي عملية متضررة.

passages.title: The Night Raid
passages.text: السَّاعَةُ الثَّالِثَةُ صَبَاحًا. الْبَيْتُ هَادِئٌ. الْأَطْفَالُ نَائِمُونَ. فَجْأَةً - انْفِجَارُ الْبَابِ. صُرَاخٌ. أَضْوَاءٌ. جُنُودٌ فِي كُلِّ مَكَانٍ. الْأَبُ يُسْحَبُ مِنْ فِرَاشِهِ. الْأُمُّ تَصْرُخُ. الْأَطْفَالُ يَبْكُونَ. خَمْسُ دَقَائِقَ مِنَ الْفَوْضَى. ثُمَّ يَذْهَبُونَ. وَيَبْقَى الْبَيْتُ مُحَطَّمًا. وَالْعَائِلَةُ مَرْعُوبَةً. أَكَانَ هَذَا الرَّجُلُ مُجْرِمًا حَقًّا؟ أَمْ خَطَأً فِي الْعُنْوَانِ؟
passages.translation: Three o'clock in the morning. The house is quiet. The children are asleep. Suddenly - the door explodes. Screaming. Lights. Soldiers everywhere. The father is dragged from his bed. The mother screams. The children cry. Five minutes of chaos. Then they leave. And the house remains shattered. And the family terrified. Was this man truly a criminal? Or a mistake in the address?
passages.moralLesson: Security operations impact innocent families. The trauma of a raid remains long after the soldiers leave.
passages.moralLessonAr: العمليات الأمنية تؤثر على العائلات البريئة. صدمة المداهمة تبقى طويلًا بعد رحيل الجنود.

passages.title: The Peace Negotiator
passages.text: بَعْدَ سَنَوَاتٍ مِنَ الْقِتَالِ جَلَسَا عَلَى طَاوِلَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ. كُلٌّ مِنْهُمَا قَتَلَ أَبْنَاءَ الْآخَرِ. كُلٌّ مِنْهُمَا يَحْمِلُ جِرَاحًا لَا تَلْتَئِمُ. لَكِنَّهُمَا يَتَكَلَّمَانِ. لِأَنَّ الْبَدِيلَ أَسْوَأُ. مُفَاوَضَاتٌ صَعْبَةٌ. كَلِمَاتٌ مَوْزُونَةٌ. غَضَبٌ مَكْتُومٌ. أَحْيَانًا يَقُومُ أَحَدُهُمَا وَيُهَدِّدُ بِالْمُغَادَرَةِ. ثُمَّ يَعُودُ. لِأَنَّ الشُّعُوبَ تُرِيدُ السَّلَامَ. وَالْقَادَةُ يَجِبُ أَنْ يَسْمَعُوا. السَّلَامُ لَيْسَ نِسْيَانَ الْمَاضِي. بَلْ بِنَاءُ مُسْتَقْبَلٍ رَغْمَ الْمَاضِي.
passages.translation: After years of fighting, they sat at one table. Each killed the other's children. Each carries wounds that won't heal. But they talk. Because the alternative is worse. Difficult negotiations. Measured words. Suppressed anger. Sometimes one of them gets up and threatens to leave. Then returns. Because the peoples want peace. And the leaders must listen. Peace is not forgetting the past. But building a future despite the past.
passages.moralLesson: True peace requires sitting with those who caused your pain. It is not forgetting but choosing a different future.
passages.moralLessonAr: السلام الحقيقي يتطلب الجلوس مع أولئك الذين سببوا ألمك. ليس النسيان بل اختيار مستقبل مختلف.

passages.title: The Informant's Child
passages.text: يَعْرِفُ الطِّفْلُ أَنَّ أَبَاهُ مَكْرُوهٌ. الْأَوْلَادُ فِي الْمَدْرَسَةِ لَا يَلْعَبُونَ مَعَهُ. يَقُولُونَ: أَبُوكَ خَائِنٌ. يَبْكِي وَيَسْأَلُ أُمَّهُ: لِمَاذَا يَكْرَهُونَنَا؟ الْأُمُّ لَا تَعْرِفُ مَاذَا تَقُولُ. كَيْفَ تَشْرَحُ لَهُ أَنَّ أَبَاهُ يُحَاوِلُ إِنْقَاذَ أَرْوَاحٍ؟ أَوْ أَنَّهُ يَفْعَلُ مَا يَجِبُ فِعْلُهُ؟ الطِّفْلُ لَا يَفْهَمُ السِّيَاسَةَ. يَفْهَمُ فَقَطْ أَنَّهُ وَحِيدٌ.
passages.translation: The child knows his father is hated. The children at school don't play with him. They say: Your father is a traitor. He cries and asks his mother: Why do they hate us? The mother doesn't know what to say. How does she explain to him that his father is trying to save lives? Or that he is doing what must be done? The child doesn't understand politics. He only understands that he is alone.
passages.moralLesson: Children of informants carry burdens they cannot understand. The sins of the father fall upon innocent shoulders.
passages.moralLessonAr: أبناء المخبرين يحملون أعباءً لا يستطيعون فهمها. ذنوب الأب تقع على أكتاف بريئة.

passages.title: The Intelligence Failure
passages.text: كَانَتِ الْمَعْلُومَاتُ وَاضِحَةً. التَّحْذِيرَاتُ مُتَعَدِّدَةً. لَكِنْ لَمْ يَسْتَمِعْ أَحَدٌ. الْمَسْؤُولُونَ قَالُوا: مُسْتَحِيلٌ. هَذَا لَنْ يَحْدُثَ هُنَا. ثُمَّ حَدَثَ. الضَّحَايَا بِالْمِئَاتِ. وَالسُّؤَالُ الْآنَ: مَنِ الْمَسْؤُولُ؟ الْمُحَلِّلُ الَّذِي كَتَبَ التَّقْرِيرَ؟ الْمُدِيرُ الَّذِي أَهْمَلَهُ؟ السِّيَاسِيُّ الَّذِي لَمْ يُرِدْ سَمَاعَ الْحَقِيقَةِ؟ الْكُلُّ يَلُومُ الْآخَرَ. وَالضَّحَايَا لَا صَوْتَ لَهُمْ.
passages.translation: The information was clear. The warnings were multiple. But no one listened. Officials said: Impossible. This won't happen here. Then it happened. Victims by the hundreds. And the question now: Who is responsible? The analyst who wrote the report? The director who ignored it? The politician who didn't want to hear the truth? Everyone blames the other. And the victims have no voice.
grammaticalConcepts: لا + noun for negation (لا صوت لهم)
passages.moralLesson: Intelligence failures are rarely one person's fault. They reflect systemic breakdowns where warnings fall on deaf ears.
passages.moralLessonAr: الفشل الاستخباراتي نادرًا ما يكون خطأ شخص واحد. إنه يعكس انهيارات منهجية حيث تسقط التحذيرات على آذان صماء.

passages.title: The Returnee
passages.text: بَعْدَ عَشْرِ سَنَوَاتٍ فِي الْخَارِجِ عَادَ إِلَى وَطَنِهِ. لَكِنَّ الْوَطَنَ تَغَيَّرَ. وَهُوَ تَغَيَّرَ. الشَّوَارِعُ غَرِيبَةٌ. النَّاسُ غُرَبَاءُ. حَتَّى عَائِلَتُهُ لَا تَعْرِفُهُ. كَانَ شَابًّا حِينَ غَادَرَ. عَادَ رَجُلًا بِشَعْرٍ أَبْيَضَ وَعَيْنَيْنِ تَعِبَتَيْنِ. مَا الَّذِي رَآهُ هُنَاكَ؟ لَا أَحَدَ يَسْأَلُ. وَهُوَ لَا يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَتَذَكَّرَ.
passages.translation: After ten years abroad he returned to his homeland. But the homeland changed. And he changed. The streets are strange. The people are strangers. Even his family doesn't recognize him. He was young when he left. He returned a man with white hair and tired eyes. What did he see there? No one asks. And he doesn't want to remember.
passages.moralLesson: Those who leave for secret missions return as strangers. Time and experience create unbridgeable distances.
passages.moralLessonAr: الذين يغادرون في مهام سرية يعودون كغرباء. الزمن والتجربة يخلقان مسافات لا يمكن عبورها.

passages.title: The Moral Line
passages.text: قَالَ الضَّابِطُ لِلْمُجَنَّدِ الْجَدِيدِ: سَتَفْعَلُ أَشْيَاءَ لَا تَفْتَخِرُ بِهَا. سَتَكْذِبُ عَلَى مَنْ يَثِقُ بِكَ. سَتَخُونُ مَنْ يُحِبُّكَ. سَتُؤْذِي أَبْرِيَاءَ لِتَحْمِيَ آخَرِينَ. هَذَا لَيْسَ عَمَلًا لِأَصْحَابِ الضَّمَائِرِ الْحَسَّاسَةِ. كُلُّ عَمِيلٍ لَهُ خَطٌّ لَا يَتَجَاوَزُهُ. أَنْتَ سَتَكْتَشِفُ خَطَّكَ عِنْدَمَا تَصِلُ إِلَيْهِ. وَحِينَئِذٍ سَتَخْتَارُ: الْمُهِمَّةُ أَمِ الضَّمِيرُ؟ أَتَمَنَّى أَنْ تَخْتَارَ الصَّوَابَ. لَكِنْ لَا أَحَدَ يَعْرِفُ مَا هُوَ الصَّوَابُ حَتَّى تِلْكَ اللَّحْظَةِ.
passages.translation: The officer told the new recruit: You will do things you won't be proud of. You will lie to those who trust you. You will betray those who love you. You will hurt innocents to protect others. This is not work for those with sensitive consciences. Every agent has a line they won't cross. You will discover your line when you reach it. And then you will choose: the mission or the conscience? I hope you choose right. But no one knows what is right until that moment.
passages.moralLesson: Every person has moral limits they discover only when tested. The choice between mission and conscience defines who they truly are.
passages.moralLessonAr: كل شخص له حدود أخلاقية يكتشفها فقط عندما يُختبر. الاختيار بين المهمة والضمير يحدد من هو حقًا.

passages.title: The Proxy War: States Fighting Through Others
passages.titleAr: الْحَرْبُ بِالْوَكَالَةِ: دُوَلٌ تُقَاتِلُ بِأَيْدِي غَيْرِهَا
passages.text:
مِنْ أَخْطَرِ ظَوَاهِرِ الْعَصْرِ الْحَدِيثِ فِي الشَّرْقِ الْأَوْسَطِ مَا يُسَمَّى بِالْحَرْبِ بِالْوَكَالَةِ. وَهِيَ أَنْ تَدْعَمَ دَوْلَةٌ كُبْرَى جَمَاعَةً مُسَلَّحَةً فِي بَلَدٍ آخَرَ لِتُحَقِّقَ أَهْدَافَهَا دُونَ أَنْ تَتَوَرَّطَ مُبَاشَرَةً. فَالْقِتَالُ يَجْرِي عَلَى أَرْضِ الْغَيْرِ، وَالدَّمُ الْمُرَاقُ دَمُ الْغَيْرِ، وَالْمُدُنُ الْمُدَمَّرَةُ مُدُنُ الْغَيْرِ. أَمَّا الدَّوْلَةُ الدَّاعِمَةُ فَتَبْقَى فِي أَمَانٍ تُحَرِّكُ الْخُيُوطَ مِنْ بَعِيدٍ.

وَلَقَدْ شَهِدَتِ الْمِنْطَقَةُ عَشَرَاتِ الصِّرَاعَاتِ مِنْ هَذَا النَّوْعِ. تَتَنَافَسُ الْقُوَى الْإِقْلِيمِيَّةُ وَالدَّوْلِيَّةُ عَلَى النُّفُوذِ، وَتَسْتَخْدِمُ الْمِيلِيشْيَاتِ وَالْفَصَائِلَ الْمُسَلَّحَةَ أَدَوَاتٍ لِتَحْقِيقِ مَصَالِحِهَا. تُرْسِلُ السِّلَاحَ وَالْمَالَ وَالْمُسْتَشَارِينَ، وَتُقَدِّمُ الْغِطَاءَ السِّيَاسِيَّ وَالدِّبْلُومَاسِيَّ. وَفِي الْمُقَابِلِ، تَحْصُلُ عَلَى نُفُوذٍ وَأَوْرَاقِ ضَغْطٍ وَمَوْطِئِ قَدَمٍ اسْتِرَاتِيجِيٍّ.

وَالضَّحِيَّةُ الْأُولَى هُمُ الْمَدَنِيُّونَ الْأَبْرِيَاءُ الَّذِينَ وَجَدُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ فِي مَيْدَانِ مَعْرَكَةٍ لَيْسَتْ مَعْرَكَتَهُمْ. يَهْرُبُونَ مِنْ بُيُوتِهِمْ لَاجِئِينَ، وَيَفْقِدُونَ أَحْبَابَهُمْ وَمُسْتَقْبَلَهُمْ. وَالضَّحِيَّةُ الثَّانِيَةُ هِيَ الدَّوْلَةُ الْوَطَنِيَّةُ الَّتِي تَتَفَكَّكُ مُؤَسَّسَاتُهَا وَتَنْهَارُ سِيَادَتُهَا.

إِنَّ مَنْ يَظُنُّ أَنَّهُ يَرْبَحُ فِي هَذِهِ الْحُرُوبِ وَاهِمٌ. فَالْفَوْضَى تَمْتَدُّ، وَالْإِرْهَابُ يَنْتَشِرُ، وَالْأَحْقَادُ تَتَرَاكَمُ. وَمَا مِنْ دَوْلَةٍ بِمَنْأًى عَنْ عَوَاقِبِ الْفَوْضَى الَّتِي أَشْعَلَتْهَا. إِنَّ السَّلَامَ الْحَقِيقِيَّ لَا يَأْتِي إِلَّا بِاحْتِرَامِ سِيَادَةِ الدُّوَلِ وَوَقْفِ التَّدَخُّلِ فِي شُؤُونِهَا الدَّاخِلِيَّةِ.
passages.translation:
Among the most dangerous phenomena of the modern era in the Middle East is what is called proxy war. It is when a major power supports an armed group in another country to achieve its goals without becoming directly involved. The fighting takes place on others' land, the blood spilled is others' blood, and the cities destroyed are others' cities. As for the supporting state, it remains safe, pulling the strings from afar.

The region has witnessed dozens of such conflicts. Regional and international powers compete for influence, using militias and armed factions as tools to achieve their interests. They send weapons, money, and advisors, and provide political and diplomatic cover. In return, they gain influence, leverage, and strategic footholds.

The first victims are innocent civilians who find themselves in a battlefield that is not their battle. They flee their homes as refugees, losing their loved ones and their futures. The second victim is the nation-state whose institutions disintegrate and whose sovereignty collapses.

Whoever thinks they are winning in these wars is deluded. Chaos spreads, terrorism proliferates, and resentments accumulate. No state is immune from the consequences of the chaos it ignited. True peace comes only through respecting state sovereignty and ending interference in internal affairs.
grammaticalConcepts: ما من + indefinite for absolute negation
passages.moralLesson: Proxy wars destroy the lands where they are fought while those who wage them remain untouched. True victory requires building peace, not exporting chaos.
passages.moralLessonAr: الحروب بالوكالة تدمر الأراضي التي تُخاض فيها بينما يبقى من يشنونها بمنأى. النصر الحقيقي يتطلب بناء السلام لا تصدير الفوضى.

passages.title: The Intelligence War: Shadows Beneath the Surface
passages.text:
خَلْفَ كُلِّ خَبَرٍ سِيَاسِيٍّ تَقْرَأُهُ، وَخَلْفَ كُلِّ قَرَارٍ تَسْمَعُ بِهِ، حَرْبٌ خَفِيَّةٌ لَا تَرَاهَا الْأَعْيُنُ. إِنَّهَا حَرْبُ الِاسْتِخْبَارَاتِ - حَيْثُ تَتَصَارَعُ الدُّوَلُ فِي الظَّلَامِ بِأَدَوَاتِ الْمَعْلُومَةِ وَالتَّجْنِيدِ وَالِاخْتِرَاقِ وَالتَّضْلِيلِ. وَفِي الشَّرْقِ الْأَوْسَطِ، تَتَقَاطَعُ عَشَرَاتُ أَجْهِزَةِ الِاسْتِخْبَارَاتِ مِنْ كُلِّ أَنْحَاءِ الْعَالَمِ، كُلٌّ مِنْهَا يَسْعَى لِحِمَايَةِ مَصَالِحِ دَوْلَتِهِ.

الْمُوَسَادُ الْإِسْرَائِيلِيُّ يَعْمَلُ عَلَى اخْتِرَاقِ الْحَرَكَاتِ الْمُقَاوِمَةِ وَاغْتِيَالِ قَادَتِهَا. وَالسِّي آي إِيه تَبْنِي شَبَكَاتٍ مِنَ الْعُمَلَاءِ وَتُدِيرُ عَمَلِيَّاتٍ سِرِّيَّةً. وَالِاسْتِخْبَارَاتُ الرُّوسِيَّةُ تَسْعَى لِاسْتِعَادَةِ نُفُوذِهَا الْقَدِيمِ. وَأَجْهِزَةُ الدُّوَلِ الْإِقْلِيمِيَّةِ تَتَنَافَسُ وَتَتَعَاوَنُ وَتَتَخَاصَمُ فِيمَا بَيْنَهَا.

وَسِلَاحُ هَذِهِ الْحَرْبِ لَيْسَ الرَّصَاصَ فَحَسْبُ، بَلِ الْمَعْلُومَةُ أَوَّلًا وَأَخِيرًا. مَنْ يَمْلِكُ الْمَعْلُومَةَ يَمْلِكُ الْقُوَّةَ. وَمِنْ هُنَا تَأْتِي أَهَمِّيَّةُ التَّجَسُّسِ الْإِلِكْتُرُونِيِّ وَالتَّنَصُّتِ وَاخْتِرَاقِ الِاتِّصَالَاتِ. كُلُّ هَاتِفٍ قَدْ يَكُونُ مُرَاقَبًا، وَكُلُّ رِسَالَةٍ قَدْ تَكُونُ مَقْرُوءَةً.

وَأَخْطَرُ مَا فِي هَذِهِ الْحَرْبِ أَنَّهَا تُفْسِدُ الثِّقَةَ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ. يَبْدَأُ الْجَمِيعُ بِالشَّكِّ فِي الْجَمِيعِ. مَنِ الْعَمِيلُ؟ مَنِ الْمُخْبِرُ؟ مَنِ الْمُتَآمِرُ؟ وَتَنْتَشِرُ نَظَرِيَّاتُ الْمُؤَامَرَةِ حَتَّى يَعْجِزَ النَّاسُ عَنْ تَمْيِيزِ الْحَقِيقَةِ مِنَ الْوَهْمِ.

إِنَّ الدَّوْلَةَ الَّتِي لَا تَمْلِكُ جِهَازَ اسْتِخْبَارَاتٍ قَوِيًّا تَكُونُ عَمْيَاءَ أَمَامَ أَعْدَائِهَا. لَكِنَّ الدَّوْلَةَ الَّتِي تُحَوِّلُ جِهَازَهَا ضِدَّ شَعْبِهَا تَفْقِدُ شَرْعِيَّتَهَا. التَّوَازُنُ بَيْنَ الْأَمْنِ وَالْحُرِّيَّةِ هُوَ التَّحَدِّي الْأَكْبَرُ.
passages.translation:
Behind every political news story you read, and behind every decision you hear about, there is a hidden war invisible to the eyes. It is the intelligence war - where states battle in darkness using the tools of information, recruitment, infiltration, and disinformation. In the Middle East, dozens of intelligence agencies from around the world intersect, each seeking to protect its state's interests.

The Israeli Mossad works to infiltrate resistance movements and assassinate their leaders. The CIA builds networks of agents and runs covert operations. Russian intelligence seeks to restore its former influence. And the agencies of regional states compete, cooperate, and conflict among themselves.

The weapon of this war is not just bullets, but information first and last. Whoever possesses information possesses power. Hence the importance of electronic espionage, wiretapping, and communications infiltration. Every phone may be monitored, and every message may be read.

The most dangerous aspect of this war is that it corrupts trust among people. Everyone begins to suspect everyone. Who is the agent? Who is the informer? Who is the conspirator? Conspiracy theories spread until people cannot distinguish truth from illusion.

A state without a strong intelligence agency is blind before its enemies. But a state that turns its agency against its own people loses its legitimacy. The balance between security and freedom is the greatest challenge.
grammaticalConcepts: Form VI verbs (تتصارع، تتقاطع، تتنافس، تتعاون، تتخاصم)
أخطر ما في (the most dangerous thing about)
passages.moralLesson: Intelligence work is necessary for state security, but when it corrupts social trust or targets citizens, it becomes a poison that destroys the state from within.
passages.moralLessonAr: العمل الاستخباراتي ضروري لأمن الدولة، لكن عندما يُفسد الثقة الاجتماعية أو يستهدف المواطنين يصبح سُمًّا يدمر الدولة من الداخل.

passages.title: On the Nature of Political Deception
passages.text:
قَالَ الْحُكَمَاءُ قَدِيمًا: السِّيَاسَةُ فَنُّ الْمُمْكِنِ، وَأَقُولُ: هِيَ أَيْضًا فَنُّ الْإِيهَامِ. فَمَا مِنْ حَاكِمٍ عَبْرَ التَّارِيخِ اسْتَغْنَى عَنِ الْخِدَاعِ كُلِّيًّا. الْفَارِقُ بَيْنَ الْخِدَاعِ الْمَذْمُومِ وَالْخِدَاعِ الْمَقْبُولِ هُوَ الْهَدَفُ وَالنَّتِيجَةُ.

إِنَّ الْحَاكِمَ الَّذِي يُخْفِي عَنْ شَعْبِهِ أَخْبَارَ الْهَزِيمَةِ حَتَّى لَا يَنْهَارَ مَعْنَوِيًّا، ثُمَّ يَعْمَلُ سِرًّا لِإِصْلَاحِ الْوَضْعِ، لَيْسَ كَالْحَاكِمِ الَّذِي يَكْذِبُ عَلَى شَعْبِهِ لِيَسْرِقَهُ. الْأَوَّلُ يَخْدَعُ لِمَصْلَحَةِ الْمَخْدُوعِينَ، وَالثَّانِي يَخْدَعُ لِمَصْلَحَتِهِ هُوَ.

وَقَدْ عَرَفَ الْعَرَبُ هَذَا الْفَنَّ مُنْذُ الْقِدَمِ. الْحَرْبُ خُدْعَةٌ - كَمَا جَاءَ فِي الْحَدِيثِ. وَالْمُفَاوِضَاتُ تَتَطَلَّبُ إِخْفَاءَ بَعْضِ الْأَوْرَاقِ. وَالدِّبْلُومَاسِيَّةُ تَقُومُ عَلَى اخْتِيَارِ الْكَلِمَاتِ بِعِنَايَةٍ فَائِقَةٍ. لَكِنَّ هُنَاكَ فَرْقًا جَوْهَرِيًّا بَيْنَ التَّكْتِيكِ الذَّكِيِّ وَالْكَذِبِ الصَّرِيحِ.

الْحَاكِمُ الَّذِي يَفْقِدُ ثِقَةَ شَعْبِهِ يَفْقِدُ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ. قَالَ ابْنُ خَلْدُونٍ: الْمُلْكُ لَا يَقُومُ إِلَّا بِالْعَصَبِيَّةِ، وَالْعَصَبِيَّةُ لَا تَقُومُ إِلَّا بِالثِّقَةِ. فَإِذَا انْهَارَتِ الثِّقَةُ انْهَارَ الْمُلْكُ مَعَهَا. وَالْكَذِبُ الْمُتَكَرِّرُ يَهْدِمُ الثِّقَةَ لَبِنَةً لَبِنَةً.

وَفِي عَصْرِنَا، صَارَتِ الْمَعْلُومَةُ تَنْتَشِرُ بِسُرْعَةِ الْبَرْقِ. الْكَذِبَةُ الَّتِي كَانَتْ تَسْتَمِرُّ عُقُودًا قَدْ تَنْكَشِفُ فِي سَاعَاتٍ. لِذَا فَإِنَّ الْحَاكِمَ الْحَكِيمَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ الصِّدْقَ - وَإِنْ كَانَ مُؤْلِمًا أَحْيَانًا - أَسْلَمُ مِنَ الْكَذِبِ عَلَى الْمَدَى الطَّوِيلِ.
passages.translation:
The sages said of old: Politics is the art of the possible, and I say: it is also the art of illusion. No ruler throughout history has dispensed entirely with deception. The difference between blameworthy deception and acceptable deception is the goal and the outcome.

The ruler who hides news of defeat from his people so they do not collapse morally, then works secretly to remedy the situation, is not like the ruler who lies to his people to rob them. The first deceives for the benefit of the deceived, and the second deceives for his own benefit.

The Arabs knew this art since antiquity. War is deception - as stated in the hadith. Negotiations require concealing some cards. Diplomacy is based on choosing words with extreme care. But there is a fundamental difference between clever tactics and outright lying.

The ruler who loses his people's trust loses everything. Ibn Khaldun said: Sovereignty cannot stand except through asabiyyah (group solidarity), and asabiyyah cannot stand except through trust. If trust collapses, sovereignty collapses with it. And repeated lying demolishes trust brick by brick.

In our age, information spreads at the speed of lightning. A lie that used to last decades may be exposed in hours. Therefore, the wise ruler knows that truth - even when painful sometimes - is safer than lying in the long run.
grammaticalConcepts: إلا for exception (لا يقوم إلا بـ)
passages.moralLesson: Strategic discretion differs from malicious deception. The wise leader knows that trust is the foundation of power, and repeated lying destroys that foundation irreparably.
passages.moralLessonAr: التحفظ الاستراتيجي يختلف عن الخداع الخبيث. القائد الحكيم يعلم أن الثقة أساس السلطة، والكذب المتكرر يدمر ذلك الأساس بلا رجعة.

passages.title: The Great Powers and the Small States
passages.text:
مُنْذُ فَجْرِ التَّارِيخِ وَالدُّوَلُ الصَّغِيرَةُ تَتَرَاقَصُ بَيْنَ أَقْدَامِ الْعَمَالِقَةِ، تُحَاوِلُ الْبَقَاءَ دُونَ أَنْ تُسْحَقَ. وَالشَّرْقُ الْأَوْسَطُ مِنْ أَكْثَرِ الْمَنَاطِقِ الَّتِي شَهِدَتْ هَذَا الصِّرَاعَ، لِأَنَّهُ مُلْتَقَى الْقَارَّاتِ وَمَعْبَرُ التِّجَارَةِ وَخَزَّانُ الطَّاقَةِ.

فِي الْقَرْنِ الْعِشْرِينَ، تَنَافَسَتِ الْإِمْبِرَاطُورِيَّتَانِ الْبَرِيطَانِيَّةُ وَالْفَرَنْسِيَّةُ عَلَى تَقْسِيمِ الْمِنْطَقَةِ. ثُمَّ جَاءَتِ الْحَرْبُ الْبَارِدَةُ فَتَنَافَسَ الِاتِّحَادُ السُّوفْيِيتِيُّ وَأَمْرِيكَا. وَالْيَوْمَ نَشْهَدُ تَنَافُسًا جَدِيدًا بَيْنَ أَمْرِيكَا وَالصِّينِ وَرُوسْيَا، وَكُلٌّ يَسْعَى لِتَوْسِيعِ نُفُوذِهِ.

وَالدُّوَلُ الصَّغِيرَةُ تَقِفُ أَمَامَ خِيَارَاتٍ صَعْبَةٍ: هَلْ تَنْحَازُ لِقُوَّةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَتَكْسِبُ حِمَايَتَهَا لَكِنْ تَفْقِدُ اسْتِقْلَالَهَا؟ أَمْ تُحَاوِلُ التَّوَازُنَ بَيْنَ الْجَمِيعِ فَتُغْضِبُ الْجَمِيعَ؟ أَمْ تَبْقَى مُحَايِدَةً فَيَتَجَاهَلُهَا الْجَمِيعُ؟

التَّارِيخُ يُعَلِّمُنَا أَنَّ أَفْضَلَ اسْتِرَاتِيجِيَّةٍ هِيَ بِنَاءُ الْقُوَّةِ الذَّاتِيَّةِ. الدَّوْلَةُ الَّتِي تَمْلِكُ اقْتِصَادًا قَوِيًّا وَجَيْشًا مُقْتَدِرًا وَشَعْبًا مُوَحَّدًا تَسْتَطِيعُ أَنْ تُفَاوِضَ مِنْ مَوْقِعِ قُوَّةٍ. أَمَّا الدَّوْلَةُ الضَّعِيفَةُ فَمَصِيرُهَا أَنْ تَكُونَ وَرَقَةً فِي أَيْدِي الْآخَرِينَ.

وَالتَّارِيخُ يُعَلِّمُنَا أَيْضًا أَنَّ التَّحَالُفَاتِ تَتَغَيَّرُ. صَدِيقُ الْيَوْمِ قَدْ يَكُونُ عَدُوَّ الْغَدِ. لِذَا فَإِنَّ الِاعْتِمَادَ الْكُلِّيَّ عَلَى قُوَّةٍ خَارِجِيَّةٍ رِهَانٌ خَاسِرٌ. الْبَقَاءُ لِمَنْ يَبْنِي قُوَّتَهُ بِنَفْسِهِ.
passages.translation:
Since the dawn of history, small states have been dancing between the feet of giants, trying to survive without being crushed. The Middle East is among the regions that has witnessed this struggle most, because it is the meeting point of continents, the corridor of trade, and the reservoir of energy.

In the twentieth century, the British and French empires competed to divide the region. Then came the Cold War and the Soviet Union and America competed. Today we witness new competition between America, China, and Russia, each seeking to expand its influence.

Small states face difficult choices: Do they align with one power and gain its protection but lose their independence? Or try to balance between all and anger all? Or remain neutral and be ignored by all?

History teaches us that the best strategy is building self-reliance. The state that possesses a strong economy, a capable army, and a unified people can negotiate from a position of strength. As for the weak state, its fate is to be a card in others' hands.

History also teaches us that alliances change. Today's friend may be tomorrow's enemy. Therefore, total dependence on an external power is a losing bet. Survival belongs to those who build their own strength.
grammaticalConcepts: منذ فجر التاريخ (since the dawn of history)
البقاء لمن (survival belongs to those who)
passages.moralLesson: Small states survive by building internal strength, not by depending on external protectors. Alliances shift, but self-reliance endures.
passages.moralLessonAr: الدول الصغيرة تبقى ببناء قوتها الداخلية لا بالاعتماد على حماة خارجيين. التحالفات تتغير لكن الاعتماد على الذات يدوم.

passages.title: The Art of Strategic Patience
passages.text:
قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي طَالِبٍ: الصَّبْرُ صَبْرَانِ - صَبْرٌ عَلَى مَا تَكْرَهُ وَصَبْرٌ عَمَّا تُحِبُّ. وَفِي السِّيَاسَةِ، الصَّبْرُ الثَّانِي أَصْعَبُ. أَنْ تَمْلِكَ الْقُدْرَةَ عَلَى الضَّرْبِ لَكِنْ تَخْتَارَ الِانْتِظَارَ - هَذَا هُوَ الصَّبْرُ الِاسْتِرَاتِيجِيُّ.

كَثِيرٌ مِنَ الْقَادَةِ يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ النَّتَائِجَ. يُرِيدُونَ النَّصْرَ الْآنَ، الْحَلَّ الْفَوْرِيَّ، الضَّرْبَةَ الْحَاسِمَةَ. لَكِنَّ السِّيَاسَةَ لَيْسَتْ مُبَارَاةً تَنْتَهِي فِي تِسْعِينَ دَقِيقَةً. إِنَّهَا مَاراثُونٌ يَمْتَدُّ عُقُودًا وَأَجْيَالًا. مَنْ يَرْكُضْ سَرِيعًا فِي الْبِدَايَةِ قَدْ يَنْهَارُ قَبْلَ خَطِّ النِّهَايَةِ.

وَانْظُرْ إِلَى التَّارِيخِ: كَمْ مِنْ دَوْلَةٍ تَسَرَّعَتْ فِي الْحَرْبِ فَخَسِرَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ؟ وَكَمْ مِنْ حَرَكَةٍ صَبَرَتْ عُقُودًا حَتَّى حَقَّقَتْ أَهْدَافَهَا؟ الْقُوَّةُ وَحْدَهَا لَا تَكْفِي - يَجِبُ أَنْ تُسْتَخْدَمَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الْمُنَاسِبِ.

الصَّبْرُ الِاسْتِرَاتِيجِيُّ لَا يَعْنِي السَّلْبِيَّةَ. بَلْ يَعْنِي الِاسْتِعْدَادَ وَالتَّخْطِيطَ وَبِنَاءَ الْقُوَّةِ أَثْنَاءَ الِانْتِظَارِ. يَعْنِي مُرَاقَبَةَ الْعَدُوِّ وَانْتِظَارَ لَحْظَةِ ضَعْفِهِ. يَعْنِي تَجَنُّبَ الِاسْتِفْزَازَاتِ الَّتِي تَدْفَعُكَ إِلَى رَدِّ فِعْلٍ غَيْرِ مَدْرُوسٍ.

وَالصَّبْرُ أَيْضًا يَحْتَاجُ إِلَى شَجَاعَةٍ. شَجَاعَةُ أَنْ تَتَحَمَّلَ الِانْتِقَادَاتِ مِمَّنْ يُرِيدُونَ الْفِعْلَ الْفَوْرِيَّ. شَجَاعَةُ أَنْ تَقُولَ: لَيْسَ الْآنَ، وَقْتُنَا سَيَأْتِي. الْقَائِدُ الَّذِي يَصْمُدُ أَمَامَ ضَغْطِ الْحَمَاسَةِ الْعَمْيَاءِ يَسْتَحِقُّ الِاحْتِرَامَ أَكْثَرَ مِمَّنْ يَنْسَاقُ مَعَهَا.
passages.translation:
The Commander of the Faithful Ali ibn Abi Talib said: Patience is of two kinds - patience with what you hate and patience from what you love. In politics, the second patience is harder. To possess the ability to strike but choose to wait - this is strategic patience.

Many leaders rush for results. They want victory now, the immediate solution, the decisive blow. But politics is not a match that ends in ninety minutes. It is a marathon extending decades and generations. Whoever runs fast at the beginning may collapse before the finish line.

Look at history: How many states rushed into war and lost everything? How many movements waited decades until they achieved their goals? Power alone is not enough - it must be used at the right time.

Strategic patience does not mean passivity. Rather, it means preparation, planning, and building strength while waiting. It means watching the enemy and waiting for the moment of his weakness. It means avoiding provocations that push you toward an unconsidered reaction.

Patience also requires courage. The courage to bear criticisms from those who want immediate action. The courage to say: Not now, our time will come. The leader who stands firm against the pressure of blind enthusiasm deserves more respect than one who is swept along with it.
grammaticalConcepts: صبران - صبر على...وصبر عن (two types structure)
لا يعني...بل يعني (does not mean...rather means)
passages.moralLesson: Strategic patience is not weakness but wisdom. True strength lies in knowing when to act, not in reacting to every provocation.
passages.moralLessonAr: الصبر الاستراتيجي ليس ضعفًا بل حكمة. القوة الحقيقية تكمن في معرفة متى تتصرف لا في الرد على كل استفزاز.

passages.title: On Information Warfare in the Modern Age
passages.titleAr: فِي حَرْبِ الْمَعْلُومَاتِ فِي الْعَصْرِ الْحَدِيثِ
passages.text:
فِي الْمَاضِي، كَانَتِ الْحُرُوبُ تُحْسَمُ بِالسَّيْفِ وَالْمِدْفَعِ. أَمَّا الْيَوْمَ، فَقَدْ ظَهَرَتْ جَبْهَةٌ جَدِيدَةٌ لَا تَقِلُّ خُطُورَةً: جَبْهَةُ الْمَعْلُومَاتِ. مَنْ يَتَحَكَّمُ فِيمَا يَعْرِفُهُ النَّاسُ وَمَا يُصَدِّقُونَهُ يَتَحَكَّمُ فِي سُلُوكِهِمْ وَقَرَارَاتِهِمْ.

تَنْتَشِرُ الْأَخْبَارُ الْكَاذِبَةُ عَبْرَ وَسَائِلِ التَّوَاصُلِ الِاجْتِمَاعِيِّ كَالنَّارِ فِي الْهَشِيمِ. يَصْنَعُ الْمُتَلَاعِبُونَ فِيدْيُوهَاتٍ مُزَيَّفَةً وَصُوَرًا مُعَدَّلَةً وَتَقَارِيرَ مَلْفَقَةً. يَخْتَلِقُونَ حَوَادِثَ لَمْ تَقَعْ وَيُنْكِرُونَ وَقَائِعَ حَدَثَتْ فِعْلًا. الْحَقِيقَةُ تَغْرَقُ فِي بَحْرٍ مِنَ الْأَكَاذِيبِ.

وَالدُّوَلُ تَسْتَخْدِمُ هَذَا السِّلَاحَ ضِدَّ بَعْضِهَا. تُنْشِئُ جُيُوشًا مِنَ الْحِسَابَاتِ الْوَهْمِيَّةِ لِنَشْرِ الْفِتْنَةِ فِي بُلْدَانٍ أُخْرَى. تُمَوِّلُ وَسَائِلَ إِعْلَامٍ تَبْدُو مُسْتَقِلَّةً لَكِنَّهَا تَخْدِمُ أَجِنْدَتِهَا. تَخْتَرِقُ أَنْظِمَةَ الْمَعْلُومَاتِ لِتَسْرِقَ الْأَسْرَارَ أَوْ تُعَطِّلَهَا.

وَالْمُوَاطِنُ الْعَادِيُّ يَقِفُ حَائِرًا: كَيْفَ أُمَيِّزُ الصَّادِقَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِ؟ كَيْفَ أَعْرِفُ مَا إِذَا كَانَتْ هَذِهِ الصُّورَةُ حَقِيقِيَّةً أَوْ مُفَبْرَكَةً؟ وَهُنَا تَكْمُنُ الْخُطُورَةُ: حِينَ يَفْقِدُ النَّاسُ الثِّقَةَ فِي كُلِّ شَيْءٍ، يُصْبِحُونَ عَاجِزِينَ عَنِ اتِّخَاذِ قَرَارَاتٍ رَشِيدَةٍ.

الدِّفَاعُ ضِدَّ حَرْبِ الْمَعْلُومَاتِ يَتَطَلَّبُ التَّعْلِيمَ وَالتَّفْكِيرَ النَّقْدِيَّ وَوَسَائِلَ إِعْلَامٍ مَوْثُوقَةً. لَكِنَّ الْأَهَمَّ هُوَ أَنْ نُدْرِكَ أَنَّنَا فِي حَرْبٍ، وَأَنَّ كُلَّ خَبَرٍ يَصِلُنَا قَدْ يَكُونُ سِلَاحًا مُوَجَّهًا.
passages.translation:
In the past, wars were decided by sword and cannon. But today, a new front has emerged no less dangerous: the information front. Whoever controls what people know and believe controls their behavior and decisions.

False news spreads through social media like wildfire. Manipulators create fake videos, altered images, and fabricated reports. They invent incidents that never occurred and deny events that actually happened. Truth drowns in a sea of lies.

States use this weapon against each other. They create armies of fake accounts to spread discord in other countries. They fund media outlets that appear independent but serve their agendas. They hack information systems to steal secrets or disrupt them.

The ordinary citizen stands confused: How do I distinguish the truthful from the false? How do I know if this image is real or fabricated? Here lies the danger: when people lose trust in everything, they become incapable of making rational decisions.

Defense against information warfare requires education, critical thinking, and trustworthy media. But most important is to realize that we are at war, and that every piece of news reaching us may be a directed weapon.
grammaticalConcepts: في الماضي...أما اليوم (past vs. present contrast)
الأهم هو أن (most important is that)

vocabularyHighlights.meaning: like wildfire (lit. fire in dry sticks)

passages.moralLesson: In the age of information warfare, the ability to think critically and verify sources is a form of self-defense. Awareness of manipulation is the first line of resistance.
passages.moralLessonAr: في عصر حرب المعلومات، القدرة على التفكير النقدي والتحقق من المصادر شكل من أشكال الدفاع عن النفس. الوعي بالتلاعب هو خط المقاومة الأول.

passages.title: The Assassin's Calculus: Ethics of Targeted Killing
passages.text:
حِينَ تَقْرِرُ دَوْلَةٌ اغْتِيَالَ قَائِدٍ عَدُوٍّ، تَدْخُلُ فِي حِسَابَاتٍ مُعَقَّدَةٍ تَتَجَاوَزُ مُجَرَّدَ الْقُدْرَةِ عَلَى التَّنْفِيذِ. هَلْ سَتَتَحَقَّقُ الْأَهْدَافُ الْمَرْجُوَّةُ؟ مَا الثَّمَنُ؟ وَهَلِ الْفِعْلُ أَخْلَاقِيٌّ أَصْلًا؟

يَقُولُ الْمُؤَيِّدُونَ: الِاغْتِيَالُ الْمُوَجَّهُ أَقَلُّ دَمَارًا مِنَ الْحَرْبِ الشَّامِلَةِ. قَتْلُ قَائِدٍ وَاحِدٍ يُنْقِذُ أَرْوَاحَ الْآلَافِ. لِمَاذَا نُدَمِّرُ جَيْشًا كَامِلًا إِذَا اسْتَطَعْنَا قَطْعَ الرَّأْسِ؟ الْحَرْبُ قَذِرَةٌ بِطَبِيعَتِهَا، فَلِمَاذَا نَتَظَاهَرُ بِالنَّظَافَةِ؟

وَيَرُدُّ الْمُعَارِضُونَ: الِاغْتِيَالُ يَفْتَحُ بَابًا لَا يُغْلَقُ. إِذَا اغْتَالَتْ دَوْلَةٌ قَادَةَ أَعْدَائِهَا، فَمَا الَّذِي يَمْنَعُ أَعْدَاءَهَا مِنْ فِعْلِ الْمِثْلِ؟ تَتَحَوَّلُ السِّيَاسَةُ الدَّوْلِيَّةُ إِلَى غَابَةٍ يَقْتُلُ فِيهَا الْجَمِيعُ الْجَمِيعَ. ثُمَّ إِنَّ الْقَتْلَ نَادِرًا مَا يُنْهِي الْمُشْكِلَةَ - الْقَائِدُ الْمَقْتُولُ يُصْبِحُ شَهِيدًا وَتَظْهَرُ قِيَادَةٌ أَشَدُّ تَطَرُّفًا.

وَهُنَاكَ الْبُعْدُ الْأَخْلَاقِيُّ الْعَمِيقُ: هَلْ لِلدَّوْلَةِ الْحَقُّ فِي أَنْ تَكُونَ قَاضِيًا وَجَلَّادًا فِي آنٍ وَاحِدٍ؟ مَنِ الَّذِي يُقَرِّرُ مَنْ يَسْتَحِقُّ الْمَوْتَ؟ وَمَاذَا عَنِ الْأَبْرِيَاءِ الَّذِينَ يَسْقُطُونَ ضَحَايَا جَانِبِيِّينَ؟

التَّارِيخُ لَا يُعْطِي إِجَابَاتٍ سَهْلَةً. بَعْضُ الِاغْتِيَالَاتِ غَيَّرَتْ مَجْرَى التَّارِيخِ، وَبَعْضُهَا أَشْعَلَ حُرُوبًا أَشَدَّ. الْحِكْمَةُ تَقْتَضِي التَّفْكِيرَ مَلِيًّا قَبْلَ اللُّجُوءِ إِلَى هَذَا الْخِيَارِ.
passages.translation:
When a state decides to assassinate an enemy leader, it enters into complex calculations that go beyond mere ability to execute. Will the desired goals be achieved? What is the price? And is the act even ethical?

Supporters say: Targeted assassination is less destructive than total war. Killing one leader saves the lives of thousands. Why destroy an entire army if we can cut off the head? War is dirty by nature, so why pretend to be clean?

Opponents respond: Assassination opens a door that cannot be closed. If a state assassinates its enemies' leaders, what prevents its enemies from doing the same? International politics becomes a jungle where everyone kills everyone. Moreover, killing rarely ends the problem - the killed leader becomes a martyr and more extremist leadership emerges.

There is a deep ethical dimension: Does the state have the right to be judge and executioner at once? Who decides who deserves death? And what about the innocents who fall as collateral damage?

History gives no easy answers. Some assassinations changed the course of history, others ignited worse wars. Wisdom requires thinking deeply before resorting to this option.
passages.moralLesson: The ethics of targeted killing remain contested. What seems like surgical precision may create uncontrollable consequences and moral precedents that haunt the future.
passages.moralLessonAr: أخلاقيات القتل الموجه تبقى موضع خلاف. ما يبدو دقة جراحية قد يخلق عواقب لا يمكن السيطرة عليها وسوابق أخلاقية تطارد المستقبل.

passages.title: The Collapse of States: Lessons from Modern History
passages.titleAr: انْهِيَارُ الدُّوَلِ: دُرُوسٌ مِنَ التَّارِيخِ الْحَدِيثِ
passages.text:
شَهِدَ الشَّرْقُ الْأَوْسَطُ فِي الْعُقُودِ الْأَخِيرَةِ انْهِيَارَ عِدَّةِ دُوَلٍ كَانَتْ تُعَدُّ مُسْتَقِرَّةً. الْعِرَاقُ بَعْدَ الْغَزْوِ، وَسُورْيَا بَعْدَ الثَّوْرَةِ، وَلِيبْيَا بَعْدَ سُقُوطِ الْقَذَّافِي، وَالْيَمَنُ فِي حَرْبِهِ الْأَهْلِيَّةِ. كُلُّ هَذِهِ نَمَاذِجُ لِمَا يَحْدُثُ حِينَ تَتَفَكَّكُ مُؤَسَّسَاتُ الدَّوْلَةِ.

الدَّرْسُ الْأَوَّلُ: سُهُولَةُ الْهَدْمِ وَصُعُوبَةُ الْبِنَاءِ. إِسْقَاطُ نِظَامٍ قَدْ يَسْتَغْرِقُ أَسَابِيعَ، لَكِنَّ بِنَاءَ بَدِيلٍ يَسْتَغْرِقُ عُقُودًا. مَنْ يَهْدِمُ بَيْتًا عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَسْأَلَ: أَيْنَ سَيَسْكُنُ السُّكَّانُ؟

الدَّرْسُ الثَّانِي: الْفَرَاغُ لَا يَدُومُ. حِينَ تَسْقُطُ الدَّوْلَةُ تَنْدَفِعُ قُوًى مُتَعَدِّدَةٌ لِمَلْءِ الْفَرَاغِ - مِيلِيشْيَاتٌ وَتَنْظِيمَاتٌ إِرْهَابِيَّةٌ وَقُوًى إِقْلِيمِيَّةٌ وَدَوْلِيَّةٌ. النَّتِيجَةُ فَوْضَى مُسْتَدَامَةٌ.

الدَّرْسُ الثَّالِثُ: الْهُوِيَّاتُ الْمَكْبُوتَةُ تَنْفَجِرُ. الدَّوْلَةُ الْقَوِيَّةُ كَانَتْ تَكْبِتُ الصِّرَاعَاتِ الطَّائِفِيَّةَ وَالْعِرْقِيَّةَ. بِسُقُوطِهَا تَظْهَرُ هَذِهِ الصِّرَاعَاتُ بِعُنْفٍ مُضَاعَفٍ.

الدَّرْسُ الرَّابِعُ: الشَّعْبُ يَدْفَعُ الثَّمَنَ. لَيْسَ الْقَادَةُ وَلَا الْمُتَدَخِّلُونَ الْخَارِجِيُّونَ، بَلِ النِّسَاءُ وَالْأَطْفَالُ وَالْمُسِنُّونَ. يَمُوتُونَ جُوعًا وَمَرَضًا وَقَصْفًا، وَيُشَرَّدُونَ مِنْ دِيَارِهِمْ.

الدَّرْسُ الْخَامِسُ: إِعَادَةُ الْبِنَاءِ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى مُصَالَحَةٍ. لَا يَكْفِي وَقْفُ إِطْلَاقِ النَّارِ - يَجِبُ مُعَالَجَةُ الْجِرَاحِ وَإِعَادَةُ بِنَاءِ الثِّقَةِ. وَهَذَا أَصْعَبُ بِكَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْحَرْبِ نَفْسِهَا.
passages.translation:
The Middle East in recent decades has witnessed the collapse of several states that were considered stable. Iraq after the invasion, Syria after the revolution, Libya after Gaddafi's fall, and Yemen in its civil war. All these are examples of what happens when state institutions disintegrate.

The first lesson: Demolition is easy, building is hard. Toppling a regime may take weeks, but building a replacement takes decades. Whoever demolishes a house must ask: Where will the residents live?

The second lesson: A vacuum does not last. When the state falls, multiple forces rush to fill the vacuum - militias, terrorist organizations, and regional and international powers. The result is sustained chaos.

The third lesson: Suppressed identities explode. The strong state was suppressing sectarian and ethnic conflicts. With its fall, these conflicts emerge with multiplied violence.

The fourth lesson: The people pay the price. Not the leaders nor the external interveners, but women, children, and the elderly. They die of hunger, disease, and bombardment, and are displaced from their homes.

The fifth lesson: Rebuilding requires reconciliation. Ceasefire is not enough - wounds must be treated and trust rebuilt. And this is far harder than the war itself.
grammaticalConcepts: لما يحدث حين (for what happens when)
passages.moralLesson: State collapse teaches that destruction is easy but reconstruction is generations of work. Those who would tear down systems must have plans for what comes after.
passages.moralLessonAr: انهيار الدول يُعلّم أن الهدم سهل لكن إعادة البناء عمل أجيال. من يريد هدم الأنظمة يجب أن يكون لديه خطط لما بعدها.

passages.title: On the Balance of Terror
passages.text:
مِنْ أَغْرَبِ مُفَارَقَاتِ الْعَصْرِ الْحَدِيثِ أَنَّ السَّلَامَ بَيْنَ الْقُوَى الْكُبْرَى قَامَ عَلَى الْخَوْفِ لَا عَلَى الْمَحَبَّةِ. سُمِّيَ هَذَا بِـ"تَوَازُنِ الرُّعْبِ" - حَيْثُ لَا يُهَاجِمُ أَحَدٌ لِأَنَّ الْجَمِيعَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ الرَّدَّ سَيَكُونُ مُدَمِّرًا.

فِي الْحَرْبِ الْبَارِدَةِ، امْتَلَكَتْ أَمْرِيكَا وَالِاتِّحَادُ السُّوفْيِيتِيُّ أَسْلِحَةً نَوَوِيَّةً كَافِيَةً لِتَدْمِيرِ الْعَالَمِ عِدَّةَ مَرَّاتٍ. لَكِنَّ هَذِهِ الْقُدْرَةَ الْمُرْعِبَةَ هِيَ الَّتِي مَنَعَتِ الْحَرْبَ. كُلُّ طَرَفٍ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ الضَّرْبَةَ الْأُولَى سَتَجْلِبُ ضَرْبَةً أَخِيرَةً لَنْ يَنْجُوَ مِنْهَا أَحَدٌ. سَمَّوْهُ "الدَّمَارَ الْمُتَبَادَلَ الْمُؤَكَّدَ".

وَالْيَوْمَ يَنْطَبِقُ الْمَبْدَأُ نَفْسُهُ عَلَى صِرَاعَاتٍ إِقْلِيمِيَّةٍ فِي الشَّرْقِ الْأَوْسَطِ. دُوَلٌ تَمْلِكُ صَوَارِيخَ قَادِرَةً عَلَى تَدْمِيرِ عَوَاصِمَ أَعْدَائِهَا، لَكِنَّهَا تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ الرَّدَّ سَيَكُونُ مُمَاثِلًا. فَيَسُودُ سَلَامٌ هَشٌّ قَائِمٌ عَلَى الْخَوْفِ الْمُتَبَادَلِ.

لَكِنَّ تَوَازُنَ الرُّعْبِ لَهُ ثَمَنٌ بَاهِظٌ. أَوَّلًا: الْمَوَارِدُ الضَّخْمَةُ الَّتِي تُنْفَقُ عَلَى التَّسْلِيحِ بَدَلًا مِنَ التَّنْمِيَةِ. ثَانِيًا: خَطَرُ الْحَادِثِ أَوِ الْخَطَأِ الَّذِي يُشْعِلُ حَرْبًا لَا يُرِيدُهَا أَحَدٌ. ثَالِثًا: السِّبَاقُ اللَّانِهَائِيُّ - كُلُّ طَرَفٍ يُطَوِّرُ أَسْلِحَتَهُ فَيَضْطَرُّ الْآخَرُ لِلتَّطْوِيرِ.

إِنَّ السَّلَامَ الْحَقِيقِيَّ لَا يُبْنَى عَلَى الْخَوْفِ بَلْ عَلَى الْعَدَالَةِ. الرُّعْبُ يَمْنَعُ الْحَرْبَ مُؤَقَّتًا، لَكِنَّهُ لَا يَصْنَعُ سَلَامًا دَائِمًا.
passages.translation:
Among the strangest paradoxes of the modern age is that peace between major powers was built on fear, not love. This was called 'balance of terror' - where no one attacks because everyone knows the response will be devastating.

During the Cold War, America and the Soviet Union possessed nuclear weapons sufficient to destroy the world several times over. But this terrifying capability is what prevented war. Each side knew that the first strike would bring a final strike from which no one would survive. They called it 'mutually assured destruction.'

Today, the same principle applies to regional conflicts in the Middle East. States possess missiles capable of destroying their enemies' capitals, but they know the response will be equivalent. So a fragile peace prevails based on mutual fear.

But the balance of terror has a heavy price. First: the enormous resources spent on armament instead of development. Second: the danger of an accident or error that ignites a war no one wants. Third: the endless race - each side develops its weapons so the other must also develop.

True peace is not built on fear but on justice. Terror prevents war temporarily, but it does not create lasting peace.
grammaticalConcepts: سُمّي هذا بـ (passive - this was called)
passages.moralLesson: Peace based on fear is unstable and costly. While deterrence may prevent war, only justice and mutual respect can create lasting peace between nations.
passages.moralLessonAr: السلام القائم على الخوف غير مستقر ومُكلف. بينما الردع قد يمنع الحرب، فإن العدالة والاحترام المتبادل وحدهما يمكنهما خلق سلام دائم بين الأمم.

passages.title: The Art of Reading Enemies
passages.text:
قَالَ الْحُكَمَاءُ: اعْرِفْ عَدُوَّكَ كَمَا تَعْرِفُ نَفْسَكَ. وَفِي عَالَمِ الِاسْتِخْبَارَاتِ وَالسِّيَاسَةِ، هَذِهِ الْمَعْرِفَةُ فَنٌّ دَقِيقٌ يُسَمَّى "تَحْلِيلَ الْخَصْمِ". لَيْسَ الْمَقْصُودُ مَعْرِفَةَ قُوَّتِهِ الْعَسْكَرِيَّةِ فَحَسْبُ، بَلْ فَهْمَ كَيْفَ يُفَكِّرُ وَمَاذَا يُرِيدُ وَمَا الَّذِي يَخَافُهُ.

الْقَائِدُ الَّذِي يَفْهَمُ عَدُوَّهُ يَسْتَطِيعُ تَوَقُّعَ تَحَرُّكَاتِهِ. يَعْرِفُ مَتَى سَيَتَرَاجَعُ وَمَتَى سَيُصَعِّدُ. يَفْهَمُ خُطُوطَهُ الْحَمْرَاءَ فَلَا يَدْفَعُهُ إِلَى زَاوِيَةٍ لَا مَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا. وَيَعْرِفُ نِقَاطَ ضَعْفِهِ فَيَسْتَغِلُّهَا عِنْدَ الْحَاجَةِ.

وَمِنْ أَخْطَرِ الْأَخْطَاءِ أَنْ تُسْقِطَ تَفْكِيرَكَ عَلَى عَدُوِّكَ. أَنْ تَفْتَرِضَ أَنَّهُ سَيَتَصَرَّفُ كَمَا تَتَصَرَّفُ أَنْتَ. كُلُّ ثَقَافَةٍ لَهَا مَنْطِقُهَا، وَكُلُّ قَائِدٍ لَهُ شَخْصِيَّتُهُ. الْأَمْرِيكِيُّ لَا يُفَكِّرُ كَالْإِيرَانِيِّ، وَالْإِسْرَائِيلِيُّ لَا يُفَكِّرُ كَالْعَرَبِيِّ. فَهْمُ هَذِهِ الْفُرُوقِ ضَرُورِيٌّ لِتَجَنُّبِ سُوءِ التَّقْدِيرِ.

وَالْقِرَاءَةُ الْجَيِّدَةُ لِلْعَدُوِّ تَتَطَلَّبُ مَصَادِرَ مُتَعَدِّدَةً: الِاسْتِخْبَارَاتُ تُوَفِّرُ الْمَعْلُومَاتِ الْخَامَّ، وَالْمُحَلِّلُونَ يُفَسِّرُونَهَا، وَالدِّبْلُومَاسِيُّونَ يُضِيفُونَ فَهْمًا لِلسِّيَاقِ، وَالْأَكَادِيمِيُّونَ يُقَدِّمُونَ الْعُمْقَ التَّارِيخِيَّ وَالثَّقَافِيَّ.

لَكِنِ احْذَرْ: الْإِفْرَاطُ فِي التَّحْلِيلِ قَدْ يُؤَدِّي إِلَى الشَّلَلِ. أَحْيَانًا تَعْرِفُ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَنْ عَدُوِّكَ لَكِنْ تَعْجِزُ عَنِ اتِّخَاذِ قَرَارٍ. الْحِكْمَةُ فِي التَّوَازُنِ بَيْنَ الْمَعْرِفَةِ وَالْفِعْلِ.
passages.translation:
The sages said: Know your enemy as you know yourself. In the world of intelligence and politics, this knowledge is a precise art called 'adversary analysis.' The goal is not just knowing his military strength, but understanding how he thinks, what he wants, and what he fears.

The leader who understands his enemy can anticipate his movements. He knows when he will retreat and when he will escalate. He understands his red lines so he doesn't push him into a corner with no exit. And he knows his weak points to exploit when needed.

Among the most dangerous errors is projecting your thinking onto your enemy. Assuming he will act as you would act. Every culture has its logic, and every leader has his personality. The American does not think like the Iranian, and the Israeli does not think like the Arab. Understanding these differences is necessary to avoid miscalculation.

Good reading of the enemy requires multiple sources: intelligence provides raw information, analysts interpret it, diplomats add contextual understanding, and academics provide historical and cultural depth.

But beware: excessive analysis can lead to paralysis. Sometimes you know everything about your enemy but cannot make a decision. Wisdom lies in balancing knowledge and action.
grammaticalConcepts: استفهام غير مباشر (ماذا يريد، ما الذي يخافه)
لا + verb for negation with كـ comparison
passages.moralLesson: Understanding your adversary is essential for strategic success, but this understanding must lead to action. Analysis without decision is as dangerous as action without analysis.
passages.moralLessonAr: فهم خصمك ضروري للنجاح الاستراتيجي، لكن هذا الفهم يجب أن يؤدي إلى عمل. التحليل بدون قرار خطير كالعمل بدون تحليل.
